story:
BONUS: Listen to 5 of 10 new songs from the upcoming album 'Action Figures' by clicking -------> HERE!!!!!

WHAT'S THE DEAL?!

Well, Superdivorce formed in 2015 on the heels of the breakup of a band called Sleep Star Ignition (RIP). After Sleep Star closed up shop, three of us from that group decided to continue playing together for fun.

Initially it was me (Villars) on bass, Bender on drums, and our former guitarist, Bob Tallman just getting together once a week and jamming around in my basement. We jokingly agreed to refer to our three man experimental project as 'Superdivorce' until one of us came up with a permanent name.

After some time, however, we realized none of us actually wanted to let go of 'Superdivorce', and so it stuck.

In the summer of 2015 we added a bass player called Dale Hupke and I moved to vocals exclusively. We wrote 10 songs over the course of a few months and recorded the first Superdivorce album 'Wish Ya The Best' in the late autumn of 2015.

WYTB was released in early 2016 and we played a handful of shows around that time. Unfortunately, shortly after the album's release we experienced a hefty dose of band-related turmoil that left the roster cut in half.

By the end of June 2016, our four-piece post-hardcore band had become a duo with an uncertain future. 

So...

Bender and I decided to move forward as a two-piece synthpop project.

Why?

Well, not only are we both suckers for 80s nostalgia of many different flavors, but this is actually the kind of music I've had a mind to create for years!

Though I've been playing in fairly aggressive rock bands for the past 15 years, I mostly listen to new wave and 80s pop music. It's the first music I remember from my childhood. Born in 85, I'm talking very early memories. It's awesome to explore that influence and let it shine through in a big way. 

It was a blast writing these songs. It was even more fun going into the studio to see them transform and blossom into the feast of an album that this turned out to be. Our producer, Josh Schroeder, did a world class job helping us make this vision a reality. 

Please look forward to 'Action Figures' and place your pre-order today!

 

SUPERDIVORCE?!

  • Villars and Bender respectively.
  • Former four-piece post-hardcore band that experienced a major lineup crisis and became a two-piece synthpop powerhouse.
  • Those who preorder will have the chance to guarantee themselves a copy of this synthpop juggernaut, Action Figures, in several different amazing formats!

         -Blue vinyl record!

        -Blue cassette tape!

        -Compact disc with deluxe 12 page booklet

 

ALL ITEMS ARE BEING OFFERED AT A DISCOUNTED PREORDER PRICE!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

*Upon completion of preorder period, prices will be as follows:

Digital Album - $10

CD - $15

Cassette - $20

Vinyl - $25

Tee - $20

story:
To all who don't know me as a person, My name is Terrance Anthony Banks. I am a 31 year old soon to be father. I perform music under the artist name of Soultru, I perform a mix of Soul with Hip-Hop influences while telling my story such as being shelter in my Mothers household and learning of her Schizophrenia and Bipolar Disorders as well as things like lost love and overcoming many personal hurdles.  

This Indiegogo campaign is important because all of the extra money we would have for tour purposes will be going towards the expected baby that my girlfriend Jessica and I are expecting. With your help my friend Colton and I can still head out west for our July tour dates which are all confirmed. In cities such as Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Denver and a few other stops along the way. Below is a link to something we recorded recently while walking the streets of Chicago the night after a show.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=swBA2K40a2M

The amount I am asking for is to help cover gas costs since we will be driving the full tour to and from the Quad Cities. Any and every contribution is truly appreciated and that's why I will be sending out hand written thank you letters to each and everyone of you.

I'm estimating with all of our traveling 700 dollars would be what we would use roughly in gas. Which would get us to Seattle down the coast and back up to Iowa when it's all said and done. We would still be coming out of pocket for a few hotels and eating purposes but for the most part we will be staying with friends in these major cities. What I am able to offer you in return for your donations are a few merch packages full of stickers, buttons, handwritten thank you letters, unreleased tracks as well as a new tour shirt design. Regardless of if we reach our ultimate goal of 700 dollars we will take what we raise put it in the tank and roll with the punches. Hoping to sell merch to get us the rest of the way at the first few gigs and go from there. Below is a link of our last show in Des Moines finishing off our last tour together.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-vdVXT_oh_k

 

Your contribution to this campaign would make a huge difference in the grand scheme of where my music goes past this year. With this tour it allows me to get myself in front of tones of new fans because the majority of the dates are through Sofar Sounds, which is a company that hosts intimate stripped back music session in over 400 cities across the globe. Each show we make some guaranteed money and play in front of no less than 50 new fans which in turn helps me to get my name out there even further and allows me to continue to pursue my dream of making a living off of my music. I truly believe god placed me on this earth with the gifts I have to tell my story, to sing my song and to help others who need it.

I'm banking on this to work because without your help tour may not be possible, this is the last tour I will be able to go on seeing that the baby is due Late Sept-Early Oct. as well work is allowing me time off to pursue music. I drive for Fed-Ex as my day job so Fall-Winter cripples me from doing much outside of my area and staying consistent in the music industry is a huge aspect of it. The older I become the more challenges I face as an artist but one thing is that I will never give up on my dream even if I never reach my goal of being a professional everyday musician but at the end of the day no matter what happens at least I tried, I've already done some amazing things but I feel like the best is yet to come. Thank you for your love and support.

story:
Over a year in the making 'Tree of Life' is one of the few all harp guitar albums ever made, possibly the first ever conceptual harp guitar record to date taking the listener on an incredible journey of love, life and loss.

Two pre-release videos from 'Tree of Life'.

 

'Tree of Life' contains eleven (11) original pieces recorded at ultra high 96k/24bit resolution- all recorded, mixed and mastered by myself at my Tree of Life Recording Studio.

The music business being what it is today, streaming music payments do not provide anywhere near the amount of money needed for a project of this scope and scale, so I am asking you, to get involved and either pre-order 'Tree of Life' or take an even larger role and receive additional rewards, in return for being an integral part of the project.

Sean de Burca has created extensive custom artwork for each song in 'Tree of Life' that will be included in the digipak and with early downloads. You can also pre-order signed CDs, posters, tab sets, Skype lessons, album credits, house concerts and even studio time with me are all available - your contributions will go towards the physical release, artwork and printed materials to make this project come to life!

Please join me on this journey to release 'Tree of Life' in early 2017. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand money can be tight. Whether or not contributing to the campaign is feasible, there are other ways you can be a valuable part of my project.  Help me spread the word about this campaign by sharing the link, telling your friends, and thereby ultimately assisting me in reaching my goal! 

"As I was listening to him play (at the Harp Guitar Gathering), I thought to myself that along with the newer style techniques he's clearly got going on, Alex is one of the most melodic of the new crop of harp guitarists.  While I sat there thinking that to myself, the stage manager leaned over and whispered essentially the same words to me." -Stephen Bennett

"Through both his recordings and performances, Alex impressed me with his consummate touch, intricate, multi-layered percussive arrangements, and nice bits of melody sprinkled throughout" -Gregg Miner

story:
[ Versione italiana a fondo pagina ]

Hi friends !!!

We are The Black Rain and we are here on Indiegogo asking you to support our project.

Moved by our common passion for music, last year we recorded and published our debut album “Night Tales”. The results greatly exceeded our expectations: a huge confirmation in terms of public that forced us to reprint the CD and excellent reviews by the critics. The number of fans increased, the audience attending our concerts got larger and larger and all this gave us the chance to perform also in France and in Greece where we have been hosted in the most popular TV show “Radio Arvila”.

These amazing experiences strengthened our enthusiasm and our will to keep playing music.

We have new songs for our new album, but now more than ever we need your help to make it. Together we can.

What we are asking for is to help us face the costs for recording, mixing, mastering, artwork and printing of our second CD whose release is foreseen in spring 2014.

Do ut des, Latins said. Every donation will have in return a reward that we hope will repay you for the help you are giving us.

We have a dream. Please help us making it real. 

Thanks for your attention.


Who we are

Everything started in Bologna in 2002 but we will have to wait until 2010 to reach our final line-up: Mirko Greco (voice), Eugenio Bonifazi (guitars), Marco Molteni (bass) and Raffaele Marchesini (drums).

Rock has just a few formulas and some secret ingredient for sure. Ours is composed by powerful rhythmics, distorted guitars and a touch of blues. This combination in just a few years increased more and more the number of fans that attend our concerts. Due to this success, in 2011 we decided to concentrate on composing new songs that will be included in our debut album “Night Tales”. 

The CD, that since the very start received a warm welcome both from the public and the critics, was followed by a promotional tour that took us in France and that made us win the participation in the main show of Greece, hosted by the most popular TV channel .

If you should attend one of our concerts remember that “ No one should get out without his dose of ROCK!!! "


Perks


[ENG] We’ve been thinking about a series of rewards for each donation we will receive. There is not any additional shipping cost and each donor will be thanked publicly. This is what you can have in return for your support:

[ ITA ] Abbiamo pensato ad una serie di ricompense per ogni donazione ricevuta. Non ci sono spese aggiuntive per la spedizione ed ogni donatore verrà ringraziato pubblicamente. Ecco cosa potete ricevere in cambio del vostro supporto:


[ENG] Digital Download Perk - To start !!! With 3 USD we’ll send you a link you can use to download 3 songs of our album one week before the official CD release.

[ ITA ] Digital Download Perk – Per cominciare !!! Con 3 $ ti verrà inviato un link tramite il quale potrai scaricare 3 brani dell'album una settimana prima dell’uscita ufficiale del cd.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


[ENG] Friend Perk - Downlad Mania!!! With 10 USD we’ll send you a link you can use to download the entire CD two weeks before the official CD release !!

[ ITA ] Friend Perk – Download Mania !!! Con 10 $ ti verrà inviato un link dal quale potrai scaricare l’intero cd due settimane prima dell’uscita ufficiale !!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



[ENG] Supporter Perk - Physical, let’s get physical !!! With 15 USD we’ll send you a physical copy of the CD one week before the official release !!!

[ ITA ] Supporter Perk – Physical, let’s get physical !!! Con 15 $ ti invieremo il CD fisico una settimana prima dell’uscita ufficiale !!!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[ENG] Fan Perk - An official fan !!!  With 30 USD we will send you one physical CD and The Black Rain T-shirt one week before the official CD release

[ ITA ] Fan Perk – Un fan ufficiale !!! Con 30 $ ti invieremo il cd fisico e la maglietta dei The Black Rain una settimana prima dell’uscita ufficiale del CD

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[ ENG] Big Fan Perk - Let’s start taking it seriously! With 50 USD you’ll receive one physical CD, The Black Rain T-shirt, our first CD “Night Tales”, one autographed and inscribed poster and, above all, your name will appear within the official thanks inside the CD.

[ ITA ] Big Fan Perk - Iniziamo a fare sul serio? Con 50 $ riceverai il CD fisico, la maglietta dei The Black Rain, il nostro primo CD “Night Tales”,  un poster autografato con dedica, e soprattutto, il tuo nome apparirà nei ringraziamenti ufficiali all’interno del CD.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[ENG] Huge Fan Perk - It’s getting interesting. Just 75 USD to receive home, with no extra costs: one physical CD, The Black Rain T-Shirt, our first CD “Night Tales”, one autographed and inscribed poster, your name written within the official thanks inside the CD and a copybook with the new handwritten lyrics.

[ ITA ] Huge Fan Perk - La cosa si fa interessante. Solo 75 $ per avere a casa tua, senza spese aggiuntive: il CD fisico, la maglietta dei The Black Rain, il nostro primo CD “Night Tales”, un poster autografato con dedica, il tuo nome scritto nei ringraziamenti ufficiali all’interno del CD e un quaderno con i nuovi testi scritti a mano.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[ENG] With All Our Love Perk - That’s Love !!! With 125 USD you won’t just receive one physical CD, The Black Rain T-Shirt, our first CD “Night Tales”, one autographed and inscribed poster, your name written within the official thanks inside the CD  and a copybook with the new handwritten lyrics…..but also an autographed kick drum skin and an unpublished CD containing some of our songs in unplugged version. An offer you can't miss !!!

[ ITA ] With All Our Love Perk - Questo è amore !!! con 125 $ non solo ricevai il CD fisico, la maglietta dei The Black Rain, il nostro primo CD “Night Tales”, un poster autografato con dedica, il tuo nome scritto nei ringraziamenti ufficiali all’interno del CD e un quaderno con i nuovi testi scritti a mano…ma aggiungeremo a tutto ciò anche una pelle della gran cassa autografata e un CD inedito contenente alcuni nostri brani rivisitati in chiave unplugged. Solo per voi. Un’offerta imperdibile !!!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[ENG] With All Our Love And Petting Perk - We love you, it’s official now! And as it’s a mutual love we’re talking about, with 200 USD with no extra costs, you’ll receive home, with all our love, one physical CD, The Black Rain T-Shirt, our first CD “Night Tales”, one autographed and inscribed poster, your name written within the official thanks inside the CD, a copybook with the new handwritten lyrics, an autographed kick drum skin, an unpublished CD containing some of our songs in unplugged version as well as….. a 30 minutes acoustic live via Skype!!!!

[ ITA ] With All Our Love And Petting Perk - E’ ufficiale, ti amiamo ! E siccome l’amore è reciproco, con 200 $ senza spese aggiungive, con tutto il nostro amore  avrai a casa tua il CD fisico, la maglietta dei The Black Rain, il nostro primo CD “Night Tales”, un poster autografato con dedica, il tuo nome scritto nei ringraziamenti ufficiali all’interno del CD, un quaderno con i nuovi testi scritti a mano, una pelle della gran cassa autografata, un CD inedito contenente alcuni nostri brani rivisitati in chiave unlugged nonchè ... (rullo di tamburi)... un concerto acustico via Skype della durata di 30 minuti !!!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[ENG] With All Our Love, Sex & Rock’n’Roll Perk - A whole day as a real rocker !!! You really deserve it ! You are tough and we esteem you very much. You just donated 350 USD and you’ll have in return: one physical CD, The Black Rain T-Shirt, our first CD “Night Tales”, one autographed and inscribed poster, your name written within the official thanks inside the CD, a copybook with the new handwritten lyrics, an autographed kick drum skin, an unpublished CD containing some of our songs in unplugged version, a 30 minutes acoustic live via Skype and….. a real photoshoot with the members of the band and a session of portrait photography taken by a real professional photographer. And as it will be a long long day, after we will go out to have a drink !!!

[ ITA] With All Our Love, Sex & Rock’n’Roll Perk - Una giornata da vero Rocker !!! Te lo meriti… davvero ! Sei un duro e hai tutta la nostra stima. Hai appena donato 350 $ e in cambio avrai : il CD fisico, la maglietta dei The Black Rain, il nostro primo CD “Night Tales”, un poster autografato con dedica, il tuo nome scritto nei ringraziamenti ufficiali all’interno del CD, un quaderno con i nuovi testi scritti a mano, una pelle della gran cassa autografata, un CD inedito contenente alcuni nostri brani rivisitati in chiave unplugged, un concerto acustico via Skype della durata di 30 minuti e… un vero servizio fotografico con tutti i componenti della band e una sessione di ritratto fotografico eseguito da una vera fotografa professionista. E poiché sarà stata una lunga giornata, dopo andremo a bere qualcosa assieme !!!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[ENG] Just For One Perk - The one and only. Ok, we’ve reached the top, you’re one of us. With 500 USD you’ll be the only one who’ll have one physical CD, The Black Rain T-Shirt, our first CD “Night Tales”, one autographed and inscribed poster, a copybook with the new handwritten lyrics,  an autographed kick drum skin, an unpublished CD containing some of our songs in unplugged version, a 30 minutes acoustic live via Skype, a real photoshoot with the members of the band and a session of portrait photography taken by a real professional photographer, one photobook with the photos shot together with the band, 10 photos to be printed size 20x30, one videoclip in which we officially thank you, your name will be mentioned as “executive producer” inside the CD on sale and… if you can play an instrument or you can sing we’ll invite you on stage during one of our concerts !!!

[ ITA ] Just For One Perk  - L’unico, il solo, il numero 1. Ok, siamo al top, oramai sei uno di noi. Con 500 $ sarai l’unica persona che avrà il CD fisico, la maglietta dei The Black Rain, il nostro primo CD “Night Tales”, un poster autografato con dedica, un quaderno con i nuovi testi scritti a mano, una pelle della gran cassa autografata, un CD inedito contenente alcuni nostri brani rivisitati in chiave acustica, un concerto acustico via Skype della durata di 30 minuti, un vero servizio fotografico con tutti i componenti della band e una sessione di ritratto fotografico eseguito da una vera fotografa professionista, un fotolibro contenente gli scatti con la band, 10 fotografie stampate in formato 20x30 a tua scelta fra quelle scattatate, un videoclip di ringraziamento ufficiale, il tuo nome menzionato come “executive producer” nel cd in commercio… e se sai suonare uno strumento oppure cantare, ti inviteremo sul palco durante uno dei nostri live !!! 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Versione Italiana


Ciao a tutti, siamo i The Black Rain e siamo qui su indiegogo per chiedervi di supportare il nostro progetto.

Spinti dall’amore che ci accomuna verso la musica, lo scorso anno abbiamo registrato e pubblicato il nostro primo album “Night Tales”. I risultati hanno di gran lunga superato le nostre aspettative: un grande riscontro da parte del pubblico che ci ha portato a ristampare il cd e ottime recensioni da parte della critica di settore. I fan sono cresciuti, il pubblico presente ai live è aumentato e tutto questo ci ha dato la possibilità di esibirci anche in Francia e in Grecia dove siamo stati ospitati nella più popolare trasmissione televisiva ellenica “Radio Arvila”.

Queste splendide esperienze hanno alimentato il nostro entusiasmo e la voglia di continuare a fare musica.

Abbiamo tutto il materiale per il nuovo album, ma abbiamo bisogno ora più che mai del vostro aiuto per farcela. Insieme possiamo.

Quello che vi chiediamo è di aiutarci a sostenere le spese per la registrazione, il mixaggio, la masterizzazione, la realizzazione grafica e la stampa del nostro secondo cd la cui uscita è prevista per la primavera 2014.

Do ut des dicevano i latini. Ad ogni donazione corrisponderà una ricompensa che speriamo possa ripagarvi per l’aiuto che ci state dando. 

Abbiamo un sogno. Aiutateci a realizzarlo ! Grazie per la vostra attenzione.


Chi Siamo 

Tutto inizia a Bologna nel 2002 ma occorrerà attendere fino al 2010 per giungere alla formazione definitiva: Mirko Greco alla voce, Eugenio Bonifazi alla chitarra, Marco Molteni al basso e Raffaele Marchesini alla batteria.

Il rock ha poche formule, e di sicuro qualche ingrediente segreto. La nostra è fatta di potenti ritmiche, chitarre distorte e un tocco di blues. Questa combinazione nell’arco di pochi anni ha aumentato sempre più il numero di fans che seguono i nostri live. Visto il successo ottenuto, nel 2011 decidiamo di concentrarci nella composizione di nuovi brani che entreranno a far parte nel nostro album d’esordio “Night Tales”.

Al CD, che ha ricevuto sin da subito un ottimo riscontro sia dal pubblico che dalla stampa di settore, è seguito un tour promozionale che ci ha visti approdare in Francia e che ci ha fatto guadagnare la partecipazione alla trasmissione di punta del primo canale televisivo per share in Grecia.

Se doveste mai capitare ad un nostro show, sappiate che nessuno di voi andrà via senza aver preso la propria dose di rock.


The Black Rain on Soundcloud


The Black Rain on Reverbnation


The Black Rain Facebook Page

Moved by our common
passion for music, last year we recorded and published our debut album “Night
Tales”. The results greatly exceeded our expectations: a huge confirmation in
terms of public that forced us to reprint the CD and excellent reviews by the critics. The number of fans
increased, the audience attending our concerts got larger and larger and all
this gave us the chance to perform also in France and in Greece where we have
been hosted in the most popular TV show “Radio Arvila”.
These amazing experiences strengthened our enthusiasm and our will to keep playing music.
We have new songs for our new album, but now more than ever we need your help to make
it. Together we can.
What we are asking
for is to help us face the costs for recording, mixing, mastering, artwork and
printing of our second CD whose release is foreseen in spring 2014.
Do ut des, Latins
said. Every donation will have in return a reward that we hope will repay you
for the help you are giving us. 
We have a dream.
Please help us making it real. 
Thanks for your attention.



Who we are

Everything started in Bologna in 2002 but we will have to
wait until 2010 to reach our final line-up: Mirko Greco (voice), Eugenio
Bonifazi (guitars), Marco Molteni (bass) and Raffaele Marchesini (drums).
Rock has just a few
formulas and some secret ingredient for sure. Ours is composed by powerful
rhythmics, distorted guitars and a touch of blues. This combination in just a
few years increased more and more the number of fans that attend our concerts.
Due to this success, in 2011 we decided to concentrate on composing new songs
that will be included in our debut album “Night Tales”. 

The CD, that since
the very start received a warm welcome both from the public and the critics, was followed by a
promotional tour that took us in France and that made us win the participation
in the main show of Greece, hosted by the most popular TV channel .
If you should attend
one of our concerts remember that “ No one should get out without his dose of
ROCK!!! "




Perks


[ENG] We’ve been thinking
about a series of rewards for each donation we will receive. There is not any
additional shipping cost and each donor will be thanked publicly. This is what
you can have in return for your support:
[ ITA ] Abbiamo pensato ad una serie di ricompense per ogni
donazione ricevuta. Non ci sono spese aggiuntive per la spedizione ed ogni
donatore verrà ringraziato pubblicamente. Ecco cosa potete ricevere in cambio
del vostro supporto:



[ENG] Digital Download Perk - To start !!! With 3 USD we’ll send you a link you
can use to download 3 songs of our album one week before the official CD release.

[ ITA ] Digital Download Perk – Per cominciare !!! Con 3 $ ti
verrà inviato un link tramite il quale potrai scaricare 3 brani dell'album una settimana
prima dell’uscita ufficiale del cd.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------




[ENG] Friend Perk - Downlad Mania!!! With 10 USD we’ll send you a link you can use to download the entire CD two weeks before the official CD release !!
[ ITA ] Friend Perk – Download Mania !!! Con 10 $ ti verrà
inviato un link dal quale potrai scaricare l’intero cd due settimane prima dell’uscita ufficiale !!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[ENG] Supporter Perk - Physical, let’s get
physical !!! With 15 USD we’ll send you
a physical copy of the CD one week before the official release !!!
[ ITA ] Supporter Perk – Physical, let’s get physical !!! Con 15 $ ti invieremo il CD fisico una settimana prima dell’uscita ufficiale !!!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ENG] Fan Perk - An official fan !!!  With 30 USD we will send you one physical CD and
The Black Rain T-shirt one week before the official CD release
[ ITA ] Fan Perk – Un fan ufficiale !!! Con 30 $ ti invieremo il
cd fisico e la maglietta dei The Black Rain una settimana prima dell’uscita
ufficiale del CD
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ ENG] Big Fan Perk - Let’s start taking it
seriously! With 50 USD you’ll receive one physical CD, The Black Rain T-shirt,
our first CD “Night Tales”, one autographed and inscribed poster and, above
all, your name will appear within the official thanks inside the CD.
[ ITA ] Big Fan Perk - Iniziamo a fare sul serio? Con 50 $ riceverai il CD fisico, la maglietta
dei The Black Rain, il nostro primo CD “Night Tales”,  un poster autografato con dedica, e
soprattutto, il tuo nome apparirà nei ringraziamenti ufficiali all’interno del
CD.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ENG] Huge Fan Perk - It’s getting interesting. Just 75 USD to receive home, with no extra costs:
one physical CD, The Black Rain T-Shirt, our first CD “Night Tales”, one
autographed and inscribed poster, your name written within the official thanks
inside the CD and a copybook with the new
handwritten lyrics.
[ ITA ] Huge Fan Perk - La cosa si fa interessante. Solo 75 $ per avere a casa
tua, senza spese aggiuntive: il CD fisico, la maglietta dei The Black Rain, il
nostro primo CD “Night Tales”, un poster autografato con dedica, il tuo nome
scritto nei ringraziamenti ufficiali all’interno del CD e un quaderno con i
nuovi testi scritti a mano.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ENG] With All Our Love Perk - That’s Love !!! With 125 USD
you won’t just receive one physical CD, The Black Rain T-Shirt, our first CD
“Night Tales”, one autographed and inscribed poster, your name written within
the official thanks inside the CD  and a
copybook with the new handwritten lyrics…..but also an autographed kick drum
skin and an unpublished CD containing some of our songs in unplugged version. An offer you can't miss !!!
[ ITA ] With All Our Love Perk - Questo è amore !!! con 125 $ non solo ricevai il CD
fisico, la maglietta dei The Black Rain, il nostro primo CD “Night Tales”, un
poster autografato con dedica, il tuo nome scritto nei ringraziamenti ufficiali
all’interno del CD e un quaderno con i nuovi testi scritti a mano…ma
aggiungeremo a tutto ciò anche una pelle della gran cassa autografata e un CD inedito contenente alcuni nostri brani
rivisitati in chiave unplugged. Solo
per voi. Un’offerta imperdibile !!!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[ENG] With All Our Love And Petting Perk - We love you, it’s
official now! And as it’s a mutual love we’re talking about, with 200 USD with
no extra costs, you’ll receive home, with all our love, one physical CD, The Black Rain T-Shirt, our first CD “Night Tales”, one autographed and
inscribed poster, your name written within the official thanks inside the CD, a
copybook with the new handwritten lyrics, an autographed kick drum skin, an unpublished
CD containing some of our songs in unplugged version as well as….. a 30
minutes acoustic live via Skype!!!!
[ ITA ] With All Our Love And Petting Perk - E’ ufficiale, ti
amiamo ! E siccome l’amore è reciproco, con 200 $ senza spese
aggiungive, con tutto il nostro amore 
avrai a casa tua il CD fisico, la maglietta dei The Black Rain, il
nostro primo CD “Night Tales”, un poster autografato con dedica, il tuo nome
scritto nei ringraziamenti ufficiali all’interno del CD, un quaderno con i
nuovi testi scritti a mano, una pelle della gran cassa autografata, un CD
inedito contenente alcuni nostri brani rivisitati in chiave unlugged nonchè ... (rullo di tamburi)... un concerto acustico via Skype della durata di 30 minuti !!!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ENG] With All Our Love, Sex & Rock’n’Roll Perk - A whole day as a real
rocker !!! You really deserve it ! You are tough and we esteem you very much. You
just donated 350 USD and you’ll have in return: one physical CD, The Black Rain
T-Shirt, our first CD “Night Tales”, one autographed and inscribed poster, your
name written within the official thanks inside the CD, a copybook with the new
handwritten lyrics, an autographed kick
drum skin, an unpublished CD containing some of our songs in unplugged version, a 30 minutes acoustic live via Skype and….. a real photoshoot with the
members of the band and a session of portrait photography taken by a real professional photographer. And
as it will be a long long day, after we will go out to have a drink !!!
[ ITA] With All Our Love, Sex & Rock’n’Roll Perk - Una giornata da vero Rocker !!! Te lo meriti… davvero ! Sei un duro e hai tutta la nostra
stima. Hai appena donato 350 $ e in cambio avrai : il CD fisico, la maglietta
dei The Black Rain, il nostro primo CD “Night Tales”, un poster autografato con
dedica, il tuo nome scritto nei ringraziamenti ufficiali all’interno del CD, un
quaderno con i nuovi testi scritti a mano, una pelle della gran cassa
autografata, un CD inedito contenente alcuni nostri brani rivisitati in chiave
unplugged, un concerto acustico via Skype della durata di 30 minuti e… un vero
servizio fotografico con tutti i componenti della band e una sessione di
ritratto fotografico eseguito da una vera fotografa professionista. E poiché
sarà stata una lunga giornata, dopo andremo a bere qualcosa assieme !!!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ENG] Just For One Perk - The one and only. Ok, we’ve reached the
top, you’re one of us. With 500 USD you’ll be the only one who’ll have one
physical CD, The Black Rain T-Shirt, our first CD “Night Tales”, one
autographed and inscribed poster, a copybook with the new handwritten lyrics,  an autographed kick drum skin, an unpublished
CD containing some of our songs in unplugged version, a 30 minutes
acoustic live via Skype, a real photoshoot with the members of the band and a
session of portrait photography taken by
a real professional photographer, one photobook with the photos shot together
with the band, 10 photos to be printed size 20x30, one videoclip in which we
officially thank you, your name will be mentioned as “executive producer”
inside the CD on sale and… if you can play an instrument or you can sing we’ll invite you on stage
during one of our concerts !!!
[ ITA ] Just For One Perk  - L’unico, il solo, il numero 1. Ok, siamo al top, oramai sei uno di noi. Con 500 $ sarai
l’unica persona che avrà il CD fisico, la maglietta dei The Black Rain, il
nostro primo CD “Night Tales”, un poster autografato con dedica, un quaderno
con i nuovi testi scritti a mano, una pelle della gran cassa autografata, un CD
inedito contenente alcuni nostri brani rivisitati in chiave acustica, un
concerto acustico via Skype della durata di 30 minuti, un vero servizio
fotografico con tutti i componenti della band e una sessione di ritratto
fotografico eseguito da una vera fotografa professionista, un fotolibro
contenente gli scatti con la band, 10 fotografie stampate in formato 20x30 a
tua scelta fra quelle scattatate, un videoclip di ringraziamento ufficiale, il
tuo nome menzionato come “executive
producer” nel cd in commercio… e se sai suonare uno strumento oppure
cantare, ti inviteremo sul palco durante uno dei nostri live !!! 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Versione Italiana


Ciao a tutti, siamo i The Black Rain e siamo qui su
indiegogo per chiedervi di supportare il nostro progetto.
Spinti dall’amore che ci accomuna verso la musica, lo
scorso anno abbiamo registrato e pubblicato il nostro primo album “Night Tales”.
I risultati hanno di gran lunga superato le nostre aspettative: un grande
riscontro da parte del pubblico che ci ha portato a ristampare il cd e ottime
recensioni da parte della critica di
settore. I fan sono cresciuti, il pubblico presente ai live è aumentato e tutto
questo ci ha dato la possibilità di esibirci anche in Francia e in Grecia dove
siamo stati ospitati nella più popolare trasmissione televisiva ellenica “Radio
Arvila”.
Queste splendide esperienze hanno alimentato il nostro
entusiasmo e la voglia di continuare a fare musica. 
Abbiamo tutto il materiale per il nuovo album, ma abbiamo
bisogno ora più che mai del vostro aiuto per farcela. Insieme possiamo.
Quello che vi chiediamo è di aiutarci a sostenere le
spese per la registrazione, il mixaggio, la masterizzazione, la realizzazione
grafica e la stampa del nostro secondo cd la cui uscita è prevista per la
primavera 2014.
Do ut des dicevano i latini. Ad ogni donazione
corrisponderà una ricompensa che speriamo possa ripagarvi per l’aiuto che ci
state dando. 
Abbiamo un sogno. Aiutateci a realizzarlo ! Grazie per la vostra attenzione.

Chi Siamo 

Tutto inizia a Bologna nel 2002 ma occorrerà attendere
fino al 2010 per giungere alla formazione definitiva: Mirko Greco alla voce,
Eugenio Bonifazi alla chitarra, Marco Molteni al basso e Raffaele Marchesini
alla batteria.
Il rock ha poche formule, e di sicuro qualche ingrediente
segreto. La nostra è fatta di potenti ritmiche, chitarre distorte e un tocco di
blues. Questa combinazione nell’arco di pochi anni ha aumentato sempre più il
numero di fans che seguono i nostri live. Visto il successo ottenuto, nel 2011
decidiamo di concentrarci nella composizione di nuovi brani che entreranno a
far parte nel nostro album d’esordio “Night Tales”. 
Al CD, che ha ricevuto sin da subito un ottimo riscontro
sia dal pubblico che dalla stampa di settore, è seguito un tour promozionale
che ci ha visti approdare in Francia e che ci ha fatto guadagnare la
partecipazione alla trasmissione di punta del primo canale televisivo per share
in Grecia.
Se doveste mai capitare ad un nostro show, sappiate che
nessuno di voi andrà via senza aver preso la propria dose di rock.

The Black Rain on Soundcloud 

The Black Rain on Reverbnation

The Black Rain Facebook Page

story:
Imagine a magical place to hear music and see theatre in a building of history with fine crafted woodwork and incredible acoustics.....  

Experience an intimate setting and share some very special times with some of our world's greatest entertainers..... 

The Spire Center for Performing Arts is that place. Located in historic downtown Plymouth, MA - the very place where it all began almost 400 years ago - and now the very place that will soon host world class entertainment! The Town of Plymouth has provided funding to buy this historic building and upgrade it to today's safety code.They then signed a 100 year lease with our organization to run the facility. Many of the town's citizens and businesses have donated money to do the renovations needed for a performing arts center. 

And now you can help us Create the atmosphere needed to showcase the exceptional talent coming to the Spire with a state of the art sound system that will make it all happen!  Please give whatever you can to help us achieve our goal of $15,000 and count yourself in as a part of another great beginning in Plymouth, MA! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our building will seat 225 people and will provide audiences a chance to attend musical and theatrical performances up close and personal. We do need the funding we have asked for though before performances can commence. A state of the art sound system is critical to the success of our Center and your contribution will be used to fund its acquistion.

Your contribution of $25 or more will secure your invitation to our grand opening party later this year. A contribution of $100 or more will also give you a 2014 Gold Pass membership featuring discounted tickets and priority seating.

The Impact

The greater Plymouth area currently has no similar venue within 50 miles which features the type and quality of music and theatre we have in store. We plan musical presentations of many genres so as to appeal to a wider audience and will include folk and acoustic, jazz, Americana, country, classical, rock and others. We already have a theatrical company in residence and scheduled performances by Shakesperean companies and a professional summer stock theatre.

We plan to have a performing arts school and there is space in our large lobby to feature weekly open mic nights and comedy/improv. The volume of activity will be a significant draw for the downtown business area which already features many fine restaurants and places to stay which service the historic tourism industry of Plymouth.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please do whatever you can to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Who is the Special Ensemble?

The Special Ensemble (SE) is a premier youth performance group comprised of youth ages 9-16, who met at Newark Symphony Hall’s Children’s Performing Arts Academy, and discovered they share a common passion for singing and performing. The youth are featured at various events throughout the New Jersey Metropolitan area, including arena/sporting events, birthday celebrations, church events, festivals, retirement parties, weddings, community activities, etc.

Founded by Hugh A. Davis in 2010 and under the leadership of Musical Director, Ms. Candice Anderson and Managing Director, Ms. Niki Davis, the members of SE are role-models in their community who excel in leadership, teamwork and academics. SE helps to build skills, instill self-esteem, and provide self-expression, collaboration and fun.

Why Support the Special Ensemble

The Special Ensemble is the beginning of a lifetime of achievements waiting to come to each of its members. SE is considered to be one of Newark's hidden treasures who are inspirational and provide a bright light for the community. The youth have many dreams, goals and aspirations for themselves including traveling, competitions, a uniformed wardrobe, etc. In effort to accomplish such mentioned achievements, as an independent organization funds are required to sustain the success of the group. 

SE is privileged to have a Director and Manager who have inspired them and for the past 4 years have donated their time to leading the group. The Parents of these youth have formed a bond that is an extension to emphasizing the core values of great citizenship that is valuable to our society. As a volunteer organization, no one is paid or contributes monetarily to be a part of the Special Ensemble. While, the youth participates in various charity events throughout the year, contributions from supporters goes towards the expenses of the group.

story:
“Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silent” -Victor Hugo

Who I Am


Thank You so much for taking the time to check out this project. I'm extremely inspired by the Latin alternative independent musicians that are creating new sounds by pushing boundaries through the integration of the traditional and the contemporary. As a yogi and a musician/music lover, I've searched for a space where these two worlds could intersect, a type of meditative musical experience to build community outside of the traditional bar or club, and couldn’t find it. That's where you come in, to help support it!

Help me create an intimate and meditative Saturday evening sound ritual exploring intersections of music, culture and community on Saturday, August 24th from 7-10, at the Sitar Arts Center in Washington, DC. The evening in the community arts center will include herbal teas, aguas frescas, nourishing snacks, visuals and the musical delights of Lulacruza.

Lulacruza, an electronic folk duo from Colombia and Argentina, are at the junction of the hypermodern and the ancient. Their music weaves together hypnotic female singing, South American instruments, found sound objects, field recordings, and electronic manipulation. The result is a cross-genre, world-esque music unfolding with mesmerizing vocals, aquatic textures and up-tempo, handcrafted South American rhythms.

Check them out on NPR's Alt Latino:

http://www.npr.org/blogs/altlatino/2011/04/16/134927575/this-week-on-alt-latino-it-was-all-a-dream

http://lulacruza.com/

WATCH here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y1mzbqUhgqs

The Impact

“Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination and life to everything.” -Plato

 

By supporting this project, you are:

  • supporting the Sitar Arts Center, a Sitar Arts Center provides multidisciplinary arts education to the children and youth of Washington, DC in a nurturing, creative community where young people discover their inherent talents and gifts. The Center fosters personal and artistic growth through the visual arts, music, drama, dance, digital arts, creative writing and early childhood arts education. We offer afterschool, weekend and summer classes to more than 700 students a year, 80 percent of whom come from low-income households. http://www.sitarartscenter.org/
  • supporting an inter-generational space where music is understood as a language that transcends all sorts of boundaries and catalyzes community gatherings.
  • supporting independent artists and helping them share their offerings internationally

 

What I Need & What You Get!

Artist Fee- $400

Space Costs-$ 400 (direct donation to Sitar Arts Center)

Sound Equipment- $100

Indigogo fee- $100

 

For any amount you give to this project, we would love to offer a gift as a THANK YOU!

$25 - Playlist of current Latin Alternative music emailed directly to you :)

$100- 2 Front Row seats to the show!

$200- 2 One hour private yoga lessons accompanied by amazing music

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Of course, I understand if your finances are tight at the moment, and know that any little amount helps. You may also help by spreading the word!

 

Thank You!

story:
Hello world! Who am I? Why should you care about this project? I'm glad you ask. 

My name is Darryl Rahn. I am a singer-songwriter from Utica, NY in the final stages of my second full-length record.

Since my first record, "Home Sweet Home," a lot has happened. I wrote a ton of new songs, played a ton more shows, formed a band, graduated college, and got to work on album #2. This new batch of songs is a much more accurate representation of where I now stand as a writer, player, and person. The arrangements are filled out, the songs are more cohesive, and there are many more miles on the band. "Home Sweet Home" was a necessary endeavor and I will always be proud of it for what it was, but it's time to take the next step forward and bring the new songs to life for this next chapter.

This is where you come in. 

For this record, I personally funded the tracking process from playing shows, teaching guitar lessons, and waiting tables (a lot of tables). Therefore, everything is recorded and ready for post production! However, in order to mix, master, promote, and make physical copies/merch, I simply do not have the means to pay alone. I am an independent artist working for myself without the voice and budget of a label. I should add that when this record is complete, I will be moving to Nashville to further my music career. Therefore, this will not be a project that falls by the wayside later on... I have absolute faith that it will only grow from here, I simply need to get it finished and pressed so that it can accompany me on this adventure!

I have been incredibly fortunate to have such talent on the project, including the musicians and engineers behind the scenes. Josh Pleeter will be co-producing, engineering and mixing the record, and Grammy-Award winning Silas Brown will be mastering. Needless to say, I am very excited to get the ball rolling.  

If I do not raise the full amount ($1200) it will only prolong the time in which it takes me to finish the record and move on with these songs. (which would just be sad). Even if you can not donate (I totally understand...If I had money I wouldn't be on Indiegogo), SHARE this link! That will help me reach those that can donate just as much! Since it is flexible funding, every last cent counts. I truly appreciate your time and support from the beginning. Anything raised over the amount will go toward more physical copies and musical gear for future shows. ( + Vinyl pressing if enough is raised!)

Thank you for staying with me for this long. I promise you this record will be worth your time and money. 

Much love,

Darryl
story_txt: Hello world! Who am I? Why should you care about this project? I'm glad you ask. My name is Darryl Rahn. I am a singer-songwriter from Utica, NY in the final stages of my second full-length record.Since my first record, "Home Sweet Home," a lot has happened. I wrote a ton of new songs, played a ton more shows, formed a band, graduated college, and got to work on album #2. This new batch of songs is a much more accurate representation of where I now stand as a writer, player, and person. The arrangements are filled out, the songs are more cohesive, and there are many more miles on the band. "Home Sweet Home" was a necessary endeavor and I will always be proud of it for what it was, but it's time to take the next step forward and bring the new songs to life for this next chapter.This is where you come in. For this record, I personally funded the tracking process from playing shows, teaching guitar lessons, and waiting tables (a lot of tables). Therefore, everything is recorded and ready for post production! However, in order to mix, master, promote, and make physical copies/merch, I simply do not have the means to pay alone. I am an independent artist working for myself without the voice and budget of a label. I should add that when this record is complete, I will be moving to Nashville to further my music career. Therefore, this will not be a project that falls by the wayside later on... I have absolute faith that it will only grow from here, I simply need to get it finished and pressed so that it can accompany me on this adventure!I have been incredibly fortunate to have such talent on the project, including the musicians and engineers behind the scenes. Josh Pleeter will be co-producing, engineering and mixing the record, and Grammy-Award winning Silas Brown will be mastering. Needless to say, I am very excited to get the ball rolling.  If I do not raise the full amount ($1200) it will only prolong the time in which it takes me to finish the record and move on with these songs. (which would just be sad). Even if you can not donate (I totally understand...If I had money I wouldn't be on Indiegogo), SHARE this link! That will help me reach those that can donate just as much! Since it is flexible funding, every last cent counts. I truly appreciate your time and support from the beginning. Anything raised over the amount will go toward more physical copies and musical gear for future shows. ( + Vinyl pressing if enough is raised!)Thank you for staying with me for this long. I promise you this record will be worth your time and money. Much love,Darryl

story:
We' off to Nicaragua!

We (Kathleen and Mike) are off to a big adventure in March -- we are heading to Nicaragua on a mission trip with Portico Charlottesville, the church that planted our church (Portico Arlington).  We will be going with Portico’s Church Planting Team to Somotillo, Nicaragua in partnership with Because We Care Ministries (BWCM).

We’ve been on mission trips before, including to Ethiopia, Peru, Thailand, and Nicaragua.  Kathleen went to Nicaragua back in 2005 (above is a picture from her trip) to volunteer in orphanages, and she’s excited to go back.  We are excited to go on our first mission trip together, and excited to go help the people of Nicaragua.



The Impact

Nicaragua is the second poorest country in the western hemisphere. In 1998, 750,000 people lost their homes and their possessions as a result of Hurricane Mitch.  With an extreme lack of healthcare, the leading cause of death among children under the age of two is intestinal infectious disease due to malnutrition.  Due to of the lack of schools, the literacy rate is at 36%, it is unimaginable what it would be like to live in a place like this.

Portico Church has assembled a team that will share the love of Jesus Christ with these desperate people.  Portico’s missional motto is “Creating Churches for Future Generations”, with a particular emphasis on caring for children and teaching them about Christ. We will support BWCM by building houses, visiting villages, providing food and medicine, supporting local Pastors and Church Plants...... but most importantly we will be sharing the Gospel.  In addition to humanitarian missions, BWCM has a Pastor Training Facility where our senior leaders will serve and have opportunity to teach indigenous Pastors.

What We Need

Kathleen and I are heading to Nicaragua for seven days in mid-March, and we’re excited to ask you to consider supporting us through prayer (before and during the trip) and financially. Kathleen and I are raising a combined $2,900 ($1,450 each) to fund our trip, which we need to raise by Feb 14, 2015. FYI: We set the goal for IndieGoGo for $1,500, as we expect many people will mail in checks instead of using IndieGoGo.  We would love your financial support as we prepare for this adventure.  If you are interested in supporting us, please contribute here at IndieGoGo (Note:  IndieGoGo contributions are not tax deductible). 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Let other people know about our adventure -- you could post this to social media like Facebook
  • Pray for us before and during our adventure!
Thanks for reading this -- we're excited to share details of our adventure with you after we get back from Nicaragua,
Kathleen and Mike

story:
As many of you know the cost of making an album never seems to end.  We have worked through all the hard parts....  recording, mastering, artwork, yada-yada-yada...  We just need your help in the final printing!!   Your contributions will help us tremendously and they are basically preorders for the album anyways!  If you planned on getting our album then this is your chance to help us out AND get the album for your amazing contribution.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what we will use all the proceeds for:

  • The minimum campaign is $500 on Indiegogo, so if we hit that we will be using 100% of it for printing albums and potentially a new tshirt design
  • We need about $375 for album printing
  • Anything above that goal will be used for a new tshirt design to be printed asap!


We can't express enough how much your contribution will help us get this album out quicker and be ready for sale at our next big show opening up for Exodus on December 7th!   With some set backs on needing some new equipment and such, its taken us longer than we wanted to get this album out which is why we are doing this!
If we do not hit our goal, we promise anyone who contributes will still FOR SURE get what you were promised and any money raised will FOR SURE go into our album printing!

story:
UPDATE January 2016:  The DVD and digital live album will be available at 

http://renaissancetouring.com/store

Hello I’m Annie Haslam and I have been the lead singer of Renaissance for over four decades now. Like many bands we’ve had our ups and downs and changes, including the tragic loss of my dear friend Michael Dunford who passed away in 2012 just after the completion of our recent studio album Symphony Of Light. 

In April of this year we will be touring Europe for the first time in over thirty years and we are all extremely excited. It is our goal to chronicle this journey by filming and releasing a new live concert DVD.  

We ask for your help in funding the recording and production of the DVD by offering different levels of pledge rewards for your support.

Our goal is to complete the DVD project by October 2015.   

London Union Chapel

We particularly look forward to capturing our performance at London's storied Union Chapel venue where bands like Procol Harum have filmed great looking and sounding concert DVDs. 


The DVD

The DVD on disc will be a limited edition deluxe package consisting of:
  • Foldout digipack cover
  • 2-hour concert DVD with 5.1 and 2.0 audio
  • Digital album only
  • 8-page booklet

All DVD's will include a signed and numbered Letter of Appreciation only available to Indiegogo backers.
Pledge Rewards

A copy of the DVD is of course included with most of the pledge levels; your additional options include having it autographed the entire, or having your name listed in the booklet credits as an IndieGoGo backer.

In addition, we offer several historic and one-of-a-kind items as pledge rewards which you can choose from on the right! 

If we exceed our goal, additional rewards we might include will be to extend the DVD booklet, release the audio portion on CDs as well as digital download rather than digital download only; a major publicity campaign and releasing a Blue Ray version of the DVD. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share our campaign on your Facebook pages.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your help with our exciting project.

HAND PAINTED T-SHIRT:


SIGNED AND FRAMED PRINT:


PAINTED VIOLIN:



SONG FOR ALL SEASON'S PROMOTIONAL SCARF:



CUSTOM VELVET DRESS:



CARNEGIE HALL CONCERT POSTER (1975):


ANNIE'S BASEBALL JACKET:


HAND PAINTED GUITAR:

story:
We're turning 25!

Kyodo Taiko is North America's first collegiate taiko group, and accordingly has quite a bit of history behind it. Twenty-five years of students have come and gone through this highly dedicated and tight knit family, entertaining audiences both on and off campus. 

Spring Concert is an annual performance put on entirely by the members of this team and requires months of rehearsing over ten songs altogether. It is the one day in the entire school year during which friends and family can come see all of Kyodo perform at an event that is just about us. Usually we are hired out for other groups or events as entertainment, which is something we love doing - but Spring Concert is truly our time to shine. 

However, it is an extra expensive production to put on this year - 

We need your help in raising $7,000

  • $1,200 will rent out Freud Playhouse for the day.

  • $4,470 will pay for the manager, lead tech, sound engineer, stage tech, and sound assistant that the Playhouse requires us to hire.
  • $1,400 covers the cost of renting Playhouse equipment such as a video projector and projection screen.
Naturally, we don't expect you to do all the work - we've been fundraising independently as well. You may already know that we put on a successful 85 Degree Bakery delivery service during finals week of winter quarter: 

https://www.facebook.com/events/1379069389076850. Other projects are currently underway! And, as always, we are hired throughout the year to perform at other events:


Friends, family, and taiko community:
We truly want to make this year a special one. We're working to bring you a production that will hopefully be looked back on for years to come as one of the best that Kyodo has ever put on. Please help us! And even if you can't donate because you're just as broke as we are, please spread the word.

story:
The time has come!

Hey everyone and thanks for checking this out, we have been a band since 2010 and we are finally sitting down and putting out our first official EP that we plan on releasing in the Spring of 2015. Over our four years together we have opened for national touring bands such as The Red Jumpsuit Apparatus and Spoken and have loved all our friends, family, and fans that have supported us along the way. And now we need your help to put out this EP and we have some awesome things to give you guys in exchange for your help!

And this is what you can look forward to on the EP! New songs! 

What We Need & What You Get

We have some awesome stuff we wanna give you guys and things that you'll likely only be able to get through this project. What we are trying to get is $1,200 which will allow us to record the EP as well as mix/master and package the CD's. We're going to do everything we can to make this EP the best quality we have ever put out and want to reward you all, both new fans and old, for all of your support up to this point.

And no matter what, even if we don't reach our goal, every bit of your help will go into this recording project so that we can make this happen as soon as possible!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you guys can't help through this method we still love you! But if you'd wanna help in other ways you can get the word out about us and share this page with your friends or go check out our Facebook page to spread the word about us and what we're trying to do which is ultimately put our music out there to anyone who will listen, especially to kids out there who may be hurting and need a positive message in their music.

    We love you guys! Awesome things are coming!

story:
chatterbird is a group of Nashville musicians who are dedicated to exploring uniquely orchestrated chamber music.


We love performing classical music that skirts traditional boundaries, sliding between classical, jazz, hip-hop, rock, avant-garde, and country, creating a thoughtful and inventive way to discover and experience modern classical music. We bring cutting-edge chamber music repertoire into spaces where you wouldn’t typically find it - bars, galleries, breweries, basements, and everywhere in between. chatterbird formed in 2014 and had a smashing debut.

THE PROJECT:
Part of what we love most is featuring music of living composers who don't usually work within the classical genre. In our current season, we feature existing works by St. Vincent, Richard Reed Parry (Arcade Fire), Seth Timbs, and Charlie Haden, among others. We want to do more. We've created this indiegogo campaign to support the commission of a work from Brooke Waggoner, a Nashville-based singer-songwriter we’ve listened to and loved for years who has achieved international acclaim for her work. Brooke's writing is exquisitely beautiful, lush, and vibrant. She has a unique and strong artistic voice that we really believe in (scroll down and have a listen yourself!)


Brooke is hard at work on a commission for chatterbird that will be premiered at our concert in Summer 2015. The large-scale programmatic work, titled MINOR-BORN, is based on her poetry. 

Support for her commission will not only jump-start an exciting and important contribution to the growing body of new chamber music, but it will keep building upon the bold inter-genre collaborations already happening in the classical world. These conversations are so important to the vitality and growth of classical music.

 Nashville is such a special place. It's a melting pot of talent, and we want to challenge people to think differently about the things they create and consume, especially around classical music. Help us bring this original project to life!


PERKS:
We have some fun and interesting perks for you, from handmade and delicious cookies to signed merch to MYSTERIOUS TREASURE CHESTS to a special VIP experience with us (we're fun, promise). We'd love to shower you with gifts!

WHAT WE NEED: 
All funds will be used to pay for the creation of the work and supplement musicians' salaries for the premiere performance. 

HOW YOU CAN HELP:
The best way to help us is to donate! Beyond supporting the project financially, just tell your friends about us. Please help us get the word out about this unique Nashville collaboration!

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi! My name is Caitlin Novakowski.  In October, 2014, Big Noise, Scotland’s El sistema-inspired program will hold the International Sistema Teachers’ Conference in Stirling, Scotland.  I will be representing Sistema New Brunswick and participating in this unique immersive experience shaped by teachers for teachers. I have a strong desire for professional development within the el Sistema global movement and my connection to other people working in Sistema-inspired programs has encouraged me to consistently realign my teaching to reflect my philosophy that every student, regardless of background or ability, should have the opportunity to grow and be confident through a community of music.
  • We show our students that striving towards excellence is important when practicing an instrument and playing in an orchestra. I believe striving towards excellence is something teaching artists should practice as professionals. When we strive for excellence and celebrate one another as a catalyst for social change, we discover unanimity of purpose and shared responsibilities; we can refresh and hone our joint philosophies of music as a tool for social change.
  • By contributing to this project,  you will form a partnership with me in the El Sistema-inspired movement - and together, we will connect with global leaders, share innovative ideas and discover the inspirations and challenges of what it's like living out the possibility of transformative social change through music and the orchestra!  


What I Need & What You Get

  • The total cost for me to attend this Conference is $2000.00 (for the plane ticket, hotel, meals and transportation) and I am able to contribute $400.00. I am asking you to support me in raising the remaining portion.
  • Unique perks include daily updates in the form of photos, videos and written reflections describing the conference, people I've met, and learning practices that I hope to implement in our Centre in Saint John, New Brunswick. I'll even send you a postcard! After all, "guid gear comes in sma' bulk", which is a Scottish phrase for "good things come in small packages".   :) 


The Impact

  • Being part of an orchestra means you belong and are expected to do the right thing. Last week was the third week for our new students at Sistema Saint John. All beginning students made their own paper instruments out of papier maché and are now sitting proudly in rest, ready and playing position, they are learning basic rhythms, notes and are singing songs about the orchestra. At our centre, 'caring and sharing', 'hands are for helping' and 'doing the right thing' are widely known, modelled, and celebrated. One day, I was walking back to my classroom when I saw one of the teachers talking to a student who was ready for violin class before everyone else. She said to him, "You know what, I bet if you sat in your chair in ready position, Miss. Rachel would be so surprised and proud of you!" So the wide-eyed 6-year-old violinist raced to his chair, carefully picked up his paper violin and sat down with excellent posture. He held his violin carefully and rested it on one leg. He did this by himself for 3 minutes, with poise. It was a wonderful moment!
  • This project is valuable to me as a teacher, but more importantly, the knowledge that I will gain and share with our teachers will be valuable to the children of Saint John and other communities in New Brunswick. We have demonstrated that great art is for everyone and that it has the power to improve the lives of children and their families and enhance our society. We have shown that for children, an orchestra means joy, motivation, discipline, teamwork - that builds confidence and self-esteem and that it is incredibly fun. By supporting me in raising money for this trip, you will get to be part of using music as a tool for social transformation!


Risks & Challenges

  • There is a chance that I don't meet my goal of raising $1,600.00. This is my first time taking on a project like this, so I will do the best that I can to meet my goal.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc! 
  • Tell your friends and family! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

I believe striving towards excellence is something teaching artists should practice as professionals. When we strive for excellence and celebrate one another as a catalyst for social change, we discover unanimity of purpose and shared responsibilities; we can refresh and hone our joint philosophies of music as a tool for social change. By contributing to this project,  you will form a partnership with me in the El Sistema-inspired movement - and together, we will connect with global leaders, share innovative ideas and discover the inspirations and challenges of what it's like living out the possibility of transformative social change through music and the orchestra!   
   What I Need & What You Get 
The total cost for me to attend this Conference is $2000.00 (for the plane ticket, hotel, meals and transportation) and I am able to contribute $400.00. I am asking you to support me in raising the remaining portion. Unique perks include daily updates in the form of photos, videos and written reflections describing the conference, people I've met, and learning practices that I hope to implement in our Centre in Saint John, New Brunswick. I'll even send you a postcard! After all, "guid gear comes in sma' bulk", which is a Scottish phrase for "good things come in small packages".   :)  
  
The Impact 
Being part of an orchestra means you belong and are expected to do the right thing. Last week was the third week for our new students at Sistema Saint John. All beginning students made their own paper instruments out of papier maché and are now sitting proudly in rest, ready and playing position, they are learning basic rhythms, notes and are singing songs about the orchestra. At our centre, 'caring and sharing', 'hands are for helping' and 'doing the right thing' are widely known, modelled, and celebrated. One day, I was walking back to my classroom when I saw one of the teachers talking to a student who was ready for violin class before everyone else. She said to him, "You know what, I bet if you sat in your chair in ready position, Miss. Rachel would be so surprised and proud of you!" So the wide-eyed 6-year-old violinist raced to his chair, carefully picked up his paper violin and sat down with excellent posture. He held his violin carefully and rested it on one leg. He did this by himself for 3 minutes, with poise. It was a wonderful moment!
This project is valuable to me as a teacher, but more importantly, the knowledge that I will gain and share with our teachers will be valuable to the children of Saint John and other communities in New Brunswick. We have demonstrated that great art is for everyone and that it has the power to improve the lives of children and their families and enhance our society. We have shown that for children, an orchestra means joy, motivation, discipline, teamwork - that builds confidence and self-esteem and that it is incredibly fun. By supporting me in raising money for this trip, you will get to be part of using music as a tool for social transformation!



Risks & Challenges 
There is a chance that I don't meet my goal of raising $1,600.00. This is my first time taking on a project like this, so I will do the best that I can to meet my goal. 
  
Other Ways You Can Help 
Spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc! 
Tell your friends and family!  Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Jake Gregg was a member of the band Suncooked. He was a young college kid with an insatiable passion for music. His band was gaining a ton of attention around New England opening for acts like the Bosstones, and Dropkick Murphys. At age 20 he was diagnosed with Acute Myeloid Lukemia, an extremely fast acting bone marrow/blood cancer that's extremely rare in someone so young.

A lot of people in our little music scene have stories involving Jake, so here’s mine. I was introduced to Jake after my wife was his nurse when he was first admitted to the hospital in New Haven. It came up in conversation that he was in a band, and she told him i had a label and after talking about music a bit, that we actually had some mutual friends. It turned out I had actually seen his band perform with the Mighty Mighty Bosstones at one of the Throwdown shows. We talked via text, and facebook frequently, about his band, and their plans. I helped him track down a few records he was looking for, and before his health deteriorated further, I was walking him and his brother through the steps to release his band’s album on vinyl. This was something he was really focused on doing as soon as he got out of the hospital, and his brother told me it was really his dream to get this done.

Sadly to say, despite fighting his ass off, he recently lost his battle with this illness. It’s a huge loss for everyone who had the pleasure of meeting him, or getting to watch him perform. I messaged his brother to offer condolences, and saw the texts of our last conversation, and after speaking to him, I asked if we could move forward with making this happen, and he gave his blessing and encouragement, as it would have meant the world to Jake.

So here’s where you come in. Please take a look at our reward options, and give what you can. Our goal is to make enough records for friends, and to present to his family. All proceeds collected over the pressing/shipping costs will be given to the Gregg family, or a charity of their choosing. Thank you for your time in reading this, and your consideration.

-flood

story:
for the EQ-Curious⁄⁄

In our 5th season, Equilibrium Concert Series is launching our first annual Commissioning Project, commissioning works from three local composers and involving those artists in concert programming. Thus, the composer's voice is heard through the entire program, personalizing the concert experience. Such a strong presence of local composers in our season programming will deepen our mission  to nourish and enrich the local musical community by presenting concerts of new and recent music, written by New England composers and performed by local artists. Now we need your help to make this initiative a success!


2016 Concert Season⁄⁄

For our fifth season, EQ has curated an exciting roster of performers and composers, including the debut of our newly formed Equilibrium Ensemble. 

The Equilibrium Ensemble, under the direction of Matt Sharrock, is integral to Equilibrium Concert Series’ mission to showcase the talents of New England artists. With our own ensemble, we bring together the best local contemporary music performers to present innovatively curated programs of new music.  

To make this happen, we are seeking funds to cover our basic costs. Here is where your contribution will go:
  • Performer payment
  • Venue / instrument rental
  • Web presence & print publicity

By funding our season, you are enabling us to work with some of the best performers from Boston's rich community and beyond. Here are a few of the programs that your donation will support:

  • Turns | Equilibrium Ensemble premieres Clifton Ingram's commissioned work, Fortress of Turns, along with works by Nomi Epstein, Drew Baker, Daniel T. Lewis, and Mischa Salkind-Pearl.
  • FORM | electronic and multimedia composer Caroline Park’s FORM for percussion, cello, and double bass premieres alongside works of other genre-crossing artists.
  • Fourth Wall Ensemble | the acrobatic chamber musicians curate concert experiences unlike any other. Music by Stefanie Lubkowski and others.
  • Alvin Lucier portrait | double-concert showcases music by one of America's most fiercely individual experimentalists, paired with works of Beethoven.
We're already under way! Peter Van Zandt Lane’s Chamber Symphony premiered on October 15th of this year to great success and acclaim. It was performed alongside revised and never-before-heard music by our members Aaron Jay Myers and Stefanie Lubkowski.

Of his contribution to our upcoming December 4th concert as both a composer and a curator, Ingram says: “To me, the chance to fuse the creative visions of all involved is truly special and enriching, well worth sharing with the musical community.” Caroline Park notes “as an experimental electronic composer, Equilibrium Ensemble's progressive mission and interests resonate very much with my own approach to creative practice.”

Please help us to sustain this enriching and vital project. This is a tremendous undertaking for our organization, and we need your help to keep it going. Please consider making a contribution, to ensure that Equilibrium is able to offer these high-level performances and commission opportunities into the future. Every little bit helps, and we can’t do it without you!



The Impact

EQ runs a simple and streamlined operation—the expenses listed above account for over 95% of the money we use. Nevertheless, presenting high-quality new music is a costly prospect. By donating, you are making possible an event that impacts the community in immediate ways. Our concerts have been seen by over 1,000 guests (plus many more online); we have facilitated premieres of over 50 new works (several composed explicitly for us); and we have always kept our events accessible and affordable (tickets are always $10 or under). Please consider a contribution so that we can continue bringing this important music to the community.

There are many ways you can help—whether or not a donation is possible, please consider sharing our fundraising campaign with friends and enthusiasts of modern art. Our concerts are designed to welcome new audiences and broaden enthusiasm for modern music. Also, most of our concerts are streamed live online, where they can be enjoyed from anywhere, so help spread the word around the country (and globe)!


Bennies⁄⁄

Because we are fiscally sponsored by Fractured Atlas, your donations are tax-deductible. Donate before 11:59pm on December 31st and you will receive a receipt to include in your 2014 tax return. Take advantage of our perks when you donate, soak up the new music bennies, and most importantly, please come to a concert!


Don't be a stranger⁄⁄

You, our audience, are the recipients of the hard work we do. Stay in touch to learn more about EQ, join our mailing list, and follow us on Facebook.

our home//  visit our website for info, archives, and to purchase a season pass!
stay social//  we're on FB, where you'll learn about upcoming shows
live art//  watch live from anywhere
read up//  recent press

Equilibrium is:

Jason Huffman – Media Director
Daniel T. Lewis – Development Director
Stefanie Lubkowski – Public Relations Director
Aaron Jay Myers – Executive Director
Matt Sharrock – Music Director, Conductor
Mischa Salkind-Pearl – Artistic Director.


Equilibrium Concert Series is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a nonprofit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Equilibrium Concert Series must be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.
