story:
What is the Inspiration Behind the “Songs of the Gold Country” Community Music Project?

My Love for Music and Belief in Its Power to Heal, Connect and Inspire Us!

Can you recall a time that music helped you through a tough period in your life?

Music has been a reliable source of inspiration, understanding, healing and connection for me since I was a child.  And just five years ago – at the age of 46 - I played my first ever paying gig with my first band!  But unanticipated life changes soon sent me from central to southern California in 2012 and then to Sacramento in 2014.  For years, my guitars and my singing voice sat mostly idle.

In early 2016, I discovered a vibrant live music community in the historic town of Placerville, CA, where generous musicians and local music patrons accepted me and encouraged me to resume my guitar playing and singing during a difficult period in my life.  As a result of this support, I ended up playing 150 live music shows in 2016, from open mics to paying gigs, making new friends and great memories along the way!

An Genuine, Organic Community-Based Music Project for Everyone!

The “Songs of the Gold Country” community music project is a collection of 13 new folk/Americana songs by me and 14 of my talented local musician friends, aimed at capturing the spirit and story of a very special place where I spend many of my days – California’s Gold Country.

This album is my tribute to the people of Gold Country – especially the musicians, music patrons and venue managers – who reminded me what community feels like and the power of live music to inspire, connect and heal people.  We are attempting to capture the spirit of our special music community through these new original songs about the history, landscape and people of Gold Country and then share it with the world!  

The CD will ultimately be made available for resale by local merchants and organizations, with net proceeds going to our charitable music fund at the El Dorado Community Foundation.  

In summary, this is a community-based music project, created by a community of musicians, supported by a community of music lovers, for the benefit of local artists, local residents, local merchants and the millions of people in our global community who care about California’s Gold Country.

 

Contributing Musicians

These hometown singer-songwriters have written and recorded songs for this project

  • Fred & Cheryll Kent (Placerville)
  • Hugh & Sheri Hoeger (Placerville)
  • Danny Smithson (El Dorado Hills)
  • Sandi McCrossin (Placerville)
  • Tamra Godey (Sommerset)
  • James Woodward (J Woody) (Camino)
  • Lucy D’Mot (Placerville)
  • Greg Bullock & Aundrea Schindler (Placerville)
  • Bruce Stuart Riseman (El Dorado County)
  • Juliet Gobert (Nevada City)
  • Bob Woods (Sacramento)
  • DD James (Fair Oaks)

 

Project Expenses 

We're Spending Wisely and Carefully on This Project

We are attempting to raise $10,000 through a rewards-based campaign that will enable us to cover most of the initial costs of recording, duplicating and distributing this album.

The $10,000 that we raise for the project will be used as follows:

$5,000   Recording, Mixing and Mastering Expenses

$2,000   Rewards for our supporters (CDs, patches, posters, etc.)

$1,000    CD and booklet duplication (first production run for distribution)

$1,000   Project Marketing (graphic design, printing, posters, banners, etc.)

$1,000   Fees paid to Indiegogo and payment processing

It is important to note that the artists on this project are already self-funding most of the costs of the recording and marketing of this album out of their own pocket. 

Other Expense Scenarios

If we raise more than $10,000, it will first go towards any unanticipated costs above budget in the categories listed above.  We may also increase the quantity of our first production run to get better pricing.  Any remaining funds will be used to further promote and distribute the “Songs of the Gold Country” album so that more people can discover and purchase it.

If we raise less than $10,000, we will use raised funds to first fulfill all rewards to supporters and Indiegogo fees, followed by reimbursement to artists for project marketing expenses and recording, mixing and mastering expenses they have incurred.

 

Your Rewards in Exchange for Your Contributions!

Every Supporter's Contribution Counts

Every supporter will receive a specific reward based on the level of monetary support they provide.  We are keeping our rewards fairly simple for this project, so that it is easier for our supporters to contribute to the project.  

Sample Rewards

$10       "Songs of the Gold Country" commemorative patch

$25      “Songs of the Gold Country” CD w/15 page booklet

$35       All of the above + CD booklet signed by all participating artists

$45      All of the above + full color poster signed by all participating artists

$100    2 each of all of the above + your name in CD booklet as a supporter

 

Project Risks & Challenges

Unique Advantages of a Compilation Album: Strength in Numbers!

The great news about this project is that many of the risks and challenges typically associated with this type of project have already been overcome, and we are uniquely structured to handle any challenges in the future.  Here’s a brief overview:

  • I established an Executive Steering Committee for this project, consisting of five participating artists with music business experience to help advise me and successfully guide this project to completion
  • The funds we are seeking to complete our project is consistent with what a single artist or band would require to record, publish and distribute a CD/album of similar quality
  • However, we have 15 participating recording artists on this project who are promoting it to their personal networks, where most recording music projects of this type are relying on one artist’s network to raise the necessary funds.  That gives us a huge promotional advantage
  • We have several professional and semi-professional recording artists participating in this project, with collective experience of hundreds of years dealing with the  risks and challenges of recording, publishing and distributing music
  • Since most of the recording of music tracks is already completed and self-funded by the recording artists, there is no risk of not getting the album recorded, regardless of funding.
  • If we raise at least $3,000 we will be able to cover the costs of fulfilling all rewards to contributors, and we will also have enough money for final mixing and mastering of the album, so it can be sent off for duplication
  • If we raise at least $5,000 we will be able to order at least 250 CDs and booklets for duplication and resale, albeit at a less-than-optimal cost per unit.
  • If we raise $7,000 we will be able to do all of the above plus recoup the marketing costs associated with the project
  • If we raise $10,000 we will be able to all of the above plus completely reimburse the participating artists on the project for the costs of studio time in recording their songs

In summary, we have significantly less risks on our project than most solo artists or bands who use crowdfunding to record an album of similar quality.  We have tremendous strength in numbers of participating artists and promotional power, and we have already navigated through more than 80 percent of the recording process.  When there are challenges, I have an experienced committee in place to help me address and overcome them.

 

Other Ways You Can Help Support Our Project

Become a Fan of the Songs of the Gold Country Community Music Project!

I am so grateful to everyone who has provided encouragement, enthusiasm and support for the Songs of the Gold Country Community Music Project to date.  I understand that not everyone is in a position to purchase a reward to support us.

There are a number of ways you can help us, whether you purchase a reward or not:

  • Follow/like our Songs of the Gold Country Facebook page
  • Like, share and comment on our Facebook posts frequently!
  • Tell your friends, family and co-workers about our project – send them a link to our Facebook or Indiegogo page
  • Come out to one of our upcoming live music gigs and introduce yourself!
  • Send positive vibes in our direction, we’ll be happy to receive them!

 

Thanks for Your Interest! 

On behalf of all of the contributing artists of the "Songs of the Gold Country" Community Music Project, I'd like to thank you for taking the time to review our project on Indiegogo – I really appreciate it!  

Sincerely yours, 

James Gledhill - project visionary and executive producer

 Thanks for Your Interest! On behalf of all of the contributing artists of the "Songs of the Gold Country" Community Music Project, I'd like to thank you for taking the time to review our project on Indiegogo – I really appreciate it!  Sincerely yours, James Gledhill - project visionary and executive producer

story:
Short Summary

(pour voir ce résumé en français, cliquez: https://michaeljeromebrowne.com/indiegogo-francais)

If you don’t already know me, I am Michael Jerome Browne. I am primarily known as an acoustic blues artist, but I also play other types of American roots music, including old-time, Cajun, swing, soul. I have put out 7 albums in the past 20 years, 4 of them Juno-nominated, and all of them available on the Borealis label (https://borealisrecords.com). I tour mainly solo (I’ve won the Canadian Folk Music Award for Solo Artist twice) in Canada, the US and Europe.

I started playing music when I was 9 years old, and was immediately attracted to the blues. I got on stage for the first time when I was 14, and haven’t stopped since. In my teens I got interested in other forms of American music, all of which have a connection to the blues. Soul music is no exception, it is connected to the blues as a child is to its mother. In the ‘60s the two genres blended seamlessly. Artists like Bobby “Blue” Bland, Jimmy McCracklin and Lowell Fulson were identified as both blues and soul. The gospel foundation is what makes it soul. On this new album (working title: “That’s Where It’s At”) I will do some original songs and interpret classics using traditional fingerstyle blues guitar techniques to create fresh versions. This means some open tunings, some slide here and there, and the ever-present percussive thumb. There will be songs by artists like Bobby Bland, Lowell Fulson, Al Green, and Sam Cooke, and there will be at least 2 original songs co-written with B.A. Markus and a couple of original instrumentals. 

My blues-influenced acoustic guitar will be the foundation of this record. The only other instrumentalist will be drummer/percussionist John McColgan, who I’ve worked closely with for 30 years, and who will be on some of the tracks. The other guests will be vocalists: Harrison Kennedy, Roxanne Potvin and Eric Bibb. By contributing to this campaign, you can help us create some awesome soul duets!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $14,500 CAD to complete this album. This will cover studio time (tracking and mixing: $6,000), which will happen at Audio Bec Studio in Sherbrooke, Quebec; Grant Avenue Studio in Hamilton, Ontario; and Fast Forward Studio here in Montreal. Musicians’ fees will be $1,000 (this may seem low but some of the artists are bartering their services). Hotels and transportation (car rentals, gas) will be $1,400; Mastering will be $750; photography and cover design will be $1,700; getting the licenses for the non-original songs will be $1,000. This brings us to a sub-total of $11,850. If we add $425 for credit card fees, and $725 for Indiegogo’s 5% commission, we now have $13,000. Another $1,500 will cover miscellaneous expenses such as food, shipping and manufacturing of perks, which brings us to our goal of $14,500.

Borealis Records is committed to manufacturing, releasing, and promoting the album. I’ve been with them since 2001, and they have put out six of my albums, plus a compilation and a re-issue of my first. They always have had faith in what I do, and I am very grateful to have them behind me. 

PERKS! Before we get to the perks, here are three important points:

    -First of all, if you’re not interested in the perks, you can simply click on BACK IT at the top of the page, and contribute whatever amount you want.

    -Second, all contributions are in Canadian dollars. One Canadian dollar is worth about $0.80 US dollars, depending on the exchange rate of the day. If you’re contributing from outside Canada, your currency will be converted into CAD.

   -Third, if you want a CD, make sure you click on the perk that includes shipping to your country. It will either say Canada or International (Int'l) for all other countries. 

All right, here are the PERKS:

   - For $25, if you live in Canada, you can get a copy of the new CD delivered to your home.

   - For $35, if you live in Canada, you can get a copy of the new CD delivered to your home, + an exclusive bonus download of some live recordings I will be making in Port Townsend, WA, USA, in September.

   - For $35, if you live outside of Canada, you can get a copy of the new CD delivered to your home.

   - For $45, if you live outside of Canada, you can get a copy of the new CD delivered to your home, + an exclusive bonus download of some live recordings I will be making in Port Townsend, WA, USA, in September.

   - For $100, I will give you a guitar less on (or banjo, fiddle, mandolin) in your home, if you live within an hour of central Montreal by public transit. If you live further out, you can come to me.

   -For $750, I will do a house concert or workshop in your home, for your friends and family, provided you live within a 100 km radius of Montreal. If you live further away, we can discuss the transportation costs involved. You will also receive one copy of the new CD.

   -For $1000, you will get an “Executive Producer” credit on the album, and 2 copies of the new CD shipped to your home.

   

If I don’t reach my goal (depending on how far short I fall), I will apply for a Canada Council Grant in September. These grants are much harder to get than they used to be, and they require shaping the project to fit the criteria of the grant (hence this campaign), so let’s hope the campaign works! (With your help, I know it will).

The Impact

This is my first crowdfunding campaign, but not my first album (it’ll be my 8th). 4 of my 7 albums were nominated for Juno Awards, and my recent co-production with Eric Bibb and JJ Milteau, “Migration Blues,” was nominated for a Grammy. I’m very grateful that I’ve been able to play music all these years, from my coffee house and busking days in the ‘70s and ‘80s through the peak years of the Stephen Barry Band in the ‘90s, working as a sideman for Vann “Piano Man” Walls, Susie Arioli, Jordan Officer, Eric Bibb and others over the years, and the last 20 years of making my own recordings and touring on my own. You can help me continue on this journey.

The point of making a new recording is to get the music out there. But it’s not just about making a CD and digital download that people can acquire. A new album helps create a buzz which helps me book the gigs so I can come play for you! So by contributing to this project, in the long run you are facilitating a live performance that you may be able to experience. Live music: That's Where It's At! (Working title).

For this new recording I want to focus on the soul side of my repertoire, and its connection to the blues. Soul music is often blamed for people turning their backs on the blues in the 1960s, but I see it as the next step in an evolution, the moment when it got an infusion of gospel music and took off in a different direction, but maintaining its blues roots. I have adapted modern blues and soul songs to the techniques of early blues fingerstyle guitar, and aside from some drums and percussion on a few songs (John McColgan), my guitars and the vocals will be the only instruments. I’ve enlisted some great vocalists that I admire: Eric Bibb, Roxanne Potvin, and Harrison Kennedy. I can’t wait for you to hear my collaborations with these people. Help me make it happen!

Another collaborator worthy of mention is Larry O’Malley, the fabulous recording engineer at Audio Bec in Sherbrooke, Quebec. I’ve worked with him since 1994, and he has recorded and/or mixed all of my albums, as well as Eric Bibb’s Grammy-nominated “Migration Blues.” If there’s anyone who can make my solo acoustic guitars sound big, to fill in all the space when there’s nothing but that and the voices, it’s Larry. He’s done such a great job on all my album, and he keeps getting better. Most of the album will be recorded at his studio, and all of it will be mixed there. I have the utmost confidence that he will make us all sound fantastic!

Risks & Challenges

Here’s a big challenge: is there still an audience for real music played by real people? I keep hearing about how artificial intelligence will be writing the hits of the future. I believe there still is an audience, and always will be. People yearn for that human contact when they get close to someone who is playing and singing. And people want to hear a recording that resembles the show they just saw. They will get that with this album. Overdubs will be minimal, mostly it will be live off the floor. The audience for roots music is definitely ageing, but more and more I see young people coming out to acoustic music shows. Live music: That’s Where It’s At!

Other Ways You Can Help

​If contributing money is not easy for you right now, there are other ways you can help. Please share this with as many people as you can, via Email, social media, and the Indiegogo share tools. The more people know about the campaign, the more likely I am to reach my goal.

story:
Happy Anniversary Rusted Root!

What's the best way to celebrate our 25th anniversary? By putting out a brand new Rusted Root studio album!  With the success of our last release, The Movement, we want to follow up with our own independent release and offer the fans a chance to purchase some pretty awesome perks!

We found from our last Fortunate Freaks fan funding program, that our fans (YOU) wanted to and loved getting unique items from us.  We've seen as we've been touring across the country, that you love hearing our new material as much as the hits, and we want to keep them coming!  In order to do this, we want to release our next album completely independently. 

Looking for Funding to Make Our Goals Possible!

We are currently writing the new tracks that we're hoping to get on this album.  We actually have quite a few (around 30 or so) that we're testing and working on while we're out on the road.  From there, we're going to narrow it down, and bring in about 10-12 into the studio.  We need to hire some musicians, pay for some equipment and pay for studio time and space. We're estimating these costs at coming in at approximately 25K.  In addition to these costs, since we are planning on putting this album out independently, we are hoping to raise additional funds to help market and promote the album upon completion.

If we don't hit our goal, we will use these monies to help us get started, and work towards finding other means to find enough funding to move forward.

Instead of offering the standard perks for our fans, we wanted to create very special and unique opportunities for you.  We wanted to give you the chance to feel like you are actually funding something special.  There are perks for everyone, whether you can contribute $5 or $5000.  We thought about things that we would want from our favorite bands, and came up with some exciting exclusive offers that we think you'll enjoy!  If there's something you'd like to see, we're open to ideas too!  Email us at officialrustedroot@gmail.com, and we'll gladly consider your ideas.  We will be adding some additional perks as the campaign continues, so feel free to check in regularly!

Our timeline is to release the album in mid 2015.  We don't have a final timeline laid out yet, and our schedule is a bit flexible.  However, our goal will be to fulfill your orders of the perks by June 2015. Obviously, some things will be worked around our tour schedule, like the "Choose Your Own Adventure," "Send Me On My Way Soundcheck" or "Stage Seating." Others will need to wait until the album is complete like the "Vinyl package" and "Digital Download."

We raised over 20K on our last fan funding campaign, that we did through our merch site. We went on to create an amazing album that was hailed by critics and fans alike.  This time around, we want to offer you some amazing opportunities and give you the chance to get something special. With NO RECORD LABEL to tell us how or what to do, this album is going to be some of the best music we have ever put out. 

We Know Money is Tight!

We know that money is tight right now across the board! We've worked hard to keep our ticket prices low and the music flowing so you can enjoy what we do!  If you don't have any extra funds right now, we get it!  Please help us by sharing our campaign with your friends and letting everyone you know, know about the campaign.  Use the indiegogo share tools and help more people that use indiegogo see our project!

story:
Grabación

Las guitarras eléctricas y bajos se grabarán en mi estudio personal y posteriormente serán reamplificadas en el estudio de grabación. Las guitarras acústicas serán grabadas en estudio, así como la batería si los fondos lo permitieran. Posteriormente será mezclado y masterizado en el estudio. 

Para la grabación del disco contaré con músicos y amigos de todos estos años, que creo que enriquecerán bastante el proyecto, no serán todos los que quisiera, pero si estoy seguro de que aportarán bastante al proyecto. 

Recompensas

Las recompensas serán entregadas una vez haya finalizado el proceso de grabación y previamente al estreno del disco.

Consecución del proyecto

La grabación será efectuada independientemente de si se llega al objetivo o no. Según lo que se recaude se estudiará realizar acciones adiciones como aumentar los medios para la grabación, la celebración de un concierto o sacar una tirada limitada de copias físicas. Por supuesto estas acciones adicionales repercutirán en recompensas adicionales para los mecenas,

story:
Never Heard of Modern Echo?

Take a listen to our single "Break in the Sky" off of our 2015 EP Elan Vital. If you like what you hear, then you're in store for a lot of great hard rock music.

 
 

What We Need & What You Get

THIS IS A TWO WAY STREET! 

We really appreciate any support that you can show and we want to make sure you don't walk away empty handed. Early access to the EP, physical copies of the new EP /our first album Spirit In The Machine/our 2015 EP Elan Vital, bonus acoustic tracks, custom cover songs, custom merch, signed lyrics sheets and more can all be yours with your support! Check out the perks on the right side of the page and see what kind of cool stuff you can pick up while this campaign is up and running. 

The Impact

We raise all of our money for the band through playing live shows all over the midwest, selling CDs and getting our music on TV (Check out the American Chopper promo featuring Modern Echo below). The last part is huge for our fund raising efforts. This type of opportunity helps us pay to keep our van up and running, for our trailer, our gear, our gas, and most importantly: OUR RECORDING!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand that some of you have zero money to spare. No worries! There are other ways that you can help:

  • Please Like us on Facebook and Follow us on Instagram
  • PLEEEEASE share this page with your friends, family and anyone that loves rock music!

THANK YOU ALL SO VERY MUCH!!!

story:
My name is Derek Noppe an Ottawa based guitar player, live music fan and Mental Health advocate.

In May of 2015 I lost a close friend and band mate due to her struggles with her Mental Health Issues - this has opened my eyes to the many, many people who struggle in silence today.

Every dollar donated will be going to help those in need - the Royal Ottawa Hospital who specialize in helping those with Mental Health issues.

This is our fifth year for this fund raising event, it is now my annual duty to raise awareness and funds in memory of my band mate, I am purposely not using her name as her family struggles with the reality of her illness.

Money - show your support by giving whatever you can, no contribution is too small, it all adds up.  We have lost to many people due to mental health issues.

Share this page with all your friends - more of them have had personal contact with this issue than you know - many people suffer in silence and many have become very good at hiding it and by sharing you will help end the stigma 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please spread the word - share this site on social media, check out the website www.rockingawareness.ca  - share that too, let everyone know that you stand along side all those who suffer, help me let them know that they are not alone.
story_txt: My name is Derek Noppe an Ottawa based guitar player, live music fan and Mental Health advocate.In May of 2015 I lost a close friend and band mate due to her struggles with her Mental Health Issues - this has opened my eyes to the many, many people who struggle in silence today.Every dollar donated will be going to help those in need - the Royal Ottawa Hospital who specialize in helping those with Mental Health issues.This is our fifth year for this fund raising event, it is now my annual duty to raise awareness and funds in memory of my band mate, I am purposely not using her name as her family struggles with the reality of her illness.Money - show your support by giving whatever you can, no contribution is too small, it all adds up.  We have lost to many people due to mental health issues.Share this page with all your friends - more of them have had personal contact with this issue than you know - many people suffer in silence and many have become very good at hiding it and by sharing you will help end the stigma Other Ways You Can HelpI know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please spread the word - share this site on social media, check out the website www.rockingawareness.ca  - share that too, let everyone know that you stand along side all those who suffer, help me let them know that they are not alone.

story:
DAWN OF SOLACE "Waves" pre-order campaign

I created this campaign to be able to handle the pre-order campaign directly between an artist and fans. This way I am able to include more exclusive stuff into the campaign and be in direct contact like I was sitting behind the merch table after a gig.

Naturally this makes a lot more sense financially cutting the middle man (distributor, record store etc) and helps to make next album possible. Physical and digital album will also be distributed worldwide thru NOBLE DEMON -label, so this is not the only way to get the cd. Digital pre-order is 100% in the hands of NOBLE DEMON and available naturally worldwide. However the exclusive material is only available here in Indiegogo for a limited amount of time.

The album is recorded, mixed, mastered and is in print already. So is the video done as you can see on Youtube, so I am not gathering funds to make something happen. 

-Tuomas-


Spotify, itunes, Apple Music etc digital streaming and pre-order:
Dawn Of Solace -Waves- 

https://snd.click/DoSwaves

Dawn Of Solace -The Darkness-

https://snd.click/darkness

Check for updates, coming up gigs etc at:

https://ucm.one/en/music-labels/noble-demon/

https://www.facebook.com/dawnofsolace/

https://www.facebook.com/nobledemonrecords/

story:
E N G L I S H

Hi Thrashers!

      HOLYCIDE is finishing the mixing and mastering process of the debut full length album "Annihilate... Then Ask!" which will be a total madness for all lovers of good old 80's styled Thrash Metal.

      "Annihilate... Then Ask!" contains 9 new songs plus a cover of legendary US Thrashers DÉTENTE, recorded at Blood Cadillac Studios by Andy C. who's also doing the mix & mastering. Cover artwork was done by the well known artist Andrei Bouzikov (Municipal Waste, Toxic Holocaust, Skeletonwitch...) and it's also a total 80's looking piece of art! We were thinking about a transcendental & abstract post-modern cover full of intellectual meaning behind, but... what the fuck!! A Thrash Metal album deserves a Thrash Metal artwork, haha!!

      Even if the album will be released on Xtreem Music on 1st of February 2017, we are conscious that this is the underground and with such low and decreasing sales on physical formats, labels can't afford to pay studio & artwork costs that later will be difficult to recover, so we're financing everything by ourselves. For a relatively new band like us, of course it's quite some money, but we believe we're bringinig hell of a fucking awesome album and hopefully with your help by pre-ordering any of our items & combos, we'll get back, if not all, at least a good part of what we're investing in "Annihilate... Then Ask!".

HELP US TO ACHIEVE THIS PROJECT!!

S P A N I S H

Hey Thrashers!

      HOLYCIDE se encuentra finalizando el proceso de mezcla y masterización del debut álbum completo "Annihilate... Then Ask!" que será una total locura para todos los amantes del buen viejo Thrash al estilo de los '80.

      "Annihilate... Then Ask!" contiene 9 nuevos temas y una versión de los legendarios Thrashers americanos DÉTENTE, grabado en los Blood Cadillac Studios con Andy C. que también se encarga de la mezcla y masterización. El arte de la portada ha corrido a cargo del conocido artista Andrei Bouzikov (Municipal Waste, Toxic Holocaust, Skeletonwitch...) y es también un dibujo a estilo total mente de los '80! Estuvimos pensando en hacer una portada post-moderna transcendental y asbtracta llena de significado intelectual, pero... qué cojones!! Un álbum de Thrash Metal merece un arte Thrash Metal, jaja!!

      Aunque el álbum será editado en Xtreem Music el 1 de Febrero de 2017, somos conscientes de que esto es el underground y con tan bajas y decrecientes ventas en formatos físicos, los sellos no se pueden permitir pagar costes de estudio y arte que luego difícilmente van a recuperar, así que estamos financiando todo nosotros mismos. Por supuesto, para una banda relativamente nueva como nosotros, esto es bastante dinero, pero creemos que estamos pariendo un álbum increíble y ojalá que con vuestra ayuda haciendo pre-pedidos de nuestros artículos y combos, recuperemos, si no todo, al menos una buena parte de lo que estamos invirtiendo en "Annihilate... Then Ask!".

AYUDANOS A CUMPLIR ESTE PROYECTO!!
      Please, spread this campaign as much as you can and encourage your friends to participate!! The more money we get, more we'll invest in printing merchandise and perhaps some video-clip... who knows!!

      Unfortunately we only have the chance to accept payments through PAYPAL, so those of you who don't have an account, you can always ask a favour to some friend, he pay for it and later you pay to him somehow, hehe!!		       Por favor, difunde esta campaña todo lo que puedas y anima a tus amigos a participar!! Cuanto más dinero recaudemos, más invertiremos en fabricar merchandise y quizás un video-clip... quién sabe!!

      Lamentablemente sólo tenemos la posibilidad de aceptar pagos por PAYPAL, así que los que no tengáis cuenta, siempre podríais pedir un favor a algún amigo que la tenga, que la pague el y luego se lo pagáis como sea, jeje!!

      Release date for "Annihilate... Then Ask!" is planned for 1st of February 2017, but we'll need to be manufacturing everything during november & December to get it ready by January and mail out all pre-orders during that month.

       La fecha de salida para "Annihilate... Then Ask!" está prevista para el 1 de Febrero de 2017, pero necesitaremos ir fabricando todo durante el Noviembre y Diciember para tenerlo listo en Enero y enviar todos estos pre-pedidos durante ese mismo mes.
 

IMPORTANT

      If you want to buy different packs, since there's no way the system combine them all into one (there's no shopping cart), you must buy separately and after you buy, write us an email to holycide@gmail.com and we'll apply combined shipping and refund the difference to you, OK?

      Size for the T-shirt, please write it on the 2nd field for the addrress, OK?

IMPORTANTE

      Si quieres comprar diferentes packs, ya que no hay forma de que el sistema los combine en uno (no hay carrito), debes comprarlos por separado y tras la compra, escríbenos un email a holycide@gmail.com y te aplicaremos el envío combinado devolviéndote la diferencia, OK?

      La talla de la camiseta, escríbela en la segunda línea que hay para la dirección, OK?

story:
The Story

Namaskaram and Hello!

On behalf of Kutcheri Talkies, welcome to this crowdfunding campaign for 'Kaalai Pozhudhil'. We, at Kutcheri Talkies are thrilled to embark on this project in collaboration with singer and composer, Vinod Krishnan.

Written by his friend Nivedhitha Swaminathan, Kaalai Pozhudhil was composed by Vinod in summer 2010 - just before both of them got married to their respective partners. Rather than making any other music video, all of us wanted this song to break stereotypes and redefine relationships - particularly, with marriage. 

Mainstream media and society has reinforced each other's views of gender stereotypes in partner-based relationships. We've seen and heard the rhetoric way too often. There is not enough expression through media, of this growing collective desire to break these stereotypes. 

Kaalai Pozhudhil is a breezy, romantic song that will get you humming for sure but more importantly, attempts to do just this - bring forth a few examples of how we can be equal partners with equal priorities and equal reciprocity. 

 

Team

We have several accomplished professionals who are part of this project. 

  • Music - Vinod Krishnan
    • Singers - Vinod Krishnan, Jananie SV
    • Flute - Rasika Shekar
    • Mixing and mastering - Navneeth Balachander
    • Lyrics - Nivedhitha Swaminathan
  • Story - Vinod Krishnan, Srividhya Radhakrishnan
  • Script and direction - Deepika Chandrasekaran
  • Production team - Cock-a-doodle Productions
  • Cast
    • Female lead - Amrutha Srinivasan
    • Male lead - Abishek Joseph George

 

Numbers

Our target for this campaign in USD 12,000 (~ INR 8 lac). Once you see the breakdown, we hope you'll see why it takes this kind of budget for making something impactful.

  • Video Pre-production      INR       50,000 (~USD 720)
  • Video Production             INR    4,00,000 (~USD 5800)
  • Video Post-production   INR    1,00,000 (~USD 1500)
  • Music production            INR       50,000 (~USD 720)
  • Promotions                       INR    1,00,000 (~USD 1500)
  • Artwork                              INR       20,000 (~USD 290)
  • Legal, platform fees       INR       80,000 (~USD 1160)

 

Pre-production includes screenplay and treatment, pre-visualization and project planning, casting and scheduling. 

Production costs typically include direction, cinematography, equipment rental, artists' professional fees (actors), transportation and food for crew, venue rentals, production management (line producers), among others.

Post production typically includes editing, color correction, studio charges and VFX to create the full video, trailers, social media promotions, among others.

Music production includes costs for music production, artist fees, recording studio and recording engineer fees, mixing and mastering fees.

Promotions include social media promotions and other digital and print promotions.

Artwork includes poster design, social media, print and digital promotions.

Legal fees include filing for copyright and agreements between collaborating parties. Other fees include platform fees and transaction fees.

 

Perks

We want this to be as much your project, as it is ours. So instead of just asking for donations, we've put together some perks that you'll finding exciting! Check out the right panel for a list of perks. Many of our collaborating artists have come forward to lend their time and talent for free, to bring these perks to you. It's our way of thanking you for your support. We are constantly working to bring more perks along the way, and some of them are specific to where you live. Check those out!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute,  we've got you covered! You can still be part of our project:

Call or text 3 of your best friends now!  Tell them about this project. Word of mouth is so personal and powerful. Share this campaign with them.

Share, share, share.  Make some noise about this project on social media, especially with those who are active and popular on social media. 

Know businesses, brands, influencers or producers who would like to support us? Connect us and we'll shout out a special thank you to you in our social media promotions!

 

The Impact

By supporting this project, you'll help put this work to more ears and eyes globally. You'll show to the world that fans and supporters are an artist's best friend, when you believe in their art. You'll give us confidence that you'll stand by us if we bring meaningful music to you.

This is the first of many projects we have in our vision for the coming months and years and we hope to grow to a point where, with your support, we can address more pressing issues in society.

 

 Challenges

It's taken a long time to find the vision and the team to bring 'Kaalai Pozhudhil' to life. There is courage and clarity now. Campaigns like these are always time sensitive and entirely is dependent on the support of forthcoming individuals like you. If you have read until here, thank you for your patience. Now you know what we wish to achieve. We hope you'll be part of our journey and invite others too.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
///

We have been working to get this album out for the last few years now. Between living in different cities, limited time together, and limited time to work on this project, it has taken a while to get everything in place to make this album the best that it can be. But after a few years of hard work, we are sure we have the best product we can have. And now we want you to hear it!

This whole campaign is all about getting you the music EARLY. In fact, if you contribute, you get the whole album RIGHT NOW as a digital download. This album isn't going to be officially released until August 30th, so if you want to hear it up to a month early, this is the only way!

We are also offering an album artwork tee in an EXCLUSIVE color during this campaign only. THIS IS THE ONLY TIME WE ARE GOING TO BE OFFERING THIS SHIRT IN THIS COLOR. If early access and exclusive merch aren't enough for you, we are also offering discounted merch packages through this campaign as well.

This album is really special to us and we hope to get it out to as many people as possible. We are also trying to give back to the people who have been following us since our inception in 2013. Old fans, new fans, we hope everyone enjoys this album.

March On!

story:
Making a record is expensive, and asking for support is difficult--we're gonna do both!  Performing and writing music is our full-time job, our wages barely cover rent and the heavy task of traveling.   Our fans have been very outspoken about their desire for a new album of songs, and we are ready to do this.  Please help us realize the next step in our Good Time Traveling dream:  our sophomore recording!  

Thank you,    

The Good Time Travelers

story:
Our Story

The Westchester Chorale was organized in 1965 by Harold Aks of Sarah Lawrence College in Bronxville, New York. An auditioned avocational chorus, the Chorale has been a proud contributor to the musical life of Westchester County for the past 46 years. Throughout its history, the Chorale’s high standards of musicianship and collaboration with professional vocal soloists and instrumentalists have brought critical praise and renown. Currently, we are proud to be the chorus-in-residence at the Larchmont Avenue Church under the baton of maestro Douglas Kostner.

We are now rehearsing for our December 2011 concert, "A Feast of Magnificats," with choral works by John Rutter, Charles Stanford, Richard Shephard, and our own Douglas Kostner.

 

The Impact

 

To fund our concerts, we rely on member contributions, ticket sales, and donations from music lovers like you. This past year, the recession has really taken a toll on our fund-raising efforts and we need to fill a budget short-fall of about $3,000 in order to pay all of our concert-related expenses. If we don't raise the money, we will not be able to afford subsidized tickets for seniors and students, extra rehearsals with choral professionals, or music rentals for our spring 2012 concert, and it will be tough to attract an audience without any budget for even the most modest advertising in the local paper or printing flyers to distribute locally.

What We Need & What You Get

As we said, our budget short-fall is about $3,000. The money will be used to pay for choral professionals at additional rehearsals, ticket subsidies for the elderly and for students, fees for our soloists and for space rental, as well as music rentals and expenses for our spring 2012 concert. Even if we don't raise the whole amount, every little bit will help!

 

To sweeten the pot, we're offering a bunch o' nifty giveaways as a heartfelt "thank you" for your donation! They'll be available for pickup at the box-office for our December 10th concert at the Larchmont Avenue Church, 60 Forest Park Avenue in Larchmont, New York. Non-physical items (like the evening with author Susan G. Bell or the house in the Catskills) will expire one year from the concert date, or December 10th, 2012. Thanks again and enjoy!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate right now, please let other folks know about our IndieGoGo campaign and let them know about our concert at the Larchmont Avenue Church (60 Forest Park Avenue in Larchmont, NY) at 4:30PM on December 10th! The bigger our audience, the greater our ticket sales will be and the smaller our budget deficit - so please spread the word! And, of course, if you know other choral music lovers, please share this link with them so they can donate, too. Thanks!

To fund our concerts, we rely on member contributions, ticket sales, and donations from music lovers like you. This past year, the recession has really taken a toll on our fund-raising efforts and we need to fill a budget short-fall of about $3,000 in order to pay all of our concert-related expenses. If we don't raise the money, we will not be able to afford subsidized tickets for seniors and students, extra rehearsals with choral professionals, or music rentals for our spring 2012 concert, and it will be tough to attract an audience without any budget for even the most modest advertising in the local paper or printing flyers to distribute locally.

What We Need & What You Get
As we said, our budget short-fall is about $3,000. The money will be used to pay for choral professionals at additional rehearsals, ticket subsidies for the elderly and for students, fees for our soloists and for space rental, as well as music rentals and expenses for our spring 2012 concert. Even if we don't raise the whole amount, every little bit will help!
 
To sweeten the pot, we're offering a bunch o' nifty giveaways as a heartfelt "thank you" for your donation! They'll be available for pickup at the box-office for our December 10th concert at the Larchmont Avenue Church, 60 Forest Park Avenue in Larchmont, New York. Non-physical items (like the evening with author Susan G. Bell or the house in the Catskills) will expire one year from the concert date, or December 10th, 2012. Thanks again and enjoy!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't donate right now, please let other folks know about our IndieGoGo campaign and let them know about our concert at the Larchmont Avenue Church (60 Forest Park Avenue in Larchmont, NY) at 4:30PM on December 10th! The bigger our audience, the greater our ticket sales will be and the smaller our budget deficit - so please spread the word! And, of course, if you know other choral music lovers, please share this link with them so they can donate, too. Thanks!

story: Dear Everyone ! I want to talk about my problem. I am 15 years old . I'm from Georgia and I live in Tbilisi. I study at Tbilisi Zakaria Paliashvili central music school . I play violin from 6 years and this instrument is too important for me because violin is part of my life. Every year I play in Georgian music festivals , in concertos . I'm winner of the competition - "Future Stars" (Georgia) . But I don't have my own violin . Now I'm playing on schools violin which isn't good instrument because it's for beginner players . I have big plans for future like as playing "Devil's Trill" , Wieniawski " violin concerto" and different pieces like these . This is very serious pieces and my teacher says that I can't play any serious piece on this violin . My parents can't buy violin for me because I live in a very poor family . I think all people must help another in hardships and most help need young people because they are world's future . Please help me as you can because this is very big problem for me and for my future , Music is my life and I don't know how to live without violin and without part of my life - music . Please send this page to anyone you know (family, colleagues, and friends) whom you think would also like the opportunity to contribute to my dream.. Please help me.Thank you !

story:
[This Is Me]

For the most part of my music career, I have been asked by many people in the industry, from labels to managers “What’s your sound?”, “What genre are you?”, or “ Who are you as an artist?”. I am continuously grateful for their feedback and I challenge myself to create a unique sound and evolve as an artist. I stay true to myself, to my lyrics, and to my sound. I am not a label specific sound or genre. I’m soul, pop, rock, funk, blues or jazz all at once. I am a singer-songwriter and my genre is music. My voice is my instrument brought to life by the emotions and lyrics I have written. I write stories into songs and each story has a different path or sound but in the end they all still sound like me. A multitude of genres all on one album. A different style of sound and emotion based on my perspective. [This is me], this is who I am as an artist.

 

The Project

This album has been a “work-in-progress” for many years. A project of this magnitude takes time, hard work, patience and financing. My growth as an artist has lead me to this moment; the next level of my career. I put my heart and soul into these 10 songs. I travelled from Sudbury to the studio in North Bay on a weekly basis for the past 6 months. This album would not be possible without the incredibly talented and Juno nominated producer/engineer Ben Leggett. The experience has been like no other. I was introduced to a remarkable group of talented musicians who came to the studio to help bring these songs to life. We recorded a grand piano inside a church, added some organ, brought in some cello and of course the usual suspects of electric guitar, acoustic guitar, bass, drums and 4 different back up vocalists. I am incredibly proud of the outcome. The musicians on my new album have become my band mates and my family. (Check them out in the credits below). The album [This Is Me] will be released this October with CD’s and a limited release of Vinyl. A release party will be held in Sudbury, North Bay and Collingwood, followed by live shows supporting the album throughout Canada.

 

This Is You

Your support over the years has given me the courage and the strength to better myself on stage, to reach larger goals, and to give you my best. Your support in this campaign doesn’t necessarily mean you have to spend your hard earned money. A simple Facebook share or shout out is more than I can ask for, and I truly do appreciate it! I have had unforgettable encounters and met some amazing people during my gigs all over Ontario and beyond. I look forward to seeing you all again very soon as I continue this amazing journey into the wonderful world of music.

 

Where Does The Money Go?

Recording an independent album is very expensive. There are studio costs, hiring of a sound engineer/producer and professional musicians, mixing and mastering, album artwork, album photography, marketing, distribution, printing, pressing CD’s and Vinyl, travel costs and much more. I was fortunate to receive a grant from the Ontario Arts Council to help cover some of the costs of recording in the studio along with my personal savings. The recording is finalized and the mixing and mastering will be completed this summer. The next big step is CD’s and Vinyl and the main reason for this campaign. It will cost $5,000.00 for CD’s and a limited pressing of Vinyl records. If we exceed the goal limit (which would be amazing), those extra funds would go towards the production of a music video for the first single.

 

The Reward

With any donation you will automatically receive a digital download of my previous EP “What Would You Do?” so please leave a valid email and enjoy the music. There are several rewards to your right and there is also the option of donating any amount by clicking on the pink “BACK IT” button near the top of this campaign page. Any donation helps, and any donation over $30 will receive a signed CD copy of my new album [This Is Me].

- Here are a few of the rewards:

  • Digital download of the new album [This Is Me]
  • Signed CD [This Is Me]
  • Signed Vinyl [This Is Me]
  • This Is Me T-shirt

     
  • A cover song of your choice
  • My Epiphone Emperor Regent hollow body electric guitar signed with hard case! (picture bellow)

 

Album Credits

  • Ben Leggett (Engineer, Producer, Electric Guitar, Percussion, Mixing and Mastering)
  • David Dino White (Lead and Rhythm Guitar, Backup Vocals)
  • Eric Treleaven (Lead and Rhythm Guitar)
  • Joe Reda (Bass)
  • James Palmer (Grand Piano)
  • Jordan Wyshniowsky (Cello)
  • Shawn Pitzel (Organ)
  • Andrew Sowka (Backup Vocals)
  • Marco Lalonde (Backup Vocals)
  • Rose-Erin Stokes (Backup Vocals)
  • Stef Paquette (Song arrangement through the years)

 

Artistic Credits

  • Robert Charette (Album Artwork, Campaign Video - filming/editing)
  • Sabrina Johnson (Campaign Photography)
  • Gerry Kingsley (Album Cover Photography)

story:
About Headcase

Headcase is an indie rock band from Homewood, Alabama. The band consists of Kameron Mitchell, Mason Thomas, Andrew Hardie, and Ethan Standard. 

After months of writing, practicing, recording, and planning, we are finally ready to share our music with you!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our fundraising goal is $5,000. This will go toward the production of our album. (Paying our producer and engineers, having CD's printed, merchandise, etc.) This goal is also intended to raise enough money so that we do not have to do another fundraising campaign next time we want to make a record.

We have included quite a few awesome perks! Everyone who partners with us will automatically receive The Postscript . Other items that are up for grabs include the following:

  • Your name included in the liner notes of the album
  • A companion album (additional songs not included on the record)
  • A super awesome gift box (which includes a t-shirt, a coffee mug, and stickers) 
  • An invitation to a private house show 
  • Dinner on us

All of the perks are detailed here on fundraising web page.

 

The Impact

We have always wanted to be able to reach people through music, and this record is an opportunity for us to do just that. By partnering with us on this record, you will be a part of helping us achieve this goal. You will also be providing a foundation for our future endeavors as a band.

We have worked hard to create this record and we are excited to share it you. We do not take for granted your financial support. It means the world to us that you believe in us enough to invest in our music. Thank you so much for supporting this project! 

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any business venture, there is a financial risk that has to be taken. This record is no exception to that. Making a record is expensive, but despite this, we want to do it right.

Our greatest fear in this process is failing to reach our fundraising goal. Money is the most significant obstacle that we have to overcome. Regardless, we believe that we will make it to our goal!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word! Share our page on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. Tell your friends and your friend's mom! Please give us your feedback. We want you to be a part of this project. We can't do this without you!

@headcasetheband

story:
The Opera

Thumbprint is inspired by the extraordinary transformation of Mukhtar Mai, a young illiterate woman whose world was shattered by an act of brutality that could have destroyed her. Instead, she discovers a weapon– her voice – and against all odds, to the astonishment of her country and herself, she seeks justice and finds it. The worst thing in my life is also the best, she says: it has given my life meaning.

The music draws equally on South Asian styles (including Hindustani raga and tala, Pakistani Qawwali music, and 60s Bollywood) and the Western operatic tradition. The libretto by Susan Yankowitz originates from her original monologue and personal interviews with Mai.

Thumbprint premiered in the 2014 PROTOTYPE Festival in New York City, and will have its West Coast premiere at LA Opera, running from June 15-18th. (More information and tickets here).

The Recording

We have the opportunity to make a commercial-quality recording from the LA premiere. We have the funding to cover the cost of the actual recording, but we need additional funding to cover:

  • $3000 for additional fees for the conductor, singers, and instrumental ensemble
  • $5000 for mixing and mastering
  • $2000 for CD duplication and graphic design

Pre-Order Your Copy

By pre-ordering your copy of the recording, you can help us meet the rest of our recording costs! We also have fabulous perks at higher levels of support, including the new album from operatic surf-noir ensemble Bombay Rickey, an autographed copy of the original Mukhtar Mai monologue by librettist Susan Yankowitz, and much more!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to pre-order your copy at this time, you can still help us by sharing our campaign on social media.

Thanks for your support!
