story:
Who are we?

For those who don't know us, we are BRANDEN & JAMES, a very unique cello-vocal duo. We play classical versions of pop-tunes and some originals as well. We've spent the last two years perfecting our sound and promoting a message of authenticity and transparency. The passion comes through in our music and has provided a wealth of work and opportunity to continue playing concerts around the world--many of which YOU have come to! 

BRANDEN is an operatic tenor originally from Southern California, who spent years singing in America’s top opera houses, and then later was a finalist on America’s Got Talent.

JAMES, an Aussie from Adelaide, is a high school music teacher turned performer, who has had the privilege of performing with Olivia Newton-John, Bernadette Peters, and Idina Menzel amongst many others. In addition, James has been the musical mastermind behind all of our very distinctive arrangements.

We formed as a duo in 2015, and have been playing in all sorts of venues across The United States, Mexico, South Africa, and Australia. We've also traversed the globe playing our unique shows on luxury cruise liners. Because of this, we've been lucky enough to already reach thousands of people with our music. 

 

The Ins & Outs

With your help, we now have the opportunity to make a GLOBAL impact with our music.

This album features a 14-piece studio orchestra, complete with strings, woodwinds, piano, bass, and percussion.  Appearing on the album will be both familiar covers from decades new and old, and exciting original songs composed by Academy, Grammy, Dove Award winning songwriters. Our producer, Patrick Hamilton is a major player in the classical-crossover world. We have handed the reigns over to him to provide us with world-class production and fresh, new arrangements that have completely enhanced our sound. 

Joining us on the album is a very special celebrity guest singer. We couldn’t be more thrilled to collaborate with this consummate artist. Please stay tuned for an announcement from us later in the campaign.

You'll get to go behind the scenes with us and see exclusive sneak peeks from our time in the studio in Belgium, listen to teasers of some recordings as they become available, and feel the excitement of our progress as we get closer to reaching our goal. 

We need at least $50,000 in order to record the album with Patrick. This covers the producer fees only, so our IDEAL GOAL is actually $100,000 which would pay for the following:

PRODUCTION COSTS (rights to cover songs, songwriter fees, production of physical copies, album artwork, etc.)

PUBLICITY AND PROMOTION (album artwork and design, photo shoots, publicizing the album and our brand once it’s complete and shopping the album around to potential labels)

DISTRIBUTION (release of the album, assuring it gets in the ears of everyone possible through streaming platforms, digital outlets, and music sharing sites)

We took a big risk by taking on this recording project, but from the results we've heard so far, we believe it will be incredibly rewarding for all of us! 

PERKS: everything you need to know!

Perks are incentives offered to you, our album backers in exchange for your support. We've created some amazing perks for this campaign. We think there are some very special and personalized experiences on offer, but no matter how much you donate,  a digital download of the album is coming your way. 

Other exciting exclusives include:

  • Signed copies of Branden’s new book A Life Lived with Purpose (working title)
  • Tickets to an upcoming BRANDEN & JAMES show
  • A Skype or FaceTime session from us complete with a musical performance! Or if you're old school, we can just make it a super fun phone call
  • Your name on our album as a producer
  • A personalized recording of a song you've always wanted to hear from us - just for you!
  • One of a kind, hand-painted mini cellos delivered to your house AND dinner on us in your city
  • House concerts 
  • Dinner parties cooked by us in your home, complete with a concert for you and your friends.

​And introducing…

BRANDEN & JAMES SUPERFAN MEMBERSHIPS

Membership includes:

  • Free downloads of future released recordings. This is only the beginning for us!
  • 2 superfan t-shirts
  • Superfan recognition on the BRANDEN & JAMES website 
  • 2 VIP tickets annually to any BRANDEN & JAMES (public) concert of your choice.
  • Exclusive (never-before-seen) audio and video content from BRANDEN & JAMES concerts
  • Signed copies of all of our new recordings released during your membership.

See below for all Perk fine print.

 

How your support will help us

The affirmation we’ve received from all of you confirms that, although we’ve only been playing together a couple of years, we were meant to be doing this. YOU—our family of listeners, fans and supporters have helped define us and shape us from the very beginning.

Just like Billy Joel, we got our start in a piano bar. With each year, we’re expanding to new and exciting venues to play at across North America and beyond: Performing arts centers, world-famous cabaret venues such as 54 Below in New York City, universities, and celebrity-filled charity events. 

This is such an important step for us in our journey as artists. Producing an album of this quality is expensive, but with your support, we will continue to grow and develop at a faster rate than we could ever achieve by ourselves. By asking for your support, we are effectively making YOU the producers of our album. We are recording this album because we want to inspire more people in the way that many of you have already been inspired. We also want to offer something new and fresh to those of you who have been following us since the beginning.

We took a huge risk and have already spent the initial $50,000 to make this album. But we have faith in our fans and in our work thus far, that we're making the right decision. 

Other Ways You Can Help

While not everyone can contribute money to our campaign, (don’t worry, we totally understand) there are other ways you can help us. Start by getting the word out there to anyone and everyone about our campaign. Share the campaign through Indiegogo, or on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. You can always email your friends directly, too. The more people who hear about the campaign, the more likely we are to succeed!

The Perks: Fine Print

1. Digital Downloads will be available to you as soon as the album is released. 

2. Physical Copies signed CD’s and signed download cards will take a bit longer as we’ll be 3. depending on manufacturing deadlines and the good old postal service for these. But we’ll email with updates and notify you once it’s shipped. 

3. The 54 Below LIVE Recording will take place when we perform there on October, 18, 2018. Once we have the performance mixed and mastered, we will send out the recording as a digital download.

4. Branden’s memoir is set to be released sometime in 2019. This has been a huge year for us, adding a 65,000 word book to our line-up of work. But we’ve been thrilled to spread our wings into new and uncharted territory. Generally, books are released within one year of the manuscript deadline (which is October, 2018). So sit tight! We’ll send some secret excerpts from the book to everyone who buys it and the signed copy will come just as soon as we get our hands on it. 

5. To redeem the 2 VIP tickets, check our website for our upcoming tour dates, and notify us at least 30 days in advance of the show date, and we’ll take care of the reservation for you. We’ll also give you a big, giant hug after the show. These tickets are only available within Australia, the continental United States and Mexico and do not include cruises or any concerts of a private nature. Only ticketed events are available for redemption. Purchaser is responsible for providing their own travel to and from the venue and subsequent accommodation.

6. The Virtual Concert must be scheduled on a date and time that is agreed upon mutually. We want to be in a place where we can provide the best sound possible for you, and we want to make sure you have everyone there that you’d hoped. Must be redeemed within 12 months. 

7. Your producer credit will appear in the liner notes of the physical copy (CD or download card) after the album is released. We will be in touch with you to make sure you have exactly what you want written in there. This is YOUR big moment! 

8. We love to take a stab at playing songs across all genres, however the recorded song must be a cover song with published lyrics and must be approved by Branden and James. Not every artist can pull of any type of song, and we’re no exception to that rule. 

9. The Painted Cello is something that we have committed to hand deliver to you in your city. The mini cellos are approximately 30 inches long (for comparison James’ full-sized cello is 48 inches long) and will come with a stand so it can be showcased as a piece of art. This is only redeemable in the continental United States, Mexico, Australia and some larger cities in Canada. Since Mexico, Canada and Australia are a bit of a trek for us, they will be delivered in the window that we are there performing our shows. For example, if we’re in Aus. for three weeks in 2019, that’s when the painted cello will travel with us. We’ll be in communication with you month in advance to ensure we’re in town at the same time. We will cover our own travel and accommodation costs for the delivery of the cello.

10. Superfandom is the gift that keeps on giving! But please be aware, the deliverables are subject to potential management release requirements and again, the postal service.

11. A House Concert will be a huge effort on all of our parts and must be redeemed at a mutually agreed date and time and within 24 months of purchase. As we mentioned earlier, the purchaser must have access to a piano or full-sized electronic keyboard with weighted keys. If renting one for the evening, the purchaser is responsible for all costs associated with such rental. If the house concert is held outdoors, specific sound equipment must be utilized in order for us to provide the best sound possible for you. This equipment must be rented by the purchaser who will accept full responsibility of the costs of such rental.  The repertoire for the house concert will be decided by Branden & James, but we will happily prepare a couple of reasonable requests for the event. Branden & James will provide their personal travel and accommodation costs surrounding the date of the house concert. They will be unable to fly in any earlier than one day before the concert and must leave after the house concert is finished if their schedule requires such. Please see clause number 10 for Superfandom rules. 

12. The Dinner Party and House Concert date must be redeemed at a mutually agreed upon date and time and within 24 months of purchase. Dinner party and house concert must take place on the same day or evening. Same requirements listed above in clause 11 for the house concert apply. For the dinner party portion, Branden and James will organize a menu to accommodate everyone’s dietary restrictions. We request that dinner be served and eaten before the house concert begins in order to give us a little bit of time to prepare for the concert. Branden & James will provide their personal travel and accommodation costs surrounding the date of the house concert and dinner party. They will be unable to fly in any earlier than one day before the concert and must leave after the house concert and dinner party is finished if their schedule requires such. Please see clause number 10 for Superfandom rules.
story_txt:
Who are we?
For those who don't know us, we are BRANDEN & JAMES, a very unique cello-vocal duo. We play classical versions of pop-tunes and some originals as well. We've spent the last two years perfecting our sound and promoting a message of authenticity and transparency. The passion comes through in our music and has provided a wealth of work and opportunity to continue playing concerts around the world--many of which YOU have come to! 
BRANDEN is an operatic tenor originally from Southern California, who spent years singing in America’s top opera houses, and then later was a finalist on America’s Got Talent.

JAMES, an Aussie from Adelaide, is a high school music teacher turned performer, who has had the privilege of performing with Olivia Newton-John, Bernadette Peters, and Idina Menzel amongst many others. In addition, James has been the musical mastermind behind all of our very distinctive arrangements.

We formed as a duo in 2015, and have been playing in all sorts of venues across The United States, Mexico, South Africa, and Australia. We've also traversed the globe playing our unique shows on luxury cruise liners. Because of this, we've been lucky enough to already reach thousands of people with our music. 
 

The Ins & Outs
With your help, we now have the opportunity to make a GLOBAL impact with our music.

This album features a 14-piece studio orchestra, complete with strings, woodwinds, piano, bass, and percussion.  Appearing on the album will be both familiar covers from decades new and old, and exciting original songs composed by Academy, Grammy, Dove Award winning songwriters. Our producer, Patrick Hamilton is a major player in the classical-crossover world. We have handed the reigns over to him to provide us with world-class production and fresh, new arrangements that have completely enhanced our sound. 
Joining us on the album is a very special celebrity guest singer. We couldn’t be more thrilled to collaborate with this consummate artist. Please stay tuned for an announcement from us later in the campaign.
You'll get to go behind the scenes with us and see exclusive sneak peeks from our time in the studio in Belgium, listen to teasers of some recordings as they become available, and feel the excitement of our progress as we get closer to reaching our goal. 
We need at least $50,000 in order to record the album with Patrick. This covers the producer fees only, so our IDEAL GOAL is actually $100,000 which would pay for the following:
PRODUCTION COSTS (rights to cover songs, songwriter fees, production of physical copies, album artwork, etc.)
PUBLICITY AND PROMOTION (album artwork and design, photo shoots, publicizing the album and our brand once it’s complete and shopping the album around to potential labels)
DISTRIBUTION (release of the album, assuring it gets in the ears of everyone possible through streaming platforms, digital outlets, and music sharing sites)
We took a big risk by taking on this recording project, but from the results we've heard so far, we believe it will be incredibly rewarding for all of us! 
PERKS: everything you need to know!
Perks are incentives offered to you, our album backers in exchange for your support. We've created some amazing perks for this campaign. We think there are some very special and personalized experiences on offer, but no matter how much you donate,  a digital download of the album is coming your way.  
Other exciting exclusives include:

Signed copies of Branden’s new book A Life Lived with Purpose (working title)
Tickets to an upcoming BRANDEN & JAMES show
A Skype or FaceTime session from us complete with a musical performance! Or if you're old school, we can just make it a super fun phone call
Your name on our album as a producer
A personalized recording of a song you've always wanted to hear from us - just for you!
One of a kind, hand-painted mini cellos delivered to your house AND dinner on us in your city
House concerts 
Dinner parties cooked by us in your home, complete with a concert for you and your friends.

​And introducing…

BRANDEN & JAMES SUPERFAN MEMBERSHIPS
Membership includes:

Free downloads of future released recordings. This is only the beginning for us!
2 superfan t-shirts
Superfan recognition on the BRANDEN & JAMES website 
2 VIP tickets annually to any BRANDEN & JAMES (public) concert of your choice.
Exclusive (never-before-seen) audio and video content from BRANDEN & JAMES concerts
Signed copies of all of our new recordings released during your membership.

See below for all Perk fine print.

 
How your support will help us
The affirmation we’ve received from all of you confirms that, although we’ve only been playing together a couple of years, we were meant to be doing this. YOU—our family of listeners, fans and supporters have helped define us and shape us from the very beginning.
Just like Billy Joel, we got our start in a piano bar. With each year, we’re expanding to new and exciting venues to play at across North America and beyond: Performing arts centers, world-famous cabaret venues such as 54 Below in New York City, universities, and celebrity-filled charity events. 
This is such an important step for us in our journey as artists. Producing an album of this quality is expensive, but with your support, we will continue to grow and develop at a faster rate than we could ever achieve by ourselves. By asking for your support, we are effectively making YOU the producers of our album. We are recording this album because we want to inspire more people in the way that many of you have already been inspired. We also want to offer something new and fresh to those of you who have been following us since the beginning.

We took a huge risk and have already spent the initial $50,000 to make this album. But we have faith in our fans and in our work thus far, that we're making the right decision. 

Other Ways You Can Help
While not everyone can contribute money to our campaign, (don’t worry, we totally understand) there are other ways you can help us. Start by getting the word out there to anyone and everyone about our campaign. Share the campaign through Indiegogo, or on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. You can always email your friends directly, too. The more people who hear about the campaign, the more likely we are to succeed!
The Perks: Fine Print

1. Digital Downloads will be available to you as soon as the album is released. 
2. Physical Copies signed CD’s and signed download cards will take a bit longer as we’ll be 3. depending on manufacturing deadlines and the good old postal service for these. But we’ll email with updates and notify you once it’s shipped. 
3. The 54 Below LIVE Recording will take place when we perform there on October, 18, 2018. Once we have the performance mixed and mastered, we will send out the recording as a digital download.
4. Branden’s memoir is set to be released sometime in 2019. This has been a huge year for us, adding a 65,000 word book to our line-up of work. But we’ve been thrilled to spread our wings into new and uncharted territory. Generally, books are released within one year of the manuscript deadline (which is October, 2018). So sit tight! We’ll send some secret excerpts from the book to everyone who buys it and the signed copy will come just as soon as we get our hands on it. 
5. To redeem the 2 VIP tickets, check our website for our upcoming tour dates, and notify us at least 30 days in advance of the show date, and we’ll take care of the reservation for you. We’ll also give you a big, giant hug after the show. These tickets are only available within Australia, the continental United States and Mexico and do not include cruises or any concerts of a private nature. Only ticketed events are available for redemption. Purchaser is responsible for providing their own travel to and from the venue and subsequent accommodation.
6. The Virtual Concert must be scheduled on a date and time that is agreed upon mutually. We want to be in a place where we can provide the best sound possible for you, and we want to make sure you have everyone there that you’d hoped. Must be redeemed within 12 months. 
7. Your producer credit will appear in the liner notes of the physical copy (CD or download card) after the album is released. We will be in touch with you to make sure you have exactly what you want written in there. This is YOUR big moment! 
8. We love to take a stab at playing songs across all genres, however the recorded song must be a cover song with published lyrics and must be approved by Branden and James. Not every artist can pull of any type of song, and we’re no exception to that rule. 
9. The Painted Cello is something that we have committed to hand deliver to you in your city. The mini cellos are approximately 30 inches long (for comparison James’ full-sized cello is 48 inches long) and will come with a stand so it can be showcased as a piece of art. This is only redeemable in the continental United States, Mexico, Australia and some larger cities in Canada. Since Mexico, Canada and Australia are a bit of a trek for us, they will be delivered in the window that we are there performing our shows. For example, if we’re in Aus. for three weeks in 2019, that’s when the painted cello will travel with us. We’ll be in communication with you month in advance to ensure we’re in town at the same time. We will cover our own travel and accommodation costs for the delivery of the cello.
10. Superfandom is the gift that keeps on giving! But please be aware, the deliverables are subject to potential management release requirements and again, the postal service.
11. A House Concert will be a huge effort on all of our parts and must be redeemed at a mutually agreed date and time and within 24 months of purchase. As we mentioned earlier, the purchaser must have access to a piano or full-sized electronic keyboard with weighted keys. If renting one for the evening, the purchaser is responsible for all costs associated with such rental. If the house concert is held outdoors, specific sound equipment must be utilized in order for us to provide the best sound possible for you. This equipment must be rented by the purchaser who will accept full responsibility of the costs of such rental.  The repertoire for the house concert will be decided by Branden & James, but we will happily prepare a couple of reasonable requests for the event. Branden & James will provide their personal travel and accommodation costs surrounding the date of the house concert. They will be unable to fly in any earlier than one day before the concert and must leave after the house concert is finished if their schedule requires such. Please see clause number 10 for Superfandom rules. 
12. The Dinner Party and House Concert date must be redeemed at a mutually agreed upon date and time and within 24 months of purchase. Dinner party and house concert must take place on the same day or evening. Same requirements listed above in clause 11 for the house concert apply. For the dinner party portion, Branden and James will organize a menu to accommodate everyone’s dietary restrictions. We request that dinner be served and eaten before the house concert begins in order to give us a little bit of time to prepare for the concert. Branden & James will provide their personal travel and accommodation costs surrounding the date of the house concert and dinner party. They will be unable to fly in any earlier than one day before the concert and must leave after the house concert and dinner party is finished if their schedule requires such. Please see clause number 10 for Superfandom rules.

story:
Who am I

I've been a lot of things in my life, father, sailor, carpenter, but through it all, musician has been the title that has colored all the rest.  This album is opening doors for me to explore the singer songwriter in me to the fullest extent, and to bring the music, the songs and stories, front row seats and behind the scenes peeks, to you.

Why I'm Here

To make the best album possible in a professional studio with the caliber of talent I have chosen, takes a great deal of time and energy, as well as financial resources.  I expect the final cost to be about $12,000.  I have already spent over $6000 and the recording is nearing completion.  There will still be mixing, mastering, photography, graphic design, marketing and manufacturing costs.  This is where your help will make the rest of this project an overwhelming joy and a big success.

Why I'd like you to come along

Songwriters can have a lot of fun digging into their insides and extracting some of the more profound and bizarre ideas and visions that show up there,  and then fashioning them into songs. Putting an album together to perfect all the musical pieces and wrap them up in an alluring package is the icing on the cake.  It's the thing they can hold up say, see, I've accomplished this!  But the true reward of a singer songwriter is to play for you!

I want to play my songs for you and I hope you will like them and want to hear more.  Without you, I'm just singing to the walls and ceilings. 

How you can help

I'm giving you a few ways to get involved and show your support for me, and independent musicians everywhere. When you decide to come aboard and help in some way, you become part of my clan, my musical familia.  This means you get to hear and see songs and videos that others cannot.  You come behind the scenes with me to get an intimate look at what it takes to make all this happen. 

You can simply decide to contribute any amount you wish, but why not get a little something for your contribution.  Check out the offers of Cds, Albums, Books and Concerts listed on this page.

  

Other Ways You Can Help

Since so much music can be had for free these days, it's begun to seem silly to pay money to be able to listen to music. You may choose not to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  It would be great if you could:

  • Share the word about this Album with your friends and social media contacts
  • Come to a show, bring friends and enjoy the music with me
  • Suggest a location for a show, or ask me about booking a house concert
  • Are you, or do you know someone that works at a newspaper, radio or TV station, that might benefit by hearing about this music and help spread the word.
  • Look up my album, "Almost Home" on Spotify.  Like it and share it around.  Or even better, put a song or two into one of your playlists and share that.  These little things can go a long way and are very much appreciated.

I hope you are inspired to come along.  It may feel like taking a chance, but there really is no down side.  Your interest in my music is the reward that keeps me going, so I am good with anything you are able to contribute toward getting this music spread around.  It's from my heart to your ears.

Enjoy

Peace

Jim

story:
Wait, What?

Has Butch really never recorded before? Well, he has, but not like this. We have some home recordings, some live recordings, and some recordings he did with his cover band. But think of this as his artistic statement. A studio quality album that he can be proud to share. And it will feature collaborations with some of his sons (all of whom are on board with this project).

 

What We Need & What You Get

Okay here's the skinny

  • Recording in a studio costs money.
  • So does producing CDs and Vinyl Records
  • The money you give will go towards the studio time, paying any musicians if need be, and whatever is left will go towards printing the album for those who want a hard copy.

story:
Short Summary

Hey there! My name is Patrick. I perform under the name of Blooming and I'm independent singer-songwriter trying to make a difference in the world with my music.

I write, record and perform music because I choose every day to bring light, joy, love and magic into people's lives. That's why I wake up every day. This world can be a very dark place and I want to be someone who uses their music to help people come back into their power and connect with the joy of living. My work is in service of helping people choose how they'd love to experience life. Everything I do in my life is in service of that.

I'm reaching out to you because I need your help! After more than a year spent writing, planning and creating, I have a collection of songs that are READY for Recording. It's exciting, a little daunting but more than anything immensely satisfying to write this. 
I say this because these songs have already brought so much joy and connection to people when they've been performed. AND-
Now these 5 songs are finally ready to make their way into the world!

This is where you come in. When I recorded my last EP, I crowdfunded $2500 having no idea how much a recording project like this would cost. It was an amazing achievement and I'm still immensely grateful to everyone who supported me. 
BUT- I didn't ask for the financial assistance I actually needed for the project. I forked out an additional $4500 to cover the rest rest of the expenses... On a musician's salary.
I'm proud of the results, but by the end of the whole process I was burnt out, broke and for a while ended up withdrawing completely from pursuing a career in music (The thing I'm here to do).

The momentum I had came to a stumbling halt because I didn't ask for the help I truly needed.

Now I'm back to doing what I love and sharing music from my heart and I want to do this on a wide-spread level. These songs have the capacity to help me do just that.

I want this EP to be collaborative. I want us as a collective to put this thing together. I'm bringing in more and more participation with these songs and having you donate is a massive part of that project. I can say that WE as a collective brought a vision into reality.
 

What We Need & What You Get

In total I've estimated I'll need about $6,800 to cover all the costs of this EP.  It may still not be enough, but it'll cover the vast majority of the project.

These costs include- 
Paying the musicians on the record for Studio and Rehearsal Time ($1350)
The RECORDING!! ($2000)
Mixing ($800)
Mastering ($350)
Artwork from a Genius Graphic Designer ($750)
Printing for Vinyl (est. $1450)
Online Distribution costs ($100)

REWARDS!!
For every donation of $10 and above you will receive a Digital Download of "The City Breathes! You will be given the recording you helped create!

You can also get your hands on Blooming T-Shirts,
Specially made and signed Blooming Artwork,
A Vinyl copy of the EP  
Tickets to the Pre-Release show at Cycles of the Pass (October 26th)
Tickets the Blooming EP Launch in November (Details TBA). 
There are also extra special rewards offered where I will Come to your house and play for You or even Write You A Song. 
 

The Impact

So why bother supporting a project like this?
This is more than just a collection of great songs. This is about serving people in choosing how they want to relate to their circumstances-
Choosing to record this EP has coincided with returning to the city I love, Melbourne.

I adore this city- it's filled with a palpable magic that makes the creator within me sing. It's alive, rich and full of colours, light and texture. But to me, it seems that many people just want to run away from it all-
It's too much. Too big. Too ugly. It's soulless. It chews people up then spits them out after sucking them dry. That's the narrative I get from a number of people- That the city is dark, cold and devoid of goodness.
This EP offers a different perspective- It looks at a city in all it's beauty and ugliness and faces it all with open arms. It's a call to love and embrace it, or at least CHOOSE how we want to experience it. By facing the city as it is, in it's entirety we can collectively consider and engage in creating the city we'd love to live in.
 

Risks & Challenges

The most difficult thing in producing this EP is reaching out and asking for your help. My tendency to try to do things entirely on my own has made things much harder than they need to be. I already feel like I'm asking a lot, but I'm honestly trying to lay down what the actual costs are for this project to release this music at the standard it deserves. Following that, the biggest challenge I perceive is raising the money needed to make this EP happen. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every single dollar you put towards this EP is so valued and appreciated. It means more than you know.
That being said, if you don't have any cash to help record this EP and the project inspires you, then PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN. 
If you have already donated, please share this project you are a part of!
Also- BE IN TOUCH. If you can think of another creative way you can help to record this EP then please let me know. As I mentioned, I want this EP to be collaborative. Contact me if and let's see what we can cook up together to make this thing happen!!

COLLABORATION-

I have said that this project is collaborative and I mean that. Beyond donating and sharing this project to come to life, I want to hear more than just my voice on these songs.

All the Day- This is a song for all the women in my life as well as the earth- the great life giving force to all we have. If you are a woman (or identify as such) and want to give your voice to a powerful song that honors women and the feminine, please contact me on the email below.

Take the Weight Off- This is the final track on the EP and it's about slowing down, connecting back to the joy of life and relaxing into the flow of things. I would LOVE to have a group of people singing the chorus of this song.

I wanna make love and I wanna feel it
I wanna sing a song and actually mean it
I wanna break down to the beauty of my synthesis
And quit wasting my time, my time, my time 

 

bloomingandmusic@gmail.com/bloomingmusic

story:
First off — 

Thank you for taking time to check out the page and read this. Chances are you are a friend or family member, and I truly appreciate and love each of you! Through many bands and seasons of my life I have felt the love and support of those around me, and it means so much!

Backstory - Since I was 17 I have been part of a "band" in some way or another. I never wanted to be a solo artist or even entertain releasing music under my name or anything like that. Over time I just kept feeling like these songs were a little more personal than usual. These songs were mostly my story and my journey and I felt it most appropriate to release them as a solo artist. 

Light of Day EP - These songs have been on my mind and my heart now for about 3 years or so. Each of them have their own unique sound and story. My prayer is that this EP takes you on a journey through the valley of despair and up to the mountain of praise while taking all the roads in between. 

Why Indiegogo? - In all honesty it is hard to afford and pull off even a 5 song project. I am looking at this Indiegogo campaign as much more of a "preorder" than a fundraiser. By no means am I asking for a handout, but am hoping to offer quality merchandise and perks in exchange for your funds to help bring this music project to life! Once again, I can't say thank you enough for the love and keeping up with my journey thus far!

Perks —

In order to make it a little more fun for you to donate to the project, I've got some merch that's inspired by some things I like as well as the overall vibe of the songs. Refer to the perks on the page for what's included in each level, and here for a bit more detail on items:

Digital - Sure, you could stream the EP when it releases — or you could get it now from here!

CD - Still rocking a CD player in your car or at home? Pressed and printed with love in Chattanooga by the good folks at WTS Media!

Vinyl - It's been a dream to have songs I've written pressed to vinyl, and this project seemed like the perfect opportunity for it! Mastered by Rare Form Mastering for your turntable in all its warmth and pressed by Heavy Grooves in California. 12" LP.

Tees - See below!

 

 

THANK YOU —

To my wife Natalie - for all of the love and support of this journey. I know it's not easy being married to a musician or creative but you've stood by me and encouraged me all the way through! I love dreaming big with you and conquering goals alongside you. Here's to many more.

To Kyle Barrett -  for all the time and creative thought and input. You are a true friend and talent my brother. 

To Shane Selby & Makayla Mckibben - for the love and support, and driving to the middle of nowhere to be a part and share your gifts. I am extremely grateful for both of you! Much love always.

To my City Church Family - for constantly encouraging and standing with the team and I musically and creatively. These songs have our story threaded through them and I pray they bring joy and peace.

story:
Support a great cause and help dementia patients find themselves, through music.

Your donations will put a new iPod shuffle, headphones and music into the hands of dementia patients.

Millions of people and caregivers suffer from the effects of Alzheimer's disease, and music has been proven to ease that suffering.

Where medications have failed, music has succeeded. You can help improve the lives of those affected by this disease by giving hope and peace through music. It's not just those with the disease you will be helping. It's the families. It's the workers. It's their friends. It's your family. It's for everyone who has loved someone who has forgotten who they are. If you love people, love music, (hopefully both) or have been affected by this, we are asking for your help.

We are true believes in the MUSIC & MEMORY℠ program and what it does to bring personalized music to senior living communities across the country. This program introduces a way to bring music into the lives of people, specifically those with Alzheimer’s or dementia. Playing personalized music is therapeutic and has been linked with slowing memory loss, increasing recognition and recollection, and improving the lifestyles of residents using the program.

The power of music is real and you can see for yourself the power of it in the documentary Alive Inside, which was ignited by the clip of Henry. This has motivated us and so many others around the country to bring this miracle to our residents and families in need.


This is important to us as we know the struggles that workers, residents and families have to go through dealing with Alzheimer's and dementia. We have witnessed first-hand the power that this program has, and the effect it has on those we care for. And we need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

We wanted to make this as easy as possible for everyone involved, so we are asking for donations to get new iPods and music to alleviate the work of refurbishing used ones. MUSIC & MEMORY℠ is a fantastic program and we wanted to take it to the next level. An iPod shuffle isn't much, but it works miracles just like the rest, and will simplify this process for our team and residents.

The Impact

You will directly improve the lives, minds and health of thousands of people. 

We have all heard of Alzheimer's disease, but for those of who have witnessed it or lived it, the soul crushing power this disease has over our lives is insurmountable. 

  • Help ease the suffering caused by an epidemic bigger than you have imagined.
  • Improve the quality of life for our residents.
  • Improve peace-of-mind for the families of our residents.
  • Reduce stress for our caregivers.
  • Bring smiles, singing and head nodding to our hallways.
  • Bring life to those who feel lost. 

  • Spread love, life and beauty

    A Risk Worth Taking
    We understand that some may not be aware of the traumatic effects of dementia or Alzheimer's, and if they do, may not believe in the power that music possesses. All we ask is for you to take a few moments and review the information with an open mind and assess the research for yourself. This is real.

    Through our joint partnership with     MUSIC & MEMORY℠ we are certified and qualified to bring this program to our friends in need. This isn't based on hope and opinion, there is science here. See for yourself.

    Sharing is Caring, and is Just as Important as a Donation: Make Some Social Music

    Your voice and support is just as powerful as a donation. Please help us spread the word about the Miracle of Music.
    • You can share the campaign link on your Facebook wall.
    • You can email the campaign link to friends and family.
    • You can tweet the campaign on Twitter.
    • You can share the link with Alzheimer's, dementia or any music related Facebook or social page or group.
    • You can tell everyone at social functions and gatherings.
    • You can post a flyer at the local store, church, laundry or pub.
    • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Contact your favorite artists and ask for their support and to share across their social networks.
    • Make sharing with and helping others a part of your life wherever you go.
    • Follow, engage and support us on all our links: Facebook, & Twitter.
    • Post links to this campaign on YouTube comments, blogs and news articles.
    • Follow, engage and support MUSIC & MEMORY℠
    • Attend a viewing of the Alive Inside documentary.

    Rewards Beyond Altruism

    There is no greater reward than bringing joy and life to those we care about by battling an epidemic that affects millions of lives. But we also have these great rewards to say thank you for your support and belief in the Miracle of Music.

    Exclusive Supporter Sticker


    Handwritten Thank You Card


    I Believe In The Miracle Of Music T-Shirt 
    (5.4 oz Port Authority, Lime, 2-color. Email full name and shirt size to miracleofmusic.us@gmail.com or you will be sent a large.)


    One-Of-A-Kind Hand-Crafted Vinyl Record Bowl


    The Miracle Worker's Canvas Tote Bag


    Gold Record Sponsor Record Plaque


    Platinum Record Sponsor Record Plaque

    Thank you for all your help and support from everyone at Walker Methodist, MUSIC & MEMORY℠ and all of our memory care residents whose lives you helped improve.

    Keep in touch and stop back for more updates, perks and new ways you can help support the Miracle of Music. And let us know what we can do to improve our campaign or new perks you would like to see.

    Thank You

story:
My name is Taunya Kay and I am doing this for my daughter Halle.  She is a Junior at Box Elder High School and since she was little she has always loved taking pictures.  I have always tried to encourage anything that my girls show a passion for.  I have been a single mother to 2 wonderful girls for the past 14 years.  I have never been the type of person to ask for help in any way, but last year was a rough year for us.  I am swallowing my pride and putting this out there because she is such a good kid and her face just lights up when she talks about the trip her school has offered.

She has the opportunity to go to New York City with her Fashion Merchandising class through Bridgerland Applied Technology College.  She is so excited because before she heard about the trip she was already looking at a college in New York.  The School of Visual Arts offers exactly what she wants.
The only problem is Halle had 2 concussions while she was a cheerleader.  After the 2nd she developed social anxiety, therefore we don't know if she will be able to handle New York.  This trip gives her the perfect opportunity to experience life there for 5 days & 4 nights with people she is familiar with. Hopefully this will build her confidence and help her realize her dream of being a professional fashion photographer.
The trip will cost $1350 which includes everything except food.
She will get to attend 2 Broadway shows, visit the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the FIT-view exhibit, take a Waterway cruise around Manhattan and the Statue of Liberty, visit Greenwich Village, SOHO, Little Italy, Chinatown, the World Trade Center Memorial and St Paul's Chapel, Take a walking tour of Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller Center and Central Park, and the most exciting for her is the 2 Professional Fashion Workshops because one will be a Photo Shoot with Lee Clower.
I have already put down the deposit to hold her spot that is why I am not asking for the entire amount.

Please check out the perks we have available.
Please help to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Red Tack's new record, 'Judy'.

Two years ago, I released my first solo record, '(K)Night of the Sorrowful Face', to critical acclaim and much adoration from my small but strong circle of friends, family and fans.  The record was successfully funded here on this platform by an amazing group of supporters. I have finally gathered the courage to do it again, and I hope we can be as successful as we were the first time around, perhaps even more so! 

  • Some of you may already know me, but if you don't, I'm Colorado musician and long time guitarist/songwriter, Ted Thacker. I've named my solo act, The Red Tack (yes, an anagram). This year, I've decided to add some great musicians to the thing for good measure, and I started in the studio.
  • Ex-Baldo Rex drummers John Call and Dave Willey, two of Colorado's best drummers and musicians, have both joined me in the studio to create some real magic on a handful of songs. John plays his thundering rhythms on the anthemic Satellites, and Dave adds his rhythmic ballet to two brand new songs that I've never even played live yet. I also have the local legendary drum wizard, Jeffrey Mince, once Nina Hagen's tour drummer, playing on some of the album's coolest songs. I have a new addition to my band, Billy Pigati, a force majeure of songwriting prowess himself, he came just in the nick of time, and we will record two of the albums hits to be. There is also a blazing trumpet solo by longtime boulder musician extraordinaire, Grant Rieder on the title track. You'll have to wait to hear that one!
  • I also have big dreams and have set my sights high for the musicians joining me for the recording of the rest of the record. Devotchka's Tom Hagerman and Shawn King have both agreed to lend some magic, as has Cedric Lemoyne, an old family friend who just happens to play bass for Alanis Morrisette, and the amazing and beautiful, Rose of the West. It's not enough to say that these folks would definitely bring the magic level of this record up to eleven.   
  • I have been, and will be, recording and mixing the majority of this record in my own house and in the excellent, millenium falcon of a studio that I recorded the last record in. This studio belongs to another amazing Denver legend, musician and engineer, Kyle Richard Jones. 

I've recorded the majority of the album already, this is just the last push to get it finished.

  • 42 is the magic number, it's the meaning of the universe. But I only need a tad more than that. I will be able to pull off some feats of creation with $5200 for the final mixes, the mastering and the pressing and production of the vinyl record. Of course, if we can surpass that number I'll be able to reach out even further into the world with my music. With your help, this can be a big thing, maybe?
  • Along with becoming part of a great group of supporters, each and every donor will get some really amazing stuff from me that can't be had anywhere else. All second tier and above donors will receive a CD copy of my old powerhouse band, Veronica, Emerging From Troubled Days, a local DIY punk/rock scorcher I made in my basement with the amazing musicians, Andrew Koch and John Call. 
  • For the first time, I'm offering t-shirts, courtesy of a sweet screen that my good friend and local artist and musician, Morgan Hill made for me. These shirts will be as DIY as you can get and you will be able to choose your own custom color and size, and I can even print something on your own, one of a kind shirt from a thrift store (not kidding, if you want it on an old western shirt or a dishrag you use, as long as it prints, I can make it).
  • I have also enlisted the impeccable talents of Denver's beloved illustrator Karl Christian Krumpholz. His art can be seen all over Denver, on Colfax avenue street signs and every week in the Westword. He has done the cover for 'Judy', and we will be printing a very limited number of signed copies of the original. 

The Red Tack 'Judy' will be one of your favorite albums of next summer!

This release will only be available in the physical world on colored vinyl. As my last record was, this will be a surprise color for everyone. It will, of course, be available upon release, across your favorite platforms, but to make the deal meaningful for the low end bids, I will be sending out both demo and final mixes to pledgers right as they come from the studio. This will be weeks before they hit the airwaves and digital platforms. Everyone will also be receiving a copy of Veronica's last CD, 'Emerging From Troubled Days'. It's an excellent record in it's own right and should get your car party started every time you play it. 

We did it once, why can't we do it again?!

We've done this before, and it was both really fun and everyone loved the end product. 

  • My recording chops have only gotten better through the process, and I'm excited to make this record pop with more fun sounds and musical treats for the ear. 
  • Yes, it's going to be a challenge, but I'm excited to tackle it.

Can't pledge, but still want to help?

If you can't pledge, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out for me! Tell your music loving friends about it.
  • You can use the cool Indiegogo share tools!

We've done this before, and it was both really fun and everyone loved the end product. 

My recording chops have only gotten better through the process, and I'm excited to make this record pop with more fun sounds and musical treats for the ear. 
Yes, it's going to be a challenge, but I'm excited to tackle it.


Can't pledge, but still want to help?
If you can't pledge, that doesn't mean you can't help:

You can use the cool Indiegogo share tools!

story:
**ENGLISH VERSION BELOW**

¿QUIÉN SOY?

Hola! Mi nombre es Claudia Avila, tengo 34 años y soy músico profesional: cantante, pianista y directora coral. Hice mi pregrado en la Universidad de los Andes (piano y dirección coral) con grandes maestros, y luego me fuí a Suiza a perseguir un sueño que tenía desde que tengo memoria: estudiar canto. Allí, en Basilea, encontré mi voz a través de la música barroca y clásica; una voz potente, que tenía mucho por decir. Paralelo a esto, tuve la gran fortuna de trabajar haciendo conciertos de música folclórica latinoamericana de la mano de mi gran amiga Vittoria Pagani en la guitarra. Junto a ella, y con el gran apoyo de la Dra. Yvette Sánchez, directora del Departamento de estudios latinoamericanos de la Universidad de St. gallen (Suiza), pude reconectar con mis raíces y enriquecer mi corazón y mi voz. Y al regresar a Colombia en el año 2015, exploré de la mano de talentosos colegas cantantes la forma de interpretar la música popular, y el fuego que siento al cantarla siguió creciendo. 

Hace poco más de dos años, en un taller de liderazgo declaré ser la mejor cantante de Colombia y, por fin, después de mucho aplazarlo, a mediados de 2018 tomé acción y comencé a hacer un disco que fuera fiel reflejo de quién soy y de qué quiero decir. Es un sueño que, realmente, lleva en mi desde siempre: llegar con la música y con el canto a todo el mundo; expresar lo que mi corazón siente y conectarme con todo aquel que me escuche. Contar mis historias, las historias de otros, las historias de todos como seres humanos que sentimos, vivimos, lloramos, amamos intensamente y reímos desde el alma. Seres humanos con una misión. 

He descubierto el poder que tiene la música, y lo que genera en mí el cantar: el sentirme viva cada vez que me paro en un escenario a hacerlo. Y esa vida es lo que me impulsa a escribir, componer, arreglar y dejar este disco como testimonio de este sentir. Es por esta razón por la que, después de haber vivido fuera de mi país por tanto tiempo y explorado en tantos géneros de la música, he decidido darle rienda suelta a uno de mis más grandes sueños: consolidar mi primera producción como solista, incursionando de lleno en el género de la música popular. 

Amo el jazz, y siempre me ha causado curiosidad cómo este género se fusiona con otros, y permite explorar la improvisación sobre bases rítmicas diversas. Y las composiciones que encontrarás en este disco tienen como elemento en común el trío de jazz (piano, bajo, batería), acompañado por otros instrumentos pertenecientes a la música folclórica sudamericana. Y de la mano de mi gran amigo, el maestro David Zuluaga, llevamos esta fusión a otro nivel, al integrar elementos electrónicos en los arreglos. Esto le da un toque único y un color hermoso a mi música. 

Me encantaría poder tener este disco en mis manos y compartirlo con el mundo, y para ello requiero de tu apoyo económico y de tu contribución. Este aporte hará que mi sueño se haga realidad  y así poder seguir aportando al arte y a la música de mi país; podré llevar mis canciones al mundo entero y compartir con todos ustedes lo que siento cuando canto. La felicidad de hacer lo que siempre he amado hacer. 

 

¿CUÁNTO REQUIERO?

Para la realización de este CD requiero un capital de US12.000, los cuales serán destinados en su totalidad a cubrir costos de:

-Pre y producción del disco

-Honorarios de músicos participantes en la producción

-Costos de estudio

-Producción física del CD

Hacer un disco no es barato, y menos cuando es un disco hecho al 500%, con todo mi corazón y mi amor puestos en el. Tengo la bendición de contar con grandes maestros que me apoyan como mi productor, el gran David Zuluaga, quien ya tiene en su haber un premio Grammy Latino por su impecable trabajo con el grupo CLARALUNA. También cuento con la hermosa voz y el increíble talento de Rubén Chávez, musico y bailarín colombiano y quien también es mi amigo de la vida, mi hermano, mi familia. Y como si fuera poco, el talento impecable de mi amigo de toda la vida, el bajista colombiano José David Rojas. Ellos, junto a grandes músicos y artistas, ponen su talento y su amor también en este disco, por lo que los fondos recaudados en este crowdfunding irán a pagar sus honorarios, así como también los costos de horas de grabación, producción y masterización.

 

TODO APORTE CUENTA, desde USD1 en adelante... contar con tu colaboración hará a diferencia y me apoyará a alcanzar mi meta!!!

¿QUÉ VAS A RECIBIR?

Creo firmemente que en el recibir también se esconde el privilegio de dar; es por esto que, dependiendo el valor de tu apoyo, te harás acreedor a unos "perks", que son los siguientes: 

USD25: Copia autografiada del disco

USD75: Clase personalizada de canto (lírico o popular) y copia autografiada del disco

USD100: Clase de baile en pareja personalizada (géneros: salsa o bachata sensual) y copia autografiada del disco

USD250: Concierto acústico privado para ti y tus amigos en tu casa. Si vives fuera de Bogotá o Colombia, lo haremos posible a través de Facetime o Skype. 

USD350 EN ADELANTE: Invitación a concierto acústico en un teatro por definir en Bogotá, en donde interpretaré mis canciones y algunos covers. Si vives fuera de Bogotá o Colombia, lo haremos posible a través del envío de un DVD con este concierto, y una dedicatoria especial para ti.

 

¿CÓMO MÁS PUEDES APOYARME?

Si no tienes el dinero en este momento, no te preocupes! También me puedes apoyar de las siguientes maneras: 

*Haz ruido y comparte el link de esta campaña con todos tus conocidos. De pronto, en alguno de ellos encontraremos alguien que nos apoye económicamente, o con la difusión de mi campaña. 

*Utiliza tus redes sociales para apoyarme; comparte este link vía instagram, facebook, Whatsapp... vía email... vía señales de humo! Cualquier medio es válido!!!!

Desde YA te agradezco por tu tiempo y por tu apoyo. Es muy importante para mi el saberme merecedora de tu amor, tu apoyo y saber que crees en mi.

 

Gracias, gracias, estoy agradecida!!!

ENGLISH VERSION RIGHT HERE!!!

 

WHO AM I?

Hi! My name is Claudia Avila, I’m 34 years old and am a profesional musician: Singer, pianist and choral conducter. I did a bachelor degree at the Universidad de los Andes (piano and choral conducter) and studied with amazing teachers. After finishing I left to Basel, Switzerland, to pursue a dream I had since I can remember: to study singing. There, at Basel, I found my voice through baroque and classical music; a powerful voice, with so much to tell. Parallel to this, I had the amazing fortune to work as a Latin-American folk music performer, with my great friend, the Italian guitarist Vittoria Pagani. With her, and the amazing support of Prof. Dr. Yvette Sánchez, the School of Humaninties and Social Sciences (SHH-HSG) head master at the St. Gallen University (Switzerland), I reconnected with my roots and enlightened my heart and my voice. When I came back to Colombia in 2015, explored a way to perform popular music, working hand-in-hand with great and talented colleagues, and that fire I feel when I sing it kept growing inside of me.

A while ago, during a leadership workshop, I declared in the middle of the woods, to be the best Colombian singer. Now, after a long time postponing it, I took action and started to work on a project: a disc that could be the best reflection of who I am and of what I want to say. It is a dream that has been with me ever since: to reach the entire world with my music and my voice.  To express what my heart feels and to connect with everyone who listens to me. To tell my stories, other people stories; those stories that make us be the human beings that feel, life, cry, love and laugh from our soul. Human beings with a mission.

I have discovered the power of music, and what singing does with me; it makes me feel alive every time I stand on a stage to sing. And that life I feel, is what drives me to write lyrics, music, arrange and to leave this album as a testimony of that feeling. This is why, after have lived outside my country for so many years, and exploring so many musical genre, I have decided to work on one of my biggest dreams: to create and consolidate my first soloist production, venturing in the popular music genre completely.

I love jazz, and it’s been always a huge curiosity the way this music style has been mixed with others; it allows the improvisation over diverse rhythmical basis. The music compositions that you will find in this album have the jazz trio (piano, bass, drum set) as a common element, working along with different instruments belonging to the South American folk music. And working along with my great friend, David Zuluaga, music producer, we have taken this fusion to another level, playing and having fun with some electronic elements. This gives a very unique touch to my music.

I would love to have this album in my hands and to share it with the entire world. In order to do that, I need your support and contribution. This will help me to make my dream come true, so I can be an active part of the music and performing arts in my country. I will be able to carry my music around the world and to share with all of you, guys, what I feel when I sing. The happiness to do what I’ve always loved to do.

 

HOW MUCH DO I NEED?

For this CD album, I need an amount of USD$12,000, which will be destined completely to cover this list of expenses:

-pre and post production

-Musicians fees

-study hours

-CD ellaboration

To make a CD álbum is not very cheap. Less when it is an álbum created 500% with all my heart and love invested in it. I have the amazing blessing to have great musicians who support me, such as David Zuluaga, who already has a Latin Grammy for his impeccable work with the group CLARALUNA. I also count with the amazing voice and talent of Rubén Chávez, Colombian musician and dancer who happens to be also one of my best friends, my brother, my family. And last but not least, the impeccable talent of my friend for life, the bass player Jose David Rojas.  They all, among great and talented musicians and artist, are putting their talent and love too in this album. This is why, the money collected in this crowdfunding will go to cover their fees, as well as the hours study, production and master.

EVERY SINGLE CONTRIBUTION COUNTS, from USD1 and beyond… to have your contribution will make a huge difference and will help me to reach my goal!!!

WHAT WILL YOU GET IN RETURN?

I strongly believe that behind receiving, hides the privilege of giving; this is why, and depending on how much you can donate to my campaign, you will receive some “perks”, which are:

*USD25: CD Signed copy

*USD100: Private couple dance lesson (Salsa or bachata sensual) and a CD signed copy

*USD250: Private acoustic concert for you and your friends AT YOUR HOUSE!! If you live outside Bogota or Colombia we can make it happen via Facetime or Skype

*FROM USD350: An invitation to an acoustic concert at a theater in Bogotá, in which I will sing my songs and some covers. If you live outside Bogota or Colombia, we will make it happen through the shipment of a DVD with this concert, and a special dedication to you!!!

HOW ELSE CAN YOU SUPPOR ME?

If you don’t have the money right now, NO WORRIES! You can still support me like this:

*Make some noise and share this crowdfunding campaign with all the people around you. Maybe, hidden among them we can find someone who is willing to contribute finantially or making some noise, as well!

*Using your social media to; share this link via instagram, facebook, whatsapp... email...smoke signs! Any way you can come up to, is allowed!!!

I thank you right away for all your time and support; it is very important to me, knowing I deserve your love, support and that you believe in me.


Thank you, thank you, I'm grateful!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Nate Engberg. I am passionate about spreading the gospel and encouraging the church through music, and that's what my upcoming album, Steadfast, is all about.

I began writing songs for the church in high school, not knowing at the time that my passion would lead to the production of my first album ten years later. Looking back, I can say that this collection of songs is representative of my spiritual growth into who I am today. Ultimately every song points back to where it all started: the desire to serve God and encourage the church.

After high school, I attended Northwest Nazarene University for three years to pursue a degree in music. By the time I graduated, I had a dream of becoming a Christian recording artist. Now it is finally time to make that dream a reality. 

 

Music for the Church

"Steadfast" is both the name of my first single and the complete album because that one word describes the theme of the album as a whole. It is a call to Christians to stand firm for Jesus in a world that is doing its best to defame His name. As a Christian songwriter, I have two goals that I endeavor to meet in all of my music: the first is to provoke thought about the gospel, and the second is to encourage the church through theologically sound, Bible-based lyrics.

I have selected the best of my songs for this album, and I believe that each song has the potential to speak into your life. This music can also be used as a tool to share your faith with others because every song alludes to the greatness of God's saving grace, and I hope it will spark many conversations about salvation. 

Why Indiegogo?

I am launching this campaign because I know I can't do this project alone. I believe that any attempt to minister to the needs of the world and the church requires the blessing of God and the support of His people. With your help, we can have an impact on people's lives and spread a little more light in a dark world.

What We Need

For this project to be fully funded, I will need $10,000 to complete the album, get it into your hands, and distribute it to the music market. All of the funds be used to create a high-quality album, print Perk merchandise, and distribute the products to the people who have contributed to the campaign.  Please refer to the pie chart and description of each budgeted expense to see how each dollar is being spent.    

  • Recording Studio: This covers cost of studio recording and mixing at the rate of $200 per song. The studio I am working with is Kyle Stuck Productions.
  • Mailing Costs: All mailing costs are included in the reward tiers, meaning that you do not have to pay extra for shipping and handling on top of your pledge.
  • Musicians: We have an excellent team of musicians that are lending their talents to this project. As a musician myself, I'm not asking them to work for free. 
  • CD Printing and Distribution: This includes the cost of printing the CDs and registering the album for global distribution and performance rights. 
  • Rewards: This includes the cost of printing the $1 - $100 tier perks (excluding CDs).
  • Mastering: This is the final layer of polish on the album. A professional will evaluate the album with a fresh perspective to adjust the mix to resemble the quality of songs that you hear on the radio. 
  • Indiegogo: Indiegogo charges a 5% commission of raised funds in return for the use of their platform. In this case, with a 10k budget, they receive $500.
  • Misc. Expenses: For those unforeseen expenses that will inevitably arise such as commuting, advertising, replacing or upgrading equipment, etc. (This also rounds the budget out to a nice even 10k)
  • Original Album Art: We are commissioning Ben Aitken Art to do an original painting that will be used for the official album cover. 

Backer Perks

We have a wide range of perks to meet any budget, but most importantly, we want to say thank you for your support! We are grateful for every dollar that is contributed to help get this album off the ground.
  • $1 - Thanks for doing what you can! Within 24 hours, you will receive an email with a digital copy of the namesake track of the album, "Steadfast." 
  • $15 - This will secure a preorder for your "sponsor edition" copy of the album, plus you will receive the digital download of the "Steadfast" single. 
  • $50 - You will receive a signed 11"x17" poster of the Album cover, plus you will receive all of the previous perks. 
  • $100 - In addition to all previous perks, you will receive a music book with lead sheets for all of the songs on the album. 
  • $500 "Track Sponsor" - Your name will be listed under a track title in the album booklet as the sponsor for that track, plus you will receive all of the previous perks and four additional copies of the album to share with family and friends. 
  • $1000 "Super Sponsor" - Your name will be listed under the "Special Thanks" section in the album booklet, and I will travel to your location to perform a personal concert at your home or church. In addition, you will receive all of the $1-$100 perks and nine extra copies of the album to share with family and friends.

In the event that this project does not get fully funded through this campaign, the funds raised would go toward the immediate necessities such as paying the studio and musicians. We would then pursue other avenues of fundraising in order to meet the necessary budget.

The Band

The biggest challenge of this project is accurately transferring what I hear in my head onto a CD for you to enjoy. Luckily, I have a great team of musicians who are experts on their instruments that will help bring this project to life.

Kyle Stuck - Studio Engineer

Kyle is a freelance musician, music educator, and studio engineer who has been on both sides of the music industry. After touring with his local band, Kyle decided to pursue a music degree, specializing in music industry, and he now owns his own recording studio under the name "Kyle Stuck Productions." Kyle lives in Nampa, Idaho with his wife and children.

Edwin W. Wheeler III - Acoustic Guitar

Edwin is a professional musician, teacher, and ordained minister in the Church of the Nazarene. Growing up in a musical family, he developed a fascination exploring, discovering, and creating music. "God created the universe by the sound of his voice. He deposited that same generative power into humans and gave us his same tools--speech, sound--the ability to give life to something new through music. The musician, the songwriter, the singer... it's incredible to think that by producing music, we are reflecting the very nature of God." Edwin lives and works in Ontario, Oregon with his wife, Robin, and two young daughters.

Nick Elliot - Electric Guitar and Supplemental Strings

Nick Elliott is a multi-instrumentalist. Inspired by blues guitarists like Buddy Guy, Robert Cray, and Eric Clapton, he started playing guitar at the age of 15. Since then, he has branched out into playing many different instruments in many different genres. He also plays in a worship band for a high school youth group. Nick was born and raised in the Seattle area and now resides in Kuna, Idaho with his wife. See more of Nick's work on his YouTube Channel:    https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNx2z8gBG5DhuR.... 

Jared Sene - Bass

Jared Sene is the band and orchestra director at Lone Star Middle School in Nampa, Idaho. He also teaches private classical trombone lessons and jazz bass lessons to beginning through advanced students. As a bassist, he plays around the Treasure Valley and has had the opportunity to tour the Northwest playing bass and trombone. Jared currently plays trombone in the Boise Millennial Choir and Orchestra and bass in the Treasure Valley Swing Band, among freelancing. Besides making and teaching music, Jared enjoys golfing, researching useless information about cars, and spending time with his wife Adriana, who is also a music teacher.

Jonathan Fulwood - Drums

Jonathan Fulwood is a recent graduate of Northwest Nazarene University. While at NNU he studied engineering and was involved in multiple musical groups including the Northwesterners and Jazz Revival.  During his time as a student he interned with Power Engineers, and he now works as a transmission line engineer with the same company. Jonathan lives in Nampa, Idaho with his lovely wife. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can be a part of our team in more ways than contributing funds.

To meet this goal we need as many eyes on this project as possible, so please consider sharing this campaign on your social media network of choice.  You can also visit my website at nateengbergmusic.wixsite.com/nemusic and sign up for the newsletter to get regular updates about the Indiegogo campaign as well as other projects. You can find me on Twitter @Engbergmusic and you can follow me on Facebook at Nate Engberg Music. 

Lastly, please be in prayer for the project. Pray that the goal of this project would always be to glorify God and that He will use this campaign to further His kingdom.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi! My name is Nate Engberg. I am passionate about spreading the gospel and encouraging the church through music, and that's what my upcoming album, Steadfast, is all about.
I began writing songs for the church in high school, not knowing at the time that my passion would lead to the production of my first album ten years later. Looking back, I can say that this collection of songs is representative of my spiritual growth into who I am today. Ultimately every song points back to where it all started: the desire to serve God and encourage the church.
After high school, I attended Northwest Nazarene University for three years to pursue a degree in music. By the time I graduated, I had a dream of becoming a Christian recording artist. Now it is finally time to make that dream a reality. 

 
Music for the Church
"Steadfast" is both the name of my first single and the complete album because that one word describes the theme of the album as a whole. It is a call to Christians to stand firm for Jesus in a world that is doing its best to defame His name. As a Christian songwriter, I have two goals that I endeavor to meet in all of my music: the first is to provoke thought about the gospel, and the second is to encourage the church through theologically sound, Bible-based lyrics.
I have selected the best of my songs for this album, and I believe that each song has the potential to speak into your life. This music can also be used as a tool to share your faith with others because every song alludes to the greatness of God's saving grace, and I hope it will spark many conversations about salvation. 
Why Indiegogo?
I am launching this campaign because I know I can't do this project alone. I believe that any attempt to minister to the needs of the world and the church requires the blessing of God and the support of His people. With your help, we can have an impact on people's lives and spread a little more light in a dark world.

What We Need
For this project to be fully funded, I will need $10,000 to complete the album, get it into your hands, and distribute it to the music market. All of the funds be used to create a high-quality album, print Perk merchandise, and distribute the products to the people who have contributed to the campaign.  Please refer to the pie chart and description of each budgeted expense to see how each dollar is being spent.    


Recording Studio: This covers cost of studio recording and mixing at the rate of $200 per song. The studio I am working with is Kyle Stuck Productions.

Mailing Costs: All mailing costs are included in the reward tiers, meaning that you do not have to pay extra for shipping and handling on top of your pledge.

Musicians: We have an excellent team of musicians that are lending their talents to this project. As a musician myself, I'm not asking them to work for free. 

CD Printing and Distribution: This includes the cost of printing the CDs and registering the album for global distribution and performance rights. 

Rewards: This includes the cost of printing the $1 - $100 tier perks (excluding CDs).

Mastering: This is the final layer of polish on the album. A professional will evaluate the album with a fresh perspective to adjust the mix to resemble the quality of songs that you hear on the radio. 

Indiegogo: Indiegogo charges a 5% commission of raised funds in return for the use of their platform. In this case, with a 10k budget, they receive $500.

Misc. Expenses: For those unforeseen expenses that will inevitably arise such as commuting, advertising, replacing or upgrading equipment, etc. (This also rounds the budget out to a nice even 10k)

Original Album Art: We are commissioning Ben Aitken Art to do an original painting that will be used for the official album cover. 

Backer Perks
We have a wide range of perks to meet any budget, but most importantly, we want to say thank you for your support! We are grateful for every dollar that is contributed to help get this album off the ground.


$1 - Thanks for doing what you can! Within 24 hours, you will receive an email with a digital copy of the namesake track of the album, "Steadfast." 
$15 - This will secure a preorder for your "sponsor edition" copy of the album, plus you will receive the digital download of the "Steadfast" single. 
$50 - You will receive a signed 11"x17" poster of the Album cover, plus you will receive all of the previous perks. 
$100 - In addition to all previous perks, you will receive a music book with lead sheets for all of the songs on the album. 
$500 "Track Sponsor" - Your name will be listed under a track title in the album booklet as the sponsor for that track, plus you will receive all of the previous perks and four additional copies of the album to share with family and friends. 
$1000 "Super Sponsor" - Your name will be listed under the "Special Thanks" section in the album booklet, and I will travel to your location to perform a personal concert at your home or church. In addition, you will receive all of the $1-$100 perks and nine extra copies of the album to share with family and friends.

In the event that this project does not get fully funded through this campaign, the funds raised would go toward the immediate necessities such as paying the studio and musicians. We would then pursue other avenues of fundraising in order to meet the necessary budget.
The Band
The biggest challenge of this project is accurately transferring what I hear in my head onto a CD for you to enjoy. Luckily, I have a great team of musicians who are experts on their instruments that will help bring this project to life.
Kyle Stuck - Studio Engineer
Kyle is a freelance musician, music educator, and studio engineer who has been on both sides of the music industry. After touring with his local band, Kyle decided to pursue a music degree, specializing in music industry, and he now owns his own recording studio under the name "Kyle Stuck Productions." Kyle lives in Nampa, Idaho with his wife and children.
Edwin W. Wheeler III - Acoustic Guitar
Edwin is a professional musician, teacher, and ordained minister in the Church of the Nazarene. Growing up in a musical family, he developed a fascination exploring, discovering, and creating music. "God created the universe by the sound of his voice. He deposited that same generative power into humans and gave us his same tools--speech, sound--the ability to give life to something new through music. The musician, the songwriter, the singer... it's incredible to think that by producing music, we are reflecting the very nature of God." Edwin lives and works in Ontario, Oregon with his wife, Robin, and two young daughters.
Nick Elliot - Electric Guitar and Supplemental Strings

Nick Elliott is a multi-instrumentalist. Inspired by blues guitarists like Buddy Guy, Robert Cray, and Eric Clapton, he started playing guitar at the age of 15. Since then, he has branched out into playing many different instruments in many different genres. He also plays in a worship band for a high school youth group. Nick was born and raised in the Seattle area and now resides in Kuna, Idaho with his wife. See more of Nick's work on his YouTube Channel:    https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNx2z8gBG5DhuR.... 

Jared Sene - Bass


Jared Sene is the band and orchestra director at Lone Star Middle School in Nampa, Idaho. He also teaches private classical trombone lessons and jazz bass lessons to beginning through advanced students. As a bassist, he plays around the Treasure Valley and has had the opportunity to tour the Northwest playing bass and trombone. Jared currently plays trombone in the Boise Millennial Choir and Orchestra and bass in the Treasure Valley Swing Band, among freelancing. Besides making and teaching music, Jared enjoys golfing, researching useless information about cars, and spending time with his wife Adriana, who is also a music teacher.

Jonathan Fulwood is a recent graduate of Northwest Nazarene University. While at NNU he studied engineering and was involved in multiple musical groups including the Northwesterners and Jazz Revival.  During his time as a student he interned with Power Engineers, and he now works as a transmission line engineer with the same company. Jonathan lives in Nampa, Idaho with his lovely wife.
