You can be a part of our team in more ways than contributing funds.
To meet this goal we need as many eyes on this project as possible, so please consider sharing this campaign on your social media network of choice.  You can also visit my website at nateengbergmusic.wixsite.com/nemusic and sign up for the newsletter to get regular updates about the Indiegogo campaign as well as other projects. You can find me on Twitter @Engbergmusic and you can follow me on Facebook at Nate Engberg Music. 
Lastly, please be in prayer for the project. Pray that the goal of this project would always be to glorify God and that He will use this campaign to further His kingdom.

story:
Unravelling the journey:

In 2015, I embarked on a project to complete my first album, Lines. It was a labour of love, having done almost every part of it myself, from the mixing to the album art. I never commercially released it, instead burning only 50 copies to disc from my own computer, and selling it to my loved ones, and to interested people who saw me perform at events and open mic nights. Lines taught me a lot, and paved the way for my current project, Unravel Me. As a transgender person assigned female at birth, my voice has been a point of great uncertainty in my life. On one hand, I grew up with my voice sounding a certain way, and I loved that voice in many ways. I knew its bounds, I knew how to make to do what I needed it to do. I live with schizophrenia, and music has always been my main creative and emotional outlet. The idea of taking hormones and changing my voice was a terrifying prospect, even though my original voice sounded like it didn't belong to me. When I recorded Lines, I immortalized that voice on an album, along with all the sadness that came with my earlier years. Lines gave me permission to move into a place of excitement and hope for the future. On March 21st, 2018, I began hormone therapy, and on April 5th, 2018, I went back into the studio, this time with a professional audio engineer, and we recorded the first song of Unravel Me. Since then, we recorded 13 tracks, completing the album incrementally over a space of 18 months.

The main goal of my music has always been about relating to people, reaching people with a message of hope and resilience. Unravel Me is bursting at the seams with hope. It details a transformative journey from darkness into a place of light and lightness. This album is inspired by the image of the chrysalis. The caterpillar spins its chrysalis, without knowing it will come completely undone, and emerge as something so ornate and beautiful and new. That, to me, is such an incredible mystery of faith and hope in the unknown. Like the caterpillar, I have taken a proverbial leap of faith, not knowing how my voice will emerge, but hopeful that it will be something that is ever more beautiful in its connection to - and reflection of - who I am. Unravel Me is the documentation of this process of coming undone. Unravel Me is my time in the chrysalis.

The Impact:

As a trans person, I have spent a lot of time reflecting about how little positive representation we get. I've met many trans people, but even when I started considering hormone therapy, no one could say for certain whether I'd be able to keep singing. There is no research readily available on the topic of trans men's voices. Many of the trans men I've met said they used to sing before hormone therapy, and don't sing anymore. Others sing, but less often, or less publicly. I need music like I need air, so I set out on this album journey, determined to never stop singing, and never stop singing passionately. I hope this album will be an example of what the journey of voice masculinization can be - an exciting, terrifying dive into becoming who we truly are.

Because of the unique nature of the project as a documentation of changes to my voice, the recording needed to begin at the start of the changes. Recording commenced April 5th, 2018, and has continued at intervals until September 23, 2019, eighteen months after I began hormone therapy, with the projected release date of April 26th, 2020, which happens to be my 30th birthday! Now that we've finished the recording stage, there is much to be done, and I need your help to make this album happen.

Breaking it down:

I'm fundraising for $2500 to cover the costs of this very collaborative album. First, the cost of recording and mixing of the tracks by the fantastic audio engineer E. Morgan is $1000 even. The album art, created by an incredible Victoria-based artist, F. Leiken, is $500. These two costs are the bare minimum, and I firmly believe in paying artists a living wage, so if I raise more than I need, these two artists will receive a bonus. Next, I'll be using CDBaby for fulfillment and distribution. This price varies, but will likely be between $600 and $750, depending on how many folks order physical CDs. I'm also planning an album release party, and will need to rent a venue which is accessible to the public, including wheelchair accommodation, washrooms, a variety of seating, transit access, and food and beverages to meet different needs. My budget for the party is the lowest on my fundraising priority list, but a good album release party is important to me, still. Anything above the production costs of the album will be put toward this.

What's in it for you:

To make things more fun and interesting, I've created several perks for donations to the campaign. Ranging from the basic signed CD and commemorative merch, to homemade pie, to a personalized song, there's something pleasing for every price point. I've tried to keep everything personal and a little bit playful! Ultimately, I just want to spread the joy of music far and wide, and need some financial support to do that.

Other ways to be part of the impact:

I know not everyone has the resources to contribute. I totally get that! If you believe in the power of music, and the power of sharing our journeys of transformation, then you can help by spreading the word. The farther this campaign reaches, and the more its message of hope and connection spreads, the better. Use those share tools, tell your friends and families and neighbours and complete strangers, if that pleases you. You'll be helping one little voice be as loud and proud as possible!

story:
Tales from t'Dales is the debut from native Yorkshire emcees Doberman & Breathless; an album birthed from the disillusion of dead-end jobs, ambiguous romantic attachments, the weight of social expectation and the blinkered existence of bored young men in a small market town.

"A refreshing and honest example of Northern Hip Hop, we need more like this." 
- Hip-Hop Kings

"The duo could become a central tenet of the northern hip hop scene."
- UKHH.com

Ey up, I'm Doberman. Now that I've hyped the album up in third person and pinched some online criticisms of it to reassure the skeptics that it's not shit, I feel the time is right for me to tell you a bit about the project itself, how it came about, what it means to us, and why we're reaching out to you good people to get it made up in a physical format...

 

"Who the f*ck are Doberman and Breathless?" A bit of backstory

So, basically me and Breathless are two emcees from Irish Fields Collective, which is our "crew" if you like, consisting of:-

Doberman (me): Emcee
Breathless: Emcee
Glum: Emcee/Producer
Bottom Lip: Producer/DJ
Earl Swirl: Producer/8th Dan Wasteman

Essentially, we were all mates from school back in Yorkshire who have always been connected by our love of music in some way or another - whether that was moshing in someone's basement, touring the pubs of Otley as an Arctic Monkeys soundalike band, or embarking on underaged outings to Jungle nights in the arse end of Leeds.

From about the age of 17 onwards the sound that united us was UK Hip-Hop. Eventually, as I'm sure all lovers of hip-hop have done at some point, this love evolved into a habit of getting a bit wobbly on cheap booze, putting classic hip-hop instrumentals on, forming a circle and trying to insult each other (and each others' mums) through the medium of freestyle rap.

Eventually, me and Breathless started having our own cyphers on weeknights, when we weren't pissed, and where we brought along our own bars that we'd written beforehand. These were more serious bars, ones about our feelings and that, many of which would eventually form the foundations of some of our first rough tracks as a duo.

 

The Lost Mixtape

In 2015, we started recording at DubWhy Studios with ExP (former Sinoptic Music label boss, founder of YouTube series WYCypher, and one third of Flame Griller), with serious ambitions to make an Irish Fields mixtape. 

We recorded material for the best part of the year, occasionally dropping a low-hanging fruit of our labours on Soundcloud, but as fate would have it, we all moved for some reason or another. With myself in Birmingham, Breathless in Australia, Bottom Lip in Leeds, Earl SwirI in Worthing (I think...somewhere not too far from Brighton anyway) and Glum in South America, the project got parked, and has been sat on the shelf ever since.

 

"Yeah it's a nice story mate, maybe get to the point though..."

 

Tales from t'Dales, like the stillborn mixtape that preceded it, was a genuine labour of love. Thankfully, while the likelihood of getting five lads to finalise a project without being in the same room was looking bleak, me and Breathless kept working on new material, sending each other beats, bars and track concepts from opposite ends of the world.

When Breathless said he’d be back for a few weeks in the summer of 2017, I suggested we get back in the studio and do an EP. After using up all the holiday I could to get more recording time, the EP soon snowballed into an album: Tales from t’Dales.

 

"Ah okay. So what you wanting money for again?"

 

In addition to commemorating the album's anniversary, by getting physicals of it made we hope to achieve two things:-

1) Thank those who have shown us love and support by giving them the opportunity to not only have a physical copy of it, but also to get their hands on some super-limited, extra dank, one-time-only merch.

2) Help word of Doberman, Breathless and the Irish Fields Collective spread further – we want a professionally packaged product that we can hand out to more publications, more radio stations, and more randoms after the open mic. 

Getting there however, requires a bit of generosity, compassion, and some vocal support. That's where you come in, humble reader (you've read this far, so we already get the impression that you're dead nice).

 

"Alright, how much you after?"

The initial plan is to raise a minimum of £300 for a run of 100 CDs printed in cardboard sleeves (a bit like the mockup image at the top of the page, only with artwork on the CD itself too). 

For those who are interested in Tales from t'Dales merch but don't want a physical copy of the album, we've incorporated the markup of a CD into the manufacturing prices here, meaning that all pledges will effectively contribute to the initial run of 100.

Those choosing to invest in both the CD and some merch will enjoy their copy of the album at a discounted rate.

We've given ourselves 60 days to do this, not because we think it'll take that long to raise 300 quid, but because we want to raise the maximum amount of funds possible. We've set ourselves the initial £300 target because we think it's achievable, and because a run of 100 copies was the most reasonably priced deal we could find for a relatively small print run.

However, on the off chance we receive more funding than expected, we'd love to be able to spend any "profits" from the merch mark up on even more CDs!

 

"What you gonna do if you don't raise £300?"
 

If this happens, the contributions that we do have will still go towards some CDs, and we will message individual pledgers to ensure that they still get what they've paid for - we'll just do our best to raise the remaining funds through some more old school fundraising methods - busking, getting in a bath of beans...whatever it takes, we'll get it done eventually.

In addition to commemorating the album's anniversary, by getting physicals of it made we hope to achieve two things:-1) Thank those who have shown us love and support by giving them the opportunity to not only have a physical copy of it, but also to get their hands on some super-limited, extra dank, one-time-only merch.
2) Help word of Doberman, Breathless and the Irish Fields Collective spread further – we want a professionally packaged product that we can hand out to more publications, more radio stations, and more randoms after the open mic. Getting there however, requires a bit of generosity, compassion, and some vocal support. That's where you come in, humble reader (you've read this far, so we already get the impression that you're dead nice).
 
"Alright, how much you after?"
The initial plan is to raise a minimum of £300 for a run of 100 CDs printed in cardboard sleeves (a bit like the mockup image at the top of the page, only with artwork on the CD itself too). For those who are interested in Tales from t'Dales merch but don't want a physical copy of the album, we've incorporated the markup of a CD into the manufacturing prices here, meaning that all pledges will effectively contribute to the initial run of 100.Those choosing to invest in both the CD and some merch will enjoy their copy of the album at a discounted rate.We've given ourselves 60 days to do this, not because we think it'll take that long to raise 300 quid, but because we want to raise the maximum amount of funds possible. We've set ourselves the initial £300 target because we think it's achievable, and because a run of 100 copies was the most reasonably priced deal we could find for a relatively small print run.However, on the off chance we receive more funding than expected, we'd love to be able to spend any "profits" from the merch mark up on even more CDs!

 
"What you gonna do if you don't raise £300?" 
If this happens, the contributions that we do have will still go towards some CDs, and we will message individual pledgers to ensure that they still get what they've paid for - we'll just do our best to raise the remaining funds through some more old school fundraising methods - busking, getting in a bath of beans...whatever it takes, we'll get it done eventually.

story:
Backstory

The idea for Big Turnips came about in November 2016 in an unfinished basement in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia. While we were lamenting that so many talented songwriters end up never preserving their songs on a high-quality, durable medium (read: vinyl), something clicked. Why couldn't we take up that lofty goal of saving beautiful songs before they're forgotten? Organizing, recording, mixing, mastering, and production would be a heck of a task, but since we had more time than money we set off on this adventure in earnest.

We thought of John and Alan Lomax traveling the world recording cultural tunes that reverberate through new minds today, broadening their concept of music and life. We thought of our hometown hero, Helen Creighton, who went all around Atlantic Canada in the 1930's recording local cultural music and interviews, capturing a part of our home that we would never have heard without her.

Sitting atop the shoulders of those three giants, we started something amazing.

Big Turnips Volume 1 is a collection of 15 songs by 11 artists recorded by Stephen McIntosh and produced by McIntosh and Dylan Jewers between January and October 2017 at the Halifax Central Library Media Studio. The songs and artists on this compilation come primarily from Atlantic Canada -- Nova Scotia in particular. Some are relatively new, while one tune, "Harbour Grace," is the oldest English song from the Province of Newfoundland and is perhaps over 300 years old.

Some these songs are quintessentially Eastern Canadian. "Black Rock Beach" by Mama's Broke is a harrowing look back at the old days of public executions and witch hunts. "Dino's Lament" by Basil is a peek into the world of Gottingen Street, one of Halifax's most historic roads. And "Scotia Stream" by The Good Woods is a brief, modern shanty which tells the sad tale of a lonely Nova Scotian looking for love at the end of a Scotian gal's fishing line. 

This is only the beginning. We're in the studio every week preserving as many languages, as many songwriters, as many bits of Atlantic Canada as we can.

 

Side A

1. Black Rock Beach--Mama's Broke

2. Spent Too Long in Bed--Young Men & Odd Socks

3. Cost of a Friend--Dan St. Dan Band

4. On the Take--DG Mitchell

5. I Think My Radio's Broke--Mike T. Kerr

6. Harbour Grace (Newfoundland Traditional)-- Dylan Jewers

7. How long till I'm staring at the end?--Lukie Lovechild

8. Red Wine Winter--Bradshaw, Mitchell & Long

 

Side B

1. Scotia Stream--The Good Woods

2. Pacific Blues--Dan St. Dan Band

3. Fastball--Jesse Webber

4. Terrible Man--Odd Socks

5. I Ain't Sad & Lonely No More (I'm Just Sad)--Mike T. Kerr

6. Dracula--The Good Woods ft. David Bradshaw

7. Dino's Lament--Basil

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $2000 to get this project to the vinyl press pronto. This, plus the money we've saved from performances, and showcases around Halifax, as well as merchandising, will give us enough to press 300 high quality vinyl albums from Train Records in Toronto.

For your contribution, not only do you get the eternal glow of helping important passion projects come to life, but you can get tonnes of cool stuff as perks as well! From your standard vinyl copy, to songbooks, digital material, autographed stuff, and loving embraces.

     

    The Impact

    Big Turnips is dedicated to recording, preserving and promoting Folk music of all kinds centered around songwriters and songsters from Atlantic Canada. The project is very much inspired by Dartmouthian folklorist and archivist Helen Creighton who carried this preservation ideal at a time much before iPods or even recording devices smaller than a mid-size sedan. Technology has made these projects easier, which is why it is all the more important to commit the time and logistic energy to make this thing real.

    Things change all the time, thats the lovely world we live in. It is that reality that pushes us to enjoy and respect these musical moments as they pass. And if they're undeniably amazing, once-in-a-lifetime moments, then it would be irresponsible to not preserve them for future listeners.

       

      Risks & Challenges

      There have been multitudes of challenges, but we wont harp on those too much. The main obstacles center around the fact that we started from scratch with no plan or resources at our disposal. Recording so many artists, free of charge, and then completing the mountain of administrative bureaucracy and red tape tested our endurance. Our bright eyes have dimmed slightly, our bushy tails: flattened. Worth it. Worth it a hundred times over.

      The major risk we see is that failing this project, we risk losing this music forever, and it'd be like these wonderful songs, these wonderful events, never happened.

         

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Share on social media!

        Tell your parents

        Add us on Instagram: @bigturnips

        Check us out on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/bigturnips/

        Buy our Promo Cassette at www.bigturnips.bandcamp.com

        Listen to Helen Creighton's recordings. It won't help this campaign, but it'll help you.

story:
Hello everyone, we are Jericho Hill - a high energy rock outfit from Everett, WA! 

We got our feet wet in the Seattle scene in January of 2016- debuting our sound at a rad venue called The Highdive, in Seattle's Fremont neighborhood. 

Since then we have worked hard, played hard, and saved like to crazy to get ourselves into a position where can afford to record our tunes in our favorite studio, with our favorite audio engineer.  We are currently recording at Synergy Productions in Seattle with Sean Walker and Jason Shavey at the helm - and we can't stress this enough: its going to be epic!

The music written for this album represents bits and pieces of our collective stories. From loss of those dear to us, to lonely military deployments in dangerous places, to celebrating the "family" that we've grown with in our music scene - this album represents the best and worst times of our lives. We seek to share our art with the masses, and by completing this album in its entirety, we will exorcise the demons that helped fuel its creation - whilst sealing the jovial moments in digital perpetuity. 

We invite anyone who can, to help us on the final leg of this journey.


We have our release party scheduled for September 8th, 2018, at the very same place we got our start: The Highdive. What we need now is a little extra help covering  mastering and duplication expenses. 

 

How much cheddar do we need, and who is eating it?

What we are asking for is $2000. Here is the breakdown:

  • $420 to master the album. Mastering is a specialized bit of audio engineering used to help a tune achieve total audio creaminess, after we finished with the recording process. 
  • $1580 to duplicate the album. This is the process of having physical copies of the album made to give to you guys, sell in stores, and at shows. 
  • If we don't reach our goal - we will work with whatever donations we do receive and have less copies produced. If we receive funds in excess of our goal, we will use those funds to have additional albums and merchandise produced.
  • Additionally, Malcolm (vocals) has a special vow he's making:

If this campaign reaches funding of $2800. Malcolm will have Chad Kroeger's face tattooed on his body. Yes, you read that correctly. Chad Kroeger. The lead singer for Nickelback. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't contribute financially and that is totally cool. Heck, we are happy you clicked the link and have read this far into our campaign. Here are some other ways you can help:

 

  • Share this campaign with anyone you think would be interested. 
  • Come out to a show and say hi! 
  • Follow us on facebook, spotify, twitter, and youtube

 

Follow us on the interwebs!
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/jerichohillusa
Twitter: @JerichoHillUSA
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRu3yllw6DUnLe...
Instragram: @officialjerichohill
Website: http://www.jerichohillband.com
Email: jerichohillusa@gmail.com

story:
Hi-
It's been a while since you've heard from me. Probably because I've been learning how to build new things with my hands (renovating a barn).  While I've been sifting through demos and feeling like it's the right time for a new album, Richy Vesecky and I have written one song in particular that I feel is particularly special for this time.  I've decided to treat this one song as it's own project (perhaps it's the first step of a new album) and have it recorded and released ASAP.  While I'm usually happy to bring songs into this world via my home recording set-up, I feel compelled to give this song some extra attention.  I keep hearing it in a way that I'm not capable of producing alone at home.  With that in mind, I've asked Danny Blume at Hidden Quarry Studios (along with some other great musicians that I'm really excited to work with) to help me bring this song into this world..

After crunching the numbers, I believe it's going to take about $2000 to record the song properly and pay all the musicians involved.  I'm keeping the goal simple and manageable rather than starting a long drawn out project because I'd like to see this song in the real world by the middle of August. Being that all the pieces are already in place, that shouldn't be a problem at all.

Many of you will be familiar with my previous albums and I'm hoping that my track record will give you faith that your money will be spent properly and to a good end.

If for some reason the generosity is flowing and enough people see this as a good and welcome idea, I'll happily take any extra funds to continue recording the remainder of the songs required for a full-length album. (or perhaps a series of time-released singles :)

Love to all

Sincerely-
Frank Bango

story:
* Pre slovenský jazyk skroluj nižšie

HEY! 

 

I am Eliz Baya, an emerging new artist originally from Slovakia and currently based in London. I have been a professional jazz/ pop/ soul singer for a long time but I have gradually developed a passion for songwriting and am dreaming of creating original music. 

More about me can be found here: https://patriciabajakova.com/singer.html

 

My new musical journey is being shared with a brilliant musician and a producer, Filip Kluknavsky. Both of us, being ambitious & passionate about music, are determined to create our own new sound. We have started our collaboration with the result of our Debut EP; which includes 4 songs in a mix of styles such as pop/ electro/ dance.

 

However, we live in difficult times right now, where artists are being told to put their dreams on hold and wait for the situation to pass. What makes it even more difficult is to be able to support yourself financially due to lack of work in all spheres. These circumstances gave us even more fuel to create and push through, however our Debut EP will not be possible to launch without your financial help.

 

 

 

What We Need 

Even though we have already invested some money into the production to start it up, we are still lacking the finances that will make the EP release possible. There is still plenty of work to be done, which includes the creative process of many more people who will work on:

  • Marketing material
  • Distribution
  • Music Videos
  • Advertising 

Most of the time the team of artists can be underestimated for all the hard work they put into the process and I believe that, especially during these difficult times, they should be financially rewarded. And this is where your financial support will be much appreciated. 

 

What You Get

As a big Thank you for your help, I have included some exciting perks for you! 

£5 + - You get signed photo digitally sent to you

£25 + - You get to listen to the EP earlier than everyone else 

£50+  - You get a signed copy of the CD delivered to your door

£100+ - You get special thank you credit on a music video and a signed copy of the CD delivered to your door

£250+ -You get special thank you credit on three music videos and a signed copy of the CD delivered to your door

£500+  -An invitation to Debut EP Christmas Livestream concert for family & friends and all above 

 

❗️ Of course, feel free to donate any amount of money, as every penny will help and if we do not reach our goal, the funds will still be used to make this EP launch possible, but we will need to recalculate. All you need to do is to click on BACK IT.❗️

 

 

The Impact

This exciting Debut EP is very close to being released; however, it will not be possible without your financial help. All the post-production, marketing and distribution can be draining on finances but still very important for the quality and success of our launch. All your support and contribution are a direct investment into the team of artists and their creative process. 

 

It is important, especially now, to make people happy and get them dancing! And I believe my new music will make this happen and do the magic :) 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Only because you cannot contribute, does not mean you cannot support! I will be very happy if you could use the sharing tools and spread this page to the world via social media platforms or by word of mouth.

 

 

 

Ahoj! 

 

Volám sa  Patrícia Elizabeth  Bajáková, ale  čoskoro ma budete poznať pod umeleckým  menom Eliz Baya. Pochádzam z mesta Prešov, krajina Slovensko, avšak už dlhé roky pôsobím v Londýne. Ako profesionálna speváčka jazz/soul/pop som si časom našla cestu aj k písaniu  textov piesní a skladaní hudby.

 

Po mojej muzikálnej ceste ma bude sprevádzať úžasný hudobník a producent Filip Kluknavský. Keďže obaja sme ambiciózni a zdieľame vášeň pre hudbu, rozhodli sme sa pre spoluprácu na našom spoločnom projekte Debut EP, ktorý zahŕňa 4 skladby v rôznych žánroch,  ako napríklad pop/electro/dance.

 

Tieto ťažké časy,  v ktorých žijeme nás ešte viac poháňajú k dokončeniu nášho projektu.Avšak za  týchto okolností,  nie sme schopní si finančne pomôcť.Týmto Vás chcem poprosiť o pomoc,  bez ktorej nebude možné nielen dokončiť projekt Debut EP,  ale taktiež pracovať ďalej na našich snoch a cieľoch.

 

 

Čo je potrebné

Do nášho projektu sme  od  začiatku vložili svoje nemalé peniaze. Veľa práce nám  vôbec  neprekáža. Stáva sa,  že tím usilovne pracujúcich umelcov,  nie  je  docení. A to je prípad, kedy bude vaša podpora neskutočne vážená a motivuje k tomu, aby sme v tom, čo robíme, naďalej pokračovali. Získané financie ktoré použijeme na dokončenie a vydanie nášho diela- Debut EP budú využité na:

  • Potrebný reklamný materiál
  • Samotnú reklama 
  • Distribúciu
  • Hudobné klipy

 

Odmeny za pomoc

Sme vďační za každú čiastku,  ktorou nás podporíte, každé jedno euro nám pomôže. Financie budú využité aj keď nedosiahneme presnú čiastku nášho cieľu. Stačí len kliknúť na tlačidlo BACK IT.

 

Pre tých, ktorí nás chcú podporiť väčšou čiastkou sme  si pripravili nadštandardné poďakovanie ❗️

£5+ - ako poďakovanie Vám bude digitálne zaslaná podpísaná fotka

£25+ - ako poďakovanie su budete môcť vypočuť naše CD ako prví

£50+  - ako poďakovanie vám zašleme kópiu nášho CD aj s podpisom doručené  k dverám vášho domu

£100+ - špeciálne poďakovanie v titulkoch v jednom v našom hudobnom klipe, spolu s kópiu CD aj s podpisom doručenú k dverám vášho domu

£250+ - špeciálne poďakovanie v titulkoch až troch našich hudobných klipov spolu s kópiou CD aj s podpisom doručenú k dverám vášho domu

£500+ - pozvanie na online živý koncert pre rodinu a priateľov plus špeciálne poďakovanie v titulkoch až troch našich hudobných klipov spolu s kópiou CD aj s podpisom doručenú k dverám vášho domu

 

*Čiastku v eurách môžete vidieť zobrazenú pod librami na pravej strane.

 

Výsledok vašej pomoci

Tento zaujímavý nový Debut EP je veľmi blízko k vydaniu, ale  finálne  práce  na  projekte  nebude  možné dokončiť bez  finančnej pomoci. Post produkcia, marketing a distribúcia je  finančne náročná, avšak  pre  kvalitu veľmi dôležitá. Vaša podpora a príspevok sú priama investícia do tímu umelcov a kreatívneho procesu,  ktorí stoji za týmto novým albumom.

 

Je veľmi dôležité v tomto  období  robiť ľudí šťastnými a vyzvať ich k tancu!  Verím,  že s našou hudbou to ľahko dosiahne :)

 

Ďalšie cesty ako sa dá pomôcť

Aj keď nám nemôžete pomôcť finančne to neznamená,  že nás nemôžete podporiť. Budeme veľmi vďační za každé zdieľanie a preposielanie tejto stránky do celého sveta cez sociálne siete, alebo o nás  poviete  ľudom, ktorých  poznáte.

Most of the time the team of artists can be underestimated for all the hard work they put into the process and I believe that, especially during these difficult times, they should be financially rewarded. And this is where your financial support will be much appreciated.  What You GetAs a big Thank you for your help, I have included some exciting perks for you! £5 + - You get signed photo digitally sent to you£25 + - You get to listen to the EP earlier than everyone else £50+  - You get a signed copy of the CD delivered to your door£100+ - You get special thank you credit on a music video and a signed copy of the CD delivered to your door£250+ -You get special thank you credit on three music videos and a signed copy of the CD delivered to your door£500+  -An invitation to Debut EP Christmas Livestream concert for family & friends and all above  ❗️ Of course, feel free to donate any amount of money, as every penny will help and if we do not reach our goal, the funds will still be used to make this EP launch possible, but we will need to recalculate. All you need to do is to click on BACK IT.❗️  The ImpactThis exciting Debut EP is very close to being released; however, it will not be possible without your financial help. All the post-production, marketing and distribution can be draining on finances but still very important for the quality and success of our launch. All your support and contribution are a direct investment into the team of artists and their creative process.  It is important, especially now, to make people happy and get them dancing! And I believe my new music will make this happen and do the magic :)  Other Ways You Can HelpOnly because you cannot contribute, does not mean you cannot support! I will be very happy if you could use the sharing tools and spread this page to the world via social media platforms or by word of mouth.   Ahoj!  Volám sa  Patrícia Elizabeth  Bajáková, ale  čoskoro ma budete poznať pod umeleckým  menom Eliz Baya. Pochádzam z mesta Prešov, krajina Slovensko, avšak už dlhé roky pôsobím v Londýne. Ako profesionálna speváčka jazz/soul/pop som si časom našla cestu aj k písaniu  textov piesní a skladaní hudby. Po mojej muzikálnej ceste ma bude sprevádzať úžasný hudobník a producent Filip Kluknavský. Keďže obaja sme ambiciózni a zdieľame vášeň pre hudbu, rozhodli sme sa pre spoluprácu na našom spoločnom projekte Debut EP, ktorý zahŕňa 4 skladby v rôznych žánroch,  ako napríklad pop/electro/dance. Tieto ťažké časy,  v ktorých žijeme nás ešte viac poháňajú k dokončeniu nášho projektu.Avšak za  týchto okolností,  nie sme schopní si finančne pomôcť.Týmto Vás chcem poprosiť o pomoc,  bez ktorej nebude možné nielen dokončiť projekt Debut EP,  ale taktiež pracovať ďalej na našich snoch a cieľoch.  Čo je potrebnéDo nášho projektu sme  od  začiatku vložili svoje nemalé peniaze. Veľa práce nám  vôbec  neprekáža. Stáva sa,  že tím usilovne pracujúcich umelcov,  nie  je  docení. A to je prípad, kedy bude vaša podpora neskutočne vážená a motivuje k tomu, aby sme v tom, čo robíme, naďalej pokračovali. Získané financie ktoré použijeme na dokončenie a vydanie nášho diela- Debut EP budú využité na:
Potrebný reklamný materiál
Samotnú reklama 
Distribúciu
Hudobné klipy
 Odmeny za pomocSme vďační za každú čiastku,  ktorou nás podporíte, každé jedno euro nám pomôže. Financie budú využité aj keď nedosiahneme presnú čiastku nášho cieľu. Stačí len kliknúť na tlačidlo BACK IT. Pre tých, ktorí nás chcú podporiť väčšou čiastkou sme  si pripravili nadštandardné poďakovanie ❗️£5+ - ako poďakovanie Vám bude digitálne zaslaná podpísaná fotka£25+ - ako poďakovanie su budete môcť vypočuť naše CD ako prví£50+  - ako poďakovanie vám zašleme kópiu nášho CD aj s podpisom doručené  k dverám vášho domu£100+ - špeciálne poďakovanie v titulkoch v jednom v našom hudobnom klipe, spolu s kópiu CD aj s podpisom doručenú k dverám vášho domu£250+ - špeciálne poďakovanie v titulkoch až troch našich hudobných klipov spolu s kópiou CD aj s podpisom doručenú k dverám vášho domu£500+ - pozvanie na online živý koncert pre rodinu a priateľov plus špeciálne poďakovanie v titulkoch až troch našich hudobných klipov spolu s kópiou CD aj s podpisom doručenú k dverám vášho domu *Čiastku v eurách môžete vidieť zobrazenú pod librami na pravej strane. Výsledok vašej pomociTento zaujímavý nový Debut EP je veľmi blízko k vydaniu, ale  finálne  práce  na  projekte  nebude  možné dokončiť bez  finančnej pomoci. Post produkcia, marketing a distribúcia je  finančne náročná, avšak  pre  kvalitu veľmi dôležitá. Vaša podpora a príspevok sú priama investícia do tímu umelcov a kreatívneho procesu,  ktorí stoji za týmto novým albumom. Je veľmi dôležité v tomto  období  robiť ľudí šťastnými a vyzvať ich k tancu!  Verím,  že s našou hudbou to ľahko dosiahne :) Ďalšie cesty ako sa dá pomôcťAj keď nám nemôžete pomôcť finančne to neznamená,  že nás nemôžete podporiť. Budeme veľmi vďační za každé zdieľanie a preposielanie tejto stránky do celého sveta cez sociálne siete, alebo o nás  poviete  ľudom, ktorých  poznáte.

story:
Grre en famille c’est du reggae-ska à la saveur gipsy! 

Aidez nous à sortir notre nouvel album, il est enregistré, mixé, il s'appelle "Désamorcer la bombe" et vous pouvez meme en écouter des bouts. Il n'a besoin que d'un dernier petit coup de pouce pour être finalisé, imprimé et masterisé.

Depuis deux ans, inspirés de nos rencontres sur la route avec vous, on vous a concocté un deuxième album à l’image de nos concerts, à l’image de la famille, avec des chansons qui débordent d’énergie et d'autres plus planantes.  Il est prêt ! Enfin... presque !

Pour ceux qui nous suivent depuis la France ou même ailleurs, on a une envie folle de venir vous présenter notre nouveau bébé en personne,  mais votre aide sera indispensable pour le faire et ca commence ici!

Alors pré-achetez cet album pour contribuer à ce que la roulotte de la famille continue sur les routes de la musique. 

MERCI de votre soutien et bienvenue dans la famille!

Quand va-t-il sortir?

Mars 2016

Alors il est presque fini?

Oui! Et on en est très heureux! En participant à cette campagne de financement vous êtes certain de recevoir l'album bientôt puisqu'il est déjà enregistré

Mais c'est qui Grre en famille en fait?

Grre en famille c'est à l'origine la rencontre de Grre, un musicien français, avec des musiciens Montréalais qui sont rapidement devenus sa famille! Juliette au Violoncelle, Marina et David aux Violons, Pierre-Olivier aux percussions, Annie au piano et Tim à la basse. 

C'est quoi comme style?

On a baptisé ca Reggae Gipsy (le titre de notre premier album!), mais c'est réellement le mélange de beaucoup d'influences, au moins autant que de musiciens. Des bases de reggae ou de ska, des mélodies gipsy ou plus classiques, des ambiances festives ou plus mélancoliques.

Ca ressemble à quoi?

Des fois à du reggae

Des fois à du ska

story:
About The Roger Wagner Chorale...

In the years following WWII, under the four decade leadership of Roger Wagner, the Chorale became a symbol of goodwill ambassadorship, most notably through its tours to Japan and South Korea. As the progenitor of the Los Angeles Master Chorale, The Roger Wagner Chorale will forever be revered for its contribution to the history and culture of Los Angeles. 

Today, the legacy is rejuvenated under the baton of his daughter Jeannine Wagner, founder of the Wagner Ensemble. Highlighted by the Roger Wagner signature choral style and top quality musicianship, the The Roger Wagner Chorale features Roger Wagner’s American and World folk song classics, along with contemporary and classical world music. 

The Roger Wagner Chorale Goodwill Tour 2017 launches in Los Angeles with a free concert on November 18th @ 8pm, Brentwood Presbyterian Church, 12000 San Vicente Boulevard, Brentwood CA  before leaving for Japan and South Korea on November 23. The tour will include a benefit concert for the city of Koriyama, Fukushima that was devastated six years ago by a 9.0 earthquake, resulting in a 30 meter tsunami that claimed the lives of more than 16,000 people.

The benefit...

The Roger Wagner Choral Institute is working to expand visibility by continuing to showcase its long-standing musicians as well as emerging artists, and promote new works of local, national, and international arrangers and composers, reflecting our diverse voice through music. The Institute also plans to provide in-house training in vocal production and conducting in the Wagner style, educational outreach, and benefit partnerships.

Your tax-deductible contribution...​

In the recent past, members of the Chorale have self-funded a good portion of the expenses of the concerts, tours, and outreach programs, donating their talent and materials. Now we are asking for your support to help cover some of those expenses, but if we don't meet our funding goal, we will still be able to cover a portion of those expenses thanks to you!

During this 70th anniversary year, The Roger Wagner Chorale turns a page in its history. Support our vision and mission by choosing a tax-deductible campaign level that sings for you!

Another way you can help...

We know some of you just can't contribute, but you can help. Please get the word out and "sing" about our campaign.  You can share on Facebook and Twitter by clicking the icons back at the top of this page. Thank you for your heart and your support.

story:
If you know Hungry Skinny, you've probably seen them roll into every show in a different borrowed car. If you don't know Hungry Skinny, they're a rock & roll band from San Francisco. They've gone on 5 Western U.S. tours in the last two years and they recently released their debut self-titled album on vinyl. They've already booked their next tour and it's going to be their longest tour yet. The only problem is they have no way to get there.  They need a van. That's where you come in. If you donate to their campaign, Hungry Skinny will finally be able to buy their own van and live life on the road like they want to. No more renting, borrowing, or hot-wiring weird cousin Kevin's old pickup. The boys are getting serious about Hungry Skinny and a van is the answer. 

So, why help Hungry Skinny out? Well because playing in a band in San Francisco is hard, and because despite a diet of gas station food and working every minute they're awake the numbers still aren't adding up for Hungry Skinny. With each contribution, donors will get vinyl records, personalized artworks, secret postcards, home cooked Italian meals, alluring polaroids and even maybe your name on a secret corner inside the van.

Hungry Skinny has been in love with vans for a long time now. Have you seen the John Wayne's Teeth video? To put it simply, it's time. The band wants to book more show in more places and having a van that can get from point A to point B is essential. They've rented, they've borrrowed, they've overborrowed, and now it's time to have a van all their own. It doesn't matter what color it is, or what size it is, or how many wheels it has. This van will be the Hungry Skinny van and they will love that van. Help make it happen. Help Hungry Skinny buy a van. And the next time you see them pull up to a show you'll know that they got there because of you and on your behalf. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are also hosting a fundraising party on Saturday, September 24th, at Light Rail Studios, the studio where we recorded our album. It's also Sean and Remy's birthday show. They have the same birthday. We'll be playing with some of our favorite friends and some of our newest favorite friends from all up and down the West Coast. If you can't donate, fine, but come to the party and watch us throw one hell of a kickback. Watch us work the door, Watch us work the bar, Watch us work the stage. Saturday, September 24th at Light Rail Studios. event

Please donate, please come to the party, and please share this anyway you can. Everything helps and thank you.

story:
About Us and Our Mission

Our band consists of four friends that came together with the hopes of spreading what we have in common...our love for music and our passion to make a difference in the places we visit. This May we will embark on a two-week tour down the East Coast where we will promote awareness regarding the importance of women's shelters, homeless shelters and arts organizations within communities. We will be performing at fundraisers, benefit concerts, music venues and busking. 

Studying at the acclaimed Conservatory of Music at SUNY Purchase, we (Leah, Corry, Andrew and Jack) are extremely excited to get on the road to share our music, meet new people and make a difference anywhere we can. 

This tour cannot happen without help from our communities, friends, and families. Every contribution, no matter the size, is important to us!


We're Serious!

We are very serious when it comes to music and making a difference in the world. We are confident that this tour will be life changing experience for us and the organizations we work with. We have been preparing for a tour such as this our entire musical careers. Members of the band have played at venues such as Pianos, Birdland, Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center and at the New York City Couture Fashion Week. This is just the beginning of life long journey using our music to make a difference in this big world!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $11,000 - To go on this tour, share our music, and make a difference in the communities we visit.

8% of the funds we make will be going to PR! This is going to help us tell the public what we are doing, who we are and what we want to do!                                    

53% of the funds are going to expenses for travel! This includes the van rental, gas, tolls, food and anything that is going to help us get to and from these organizations and venues in order to promote awareness of their importance within communities!

14% will go to musical supplies and insurance for the tour! This goes towards gear and various supplies that will make our performances truly resonate with our audience.

25% will go to to taxes and Indiegogo!  These are the processing fees and taxes associated with raising money via Indiegogo.

*In return for your support we have a variety of perks from silly love letters, to private house shows!


The Impact

Your donations will give us the means to reach each of these organizations and support their mission.

Newport, Rhode Island 

-Benefit concert at Jimmy’s Saloon for The Women’s Resource Center in Newport

Philadelphia, Pennsylvania 

-The Bethesda Project

Washington D.C., Virginia 

-Fundraiser for Mercy Kids Africa at Madams Organ

Chincoteague Island, Virginia 

-The Chincoteague Cultural Alliance

Virginia Beach, Virginia 

-The Judeo-Christian Outreach Center

Atlantic City, New Jersey 

-The Covenant House New Jersey

AND MORE!

* If our campaign is over-funded the money will be donated directly to the organizations we work with!


Be a Part of the Journey! 

With your support we can make a difference in people's lives through our music. We want YOU to be a part of our journey as we reach out to communities. 
Your generous contributions will help us collaborate with organizations and the people within them. We encourage you to follow our social media accounts which will highlight all our events and performances, you will be a part of the journey and can see how much of a difference your contributions and support will be making.

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you are unable to donate to our Mama and the Stops East Coast Tour Campaign, that's alright! Here are other ways you can help...

  • Take a second to share this campaign with everyone you know and keep sharing!

  • Know a booking agent at a music venue?

  • Do you have a friend who prints band t-shirts or other merchandise?

  • Got a spare room to offer for when we’re on tour?

  • Know a talented graphic designer?

  • If you have any other ideas, let us know!

We can't thank you enough for your love and support!!!

Got a spare room to offer for when we’re on tour?
Know a talented graphic designer?

We can't thank you enough for your love and support!!!

story: Hi I'm Myla. As the middle of 2015 starts rolling around, I have decided that I would like to put more of my music/songs out into the world. I will be creating a 3-4 song Demo Ep with just me and my guitar. I feel that this is a straightforward, yet awesome way to start getting my career in the right direction. Since a very young age I knew that I wanted to incorporate music in my life. As I grew so did my dream, and now I'm here at the age of 18; wanting to make music my whole life. My goal is for people to listen to this demo and know a little more about me at the end of it. All funds will go towards mixing the demo, even if the goal is not met. I have the tracks and the producer; now all I need is a little help from you all! With you guys I can make this amazing, and I'm beyond excited for this next part in my journey. Come enjoy it along with me :).
story_txt: Hi I'm Myla. As the middle of 2015 starts rolling around, I have decided that I would like to put more of my music/songs out into the world. I will be creating a 3-4 song Demo Ep with just me and my guitar. I feel that this is a straightforward, yet awesome way to start getting my career in the right direction. Since a very young age I knew that I wanted to incorporate music in my life. As I grew so did my dream, and now I'm here at the age of 18; wanting to make music my whole life. My goal is for people to listen to this demo and know a little more about me at the end of it. All funds will go towards mixing the demo, even if the goal is not met. I have the tracks and the producer; now all I need is a little help from you all! With you guys I can make this amazing, and I'm beyond excited for this next part in my journey. Come enjoy it along with me :).

story:
Comme vous le savez probablement tous... En juillet 2016, notre ami et collègue Olivier Jacques fera le saut dans la ligue des mariés... Mais avant ce moment magique, un clan d'ami marquera l'histoire et le foie de notre Olivier préféré.

Pour l'occasion, nous avons organisé une épopée unique en son genre.

Un roadtrip endiablé.

Une journée bien arrosée.

Des challenges à réaliser. 

Des activités surréalistes. 

Jack Bauer ne survivrait pas notre 24h.

Bien que nous ne pouvions inviter tout le monde à être présent, chacun d'entre vous pourront contribuer à faire de cette épopée une réussite et visionner le résultat. Comment?

10$ pour payer une bière ou un shooter à Oli (à vous de choisir). 

Le 24 h sera filmé avec une Gopro et vous pouvez vous procurez le montage de la journée pour la modeste somme de 30$. 

Bien évidemment l'ensemble de l'argent récolté servira à supporter la dernière véritable soirée de débauche à vie de notre bon chum. Partagez cette page à vos amis et amis d'amis, mais pas à Oli! 

Merci pour votre support :)

Si vous avez des idées de challenges laissez moi le savoir :) :) :) julienbelisle@gmail.com

story:
The idea behind “Stories” is that YOU have the chance to tell your story in a way that is quite unique, through music. Is there a memory of your childhood that still makes you laugh? What about a person that you admire for their resolve even under the most extreme circumstances? Or even, from my experience, the reflection of the beautiful character of someone close to you who fought against a crippling disease for many years but ultimately could not overcome its tenacity? Your story can be tragic, inspirational, joyous, retrospective, whatever personal memories or family experiences have had an impact on your heart. I will create a 4-part piece of music for each story. Each part will be dedicated to bringing certain aspects of your story to life. Music has been my means of expression and can enhance emotions like no other art form. I am very passionate about what I create and having the opportunity to use that passion in a collaborative way with a story you are passionate about would be a very rewarding experience.


     I will contact those who pledge to have their stories used, and those whose are drawn, and we will discuss the best means of getting your story to me. I’m thinking that an email would suffice, but I’m not against interviewing via phone, facebook, skype, etc. The stories will be recorded in a written form. This will provide me a organized map to create the music. Also, I plan to post the stories on a website via blogspot.com so that those who receive/purchase the CD will be able to read the inspiration behind the music. If there are enough funds, I hope to create a booklet/poster including the printed stories that would accompany the CD. I will also be making notes of my progress as I go and include my thoughts as a bonus track/CD!


      I have set the project goal at $3750.00. This is the MINIMUM funding it would take to accomplish my goal. Ideally I can reach $5000. The money will fund equipment such as a new computer (mine is outdated for what I need), upgraded software so that I can produce professional sounds, and cost of CD reproduction. Please feel free to donate beyond the project goal as extra funds will allow me to increase the quality of the project even more! 


     * For samples of my work please feel free to check out my website, http://www.reverbnation.com/brianholmes. Thanks!

story:
Our Story

Megan is an amazing, talented, wonderful, and mature 13 year old girl from Newark, Delaware. She loves to sing, play her guitar and perform for people. As a little girl, she would sing solos in the Sunday services at her grandparents' church. Sheâ€™s never been afraid of challenges and puts 110% into everything.

About 8 months ago Megan began posting music videos on YouTube. She now has 19 videos posted, 36 subscribers and 1,661 views. A little over a month and half ago we were presented with an incredible opportunity for our Megan. We received a call from a reputable music producer from Los Angeles, CA. He would like to work with Megan and prepare her for a music career with a record label. This process will take about 4 months and will require us to travel to Los Angeles, CA in April for recording sessions. This is a very exciting opportunity for Megan, but it is certainly not free or inexpensive. In return for his fee, this music producer will co-write 4 songs with Megan, help develop a fan base, record the 4 songs to CD and shop record labels to try and get her a signed deal.

After much prayer and discussion, we have decided to move forward with this opportunity to see where it may lead. However, we are currently recovering from an unfortunate financial situation. When we were going through everything, we had to pass up on several chances to cultivate Megan's talent. She always understood and never complained and tried to help us, her parents through. Like all parents, we want to make her dream come true. Therefore, to help with the costs involved, we are posting this fundraiser.

The Impact

Megan is so excited about this incredible opportunity. She has been blessed with a beautiful voice, a friendly, happy, outgoing personality and the talent to play guitar. So many people have enjoyed her performances . With your help, we can pursue this incredible opportunity.

What's Needed & What You'll Get

Where will the money go? Here's the breakdown:
$6000 â€“ This is the music producerâ€™s fee. This go towards co-writing 4 songs with Megan (that will be recorded), studio time, production, marketing, setting up meetings with music industry professionals for the express purpose of making a reasonable attempt to secure a recording contract.

$3000 â€“ Travel expenses for going to Los Angeles for one week to meet with the music producer, recording the music and preparing CD for record labels.
$1500 â€“ Contribution to the American Diabetes Association
$1500 â€“ Contribution to the Make A Wish Foundation

Anything above and beyond the $12k will help us invest in equipment, grow her career, create a music video, and contribute a bigger sum to charity.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell the world! (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, random people on the street) By using the share tools at the top, you become the voice for this project. Large donations are greatly appreciated, but smaller donations can also fuel a fundraiser like this. If you can get your friends involved, it could make a world of difference. It's not just about raising money - it's also about helping Megan's dream of a music career come true and helping her to build a fan base. Please visit and subscribe to Megan's YouTube Page. So many people believe in Megan and we hope you will too! Together, we CAN make this happen!

story:
Hi there!

We’re Teen Girl Scientist Monthly.  We’re a 6-piece, DIY indie-stomp band hailing from the sunny Brooklyn hamlet of Bed-Stuy.  Hello!  (That’s how they say “hello” where we’re from.)  We sound like Ra Ra Riot and Clap Your Hands Say Yeah making out in the bathroom at a party.

Over the last two years, we’ve jangled, stomped and shouted all about New York City, toured to SxSW, and made two EPs of sunny guitar pop.  Now we’re getting ready to release our debut album!  The erotic elation coursing through our toned and supple bodies cannot be described.  At least not any better than we just did.

The songs we’re recording are the product of two years of rattling windows at house shows and starting shout-a-longs at bars.  They’re the document of our love affair with playing live, loud music for people who love yelling and dancing and jumping against one another.  We’ve been incredibly blessed by amazing fans and open ears, and we’re stoked beyond super soakers to begin putting together this collection of our work.

Our goal is to raise $5000 – by donating even a small amount you’ll be helping us rent studio time, pay our production staff, purchase the supplies for 500 albums and distribute them. 

(None of this money, it should be noted, will go towards evil.  We have given that up, we swear.  It will instead go towards recording, mixing, mastering and releasing ten tracks of sugar-dipped shouters that buzz like burnt honey and bust like electric sex.  This is our (admittedly oddly phrased) promise to you.)

To say “thank you” (and “god, thank you so much [sob, sob]” and, also, “we’re nothing without you”), we’ve lined up some unique, awesome and unique gifts – autographed copies of the album, yoga with the band, a TGSM-themed Choose Your Own Adventure book, and more.  We’re so grateful for your help, and we want you to know that you’re a part of our crew – for $100, we’ll name drop you in our new song We Run With Gangs, and for $300 we’ll write and record a song for you, about you - or someone you like a whole bunch.  It will be a good song, and it will get you kisses. 

If you’ve seen our live show or downloaded our EPs – and THANK YOU, if you have – you know that we’re committed to making the best recordings of our best material.  We’re excited to be making this album, and to be doing it with the support of our fans and friends (and moms, because they’re always worrying whether we’re eating enough.  YES MOM; WE JUST HAD AN APPLE LIKE TWO HOURS AGO.  GEEZ.). 

Any little bit helps, and, if you feel so inclined, please tell your friends about our campaign and our music.  We love making new besties, and it gets the word out.  We couldn’t do this without you. 

Thanks again!  You rock our world.

Teen Girl Scientist Monthly

Teen Girl Sci Mo.com
TGSM's Bandcamp
TGSM's Facebook
TGSM's Twitter

story:
UPDATE:  As of 9:55PM on Nov.1, this campaign almost met its goal within the first THREE HOURS!!!  YOU PEOPLE ARE AWESOME.  But just because the goal has been met, please dont think you need not give.  We are shooting to come as close to $5k as possible.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You might not know Mike Petillo or Aaron Leitko, but you should know their music.  Performing under the moniker PROTECT-U, these two guys have been grinding in the DC DIY music scene for years, and are now making the best music of their lives....

On Halloween, in the midst of a tour through Europe, they lost ALL of their gear out of a supposedly secure room in a nightclub in France.  NOT COOL FRANCE.  In total, they lost about $5k worth of laptops, synths, misc. sound equipment and train tickets.

We are hoping to help them replace their equipment.  Much of this was hand selected over the past few years and is integral for them to continue making their music.  We cannot let some thieves put a halt to creativity.....

A list of stolen gear as follows:

- dave smith tetre w/ case
- boss re-20 space echo pedal
- boss loop station
- nord rack synth
- boss ps-3 pitch shifter
- boss chorus pedal
- Yamaha cs-01 synthesizer
- moog midi-murf
- delta lab effectron II (had 23-era blonde redhead sticker on top)
- focus rite pro 40 sapphire
- apc 40 ableton controller
- MacBook pro 13" screen
- MacBook pro 15" screen
- zoom h4 recorder
- headphones

We do not have "REWARDS" to send you.  The more you give, the more the universe will thank you.  Help offset the cosmic harm done to Protect-U but digging deep.

Spread the word, Spread the vibes....

story:
Records Ad Nauseam is a Hollywood based independent record label, and we're proud to present the first full length LP by one of our favorite current bands, Human Toys. 

About the band...

 (Photo by Gilles Berquet) 

Human Toys : Sexy, Powerful, Subversive.

Human Toys is a collision of electronic and raw rock’n roll sound.

Mademoiselle Poupée (lead vocals, theremin) and Emma Amaretto (guitar, vocals, computer) like to play with female archetypes : subversion is the game and humor is the rule! Zeus Zelig (guitar, bass) joins as the guitar player for the US and Stephen Kida (drums) reinforces the digital beats with an evil voodoo touch.

 The band’s music takes you in a hotrod, navigating the mad road through a musical landscape of subversive fantasy, oscillating between garage, punk, electro, grindhouse and giallo movies.  

Their powerful live performances are moments of pure energy, saturated with their wild and sensual enthusiasm.  

Whenever possible, original video projections accompany Human Toys’ performances. 

 Orignially created in 2006, Human Toys was a duo based in Paris. It is now a flexible unit as a duo or a trio based in Los Angeles and Marseille. 

 Stephen Kida, began his carreer in the 1979 west coast punk scene, playing with the legendary Dead Boys among other acts of noteriety.  He joined the band in 2011.  

Zeus Zelig comes from the californian garage punk underground, playing with The Loons as well as many other raw rock bands over the years.  He joined Human Toys in early 2012.

 

About our campaign... 


Our goal with this campaign is to raise some funds to allow us to put together an extra-ordinary packaging for this premiere LP by Human Toys. They have enlisted the artistic expertiese of Gilles Berquet (http://www.gillesberquet.com/) and Lorenzo Eroticolor (http://lorenzo-eroticolor.com/) their amazing work deserves amazing packaging, so the more we raise, the more we can out into the quality and presentation of the record. Ideally we want to print a full color glossy deluxe fold out poster, so get ready to decorate your bedroom girls and boys!! 

What you get....

 

The LP

 

The 7'

Run Run Run (4 tracks) 2009

Almost sold out!!!!!

 

 

 

The CD 

Eiskalt (4 tracks) 2012

story:
"No DREAM is too big!" I am on a quest to take the world's ears on by surprise. I want to enlighten/inspire. I want you all on this journey with me. Help me raise money for my dream.

Hello, :) I’m Tyrone Griffin, I’m going to let you know the importance of music in my life and why I must strive to become an RnB/Hip-hop sensational superstar. I have had dreams from a child to become this famous singer I have envisioned since the age of 3. I always enjoyed when my favorite singers like Toni Braxton, Baby-Face, Janet Jackson, and Michael Jackson came onto the television. I just knew from right then and there, that was what I wanted to do for the rest of my life. I wanted to be an entertainer and to perform for millions of people and use my gift from god to inspire future generations to get involved in music through singing. To let you all know out there singing is a passion of mine and I would do anything to make my dreams come true. This is so important to me and if I achieved this milestone in my life it will most definitely be the best thing that has ever happened to me. This will also change my life in so many ways so that I can help others who have the same dream as me to achieve theirs. This money that is contributed to my goal will go directly to my music production. (Studio time, beats) I will be recording 4 songs, and they will all be about love and inspiring people. So please help me make my dream a reality. Thank you so much God bless. -Tyrone :) Anything you give really counts.

story:
Baraná Orchestra – Tribute to Behsat Üvez / Baraná Orkestrası – Behsat Üvez’e Övgü

Help to realize Behsat’s last dream! / Behsat’ın son hayalinin gerçekleşmesine yardım edin!

World Jazz ensemble Baraná was founded in 2002 by music wizards Behsat Üvez and Steven Kamperman. Together they planned, composed and performed highly acclaimed musical projects with a mix of elements from Turkish, European and jazz music, in different formations with musicians from different parts of the world.

Dünya Caz topluluğu Baraná, 2002 yılında müzik ustaları Behsat Üvez ve Steven Kamperman tarafından kuruldu. Dünyanın farklı bölgelerinden müzisyenlerle beraber, Türk, Avrupalı ve Caz müzik unsurlarının karışımlarını birlikte planladılar, düzenlediler ve yüksek övgüler alan projeler gerçekleştirdiler.

Last year, at age 53, Behsat Üvez passed away after a brave battle against lung cancer. He left behind an impressive legacy of compositions, CD's, concerts and last but not least many fellow-musicians for whom he was an example and inspiration. One of his biggest dreams, however, never came to the point of realization. He had always cherished the thought of having the music of Baraná performed by a really big professional band, an orchestra so to speak.

Geçtiğimiz yıl, 53 yaşında, Behsat Üvez akciğer kanserine karşı verdiği cesur mücadelenin ardından aramızdan ayrıldı. Behsat geride, düzenlemelerden, CD’lerden ve aynı derecede önemli diyebileceğimiz, birçok dost-müzisyene örnek ve ilham veren olmaktan oluşan, etkileyici bir miras bıraktı. Bununla beraber, onun en büyük rüyalarından biri gerçekleşemedi. O, her zaman, Baraná’nın müziğinin gerçekten büyük ve profesyonel bir grup, bir bakıma bir orkestra tarafından çalınması düşüncesinin üzerine titremişti.

To honour his memory, we decided to realize his dream, and organize a Baraná Orchestra, consisting of the musicians he used to play with.

Hatırasını onurlandırmak için, onun bu rüyasını gerçeklştirmeye ve beraber müzik yaptığı müzisyenlerden oluşan bir Baraná orkestrası kurmaya etmeye karar verdik.

Your help / Sizin Yardımınız

For us to be able to form the Tribute Orchestra your contribution is invaluable! With twenty musicians, the size of this orchestra is extraordinary large. This brings along many costs such as travel costs, lodging costs, etc., especially since some musicians are coming from Turkey and Germany.

Övgü Orkestramızı oluşturabilmek için sizin katkınız paha biçilmez. Yirmi müzisyen ile birlikte, orkestranın boyutu olağandışı şekilde büyük. Bu, özellikle bazı müzisyenlerin Türkiye ve Almanya’dan geliyor olmasıyla sebebi ile, seyahat masrafları, konaklama masrafları vb birçok masrafı da beraberinde getiriyor. 

Your donation will help funding the participation of Behsat's musical friends in this Orchestra. By donating, you will also contribute to the memory of an exceptional musician with friends and followers all over of the world. The term 'Baraná' means 'to get together', the motto for Barana's music, and the Orchestra is a symbol of the way music can build bridges. In short: your donation will help to realize Behsat’s last dream!

Bağışlarınız Behsat’ın müzik dostlarının bu Orkestra’ya katılmalarında yardımcı olacak. Ayrıca, bağışlarınız sayesinde, bütün dünya üzerindeki dostları ve takipçileri ile birlikte olağanüstü bir müzisyenin hatırasına katkıda buluncaksınız. 'Baraná' ‘Bir araya gelmek” manasına gelir. Baraná’nın müziğinin ve orkestrasının ilkesi müziğin köprüler kurabileceği simgeselliğidir. Kısaca: Bağışlarınız Behsat’ın son rüyasını gerçekleştirmeye yardım edecek.

Line up:

Steven Kamperman – alto clarinet, soprano sax, arrangements, Mehmet Uludag - vocals, baglama, Sanem Kalfa – vocals, Hasan Kazan - vocals, baglama, Monique Lansdorp – violin; George Dumitriu – violin; Cengiz Baytemür - ney, kaval, zurna; Paul Weiling – alto sax, Akos Laki – tenorsax; Henk Spies – baritonsax; Stanislav Mitrovic – bassclarinet;  Bert Lochs: flügelhorn; Kees Adolfsen – trombone; Ernst Reijseger – cello; Bart Lelivelt – accordeon; Erman Dirikcan – gituar; Jeff Sopacua - gituar, Meinrad Kneer – double bass; Afra Mussawissade – percussion; Sebastian Demydczuk: drums

The concerts / Konserler

  • April / Nisan 3, Groningen Oosterpoort
  • April / Nisan 9, Amsterdam Bimhuis
  • April / Nisan 12, Utrecht RASA (Day 2 of the Baraná World Jazz Festival)
  • April / Nisan 13, Rotterdam LantarenVenster

Other ways you can help

 You could help in other ways besides contributing to this campaign:

  • Share this campaign with as many people as possible;
  • Subscribe to our newsletter on www.barana.nl and Like us on Facebook
  • Visit our concerts and buy our CD’s
Yardım edebileceğiniz diğer yollar

  • Kampanyayı olabildiğince çok insanla paylaşmak;
  • Sitesindeki bültenimize abone olmak ve https://www.facebook.com/baranamusic Facebook sayfamızı beğenmek
  • Konserlerimizi ziyaret etmek ve CD’lerimizi satın almak

story:
About the project

Hello my names Matt and I’m a 20 year old musician from Penzance England who has stammered from a young age. I’m seeking funding to raise public awareness and understanding of stammering by making a charity album with artists and musicians (over 16) who stammer in aid of stammering.

Things that people take for granted in life such as introducing yourself to new people, ordering food off a menu, asking for assistance in a shop etc. become real nightmares for people who stammer. About 1% of the entire adult population have a stammer in the UK which can make life socially isolating and alienating. People who stammer are perhaps one of the most socially excluded groups in society and will often completely avoid certain social situations for fear of how there stammer will come across to the other people. The majority of the general public are still unaware of just how much of a social problem stammering is and have a basic lack of understanding of the condition. Many people who stammer find they are fluent when they sing and this album is all about giving them a chance to be heard! Songs featured on the album will be written by the artists and musicians themselves to express the thoughts, feelings and experiences of people who stammer and will be recorded at a professional recording studio in London. The album will be promoted around the area and released at a special launch gig where songs from the album will be performed by the artists and musicians. The album will also be sold online and all profits will be donated to a worthy stammering organisation. The idea for this project was formed when I was inspired by an article in the Cornishman newspaper about Kyle Coleman, a twenty five year old with autism who finds it hard to communicate with people other than through music, who was set to release a charity album in aid of autism. Having a severe stammer I have experienced social exclusion and know how difficult it can be to communicate. Like Kyle people who stammer find artistic expression is a way they are able to convey their thoughts and feelings without feeling restricted. With this in mind I felt I wanted to do something similar by recording and promoting a charity album with other people who stammer in aid of stammering. The album will feature 10 – 15 songs written by the artists and musicians themselves on the theme of stammering and will express the feelings and issues raised by the condition for people who stammer.

Help raise awareness of stammering and get cool stuff in return!

A contribution from you will really make a difference for people who stammer and will raise awareness of stammering. The project‘s target  is $4340 and any donation big or small will be a huge help! Your money will go towards booking the recording studio, album materials, marketing and promotion. In return there are a number of special perks to choose from which include a pre release digital download, signed copies of the album, signed posters, behind the scenes access and even an invite to come and see the album being recorded!

What impact will the album make?

The album could have a hugely positive impact on people who stammer, building their confidence, allowing them to freely express their thoughts and feelings about stammering through songs on the album and also allowing them to meet other people who stammer at the recording studio and album launch gig to help them realise they're not alone. The album could also have a positive and enlightening impact on the general public, allowing to hear what people who stammer go through in their own words.

How you can help

I hope you will choose to make a contribution to the project and you can also help by spreading the word of Stammering Awareness Album through word of mouth and on the internet. You can also follow the project on Facebook and Twitter through the links below. Thank you!

story:
I SEE YOU tour pilot: La Petite Carmen

You are already a part of this project simply by being ALIVE.
One playground—the universe—
an infinite number of creative points of view…
ALIVE because of one life-giving source

We seek to produce a 60-minute,

mini-operatic-pilot-performance of La Petite Carmen music by Georges Bizet…

…with a facilitated after-performance examination of
who we humans are, 

The music + the story + the science of human identity…

all there to move us toward feeling and celebrating
our common-ground fully… Uplifting and connecting all…

On an urban playground, spoken in the French language
La Petite Carmen’s foremost social-change message is…
whether we are experiencing misery or joy,
humanity’s common-ground is:
the JOY OF EXISTENCE…
all the rest is potential waiting…for us…

With the might of music and human potential…

…we dream to shine a light on destructive stories
and then illuminate our common-ground…

…we dream to create new, life-affirming stories…
a win-win for all—the rest of nature included…

WE ARE GLAD YOU ARE A PART OF THIS—COME PLAY.

 

WITH YOU, THE MONEY PAYS FOR

  • music commission, music stands/lights, set design,
  • videographer, production-technician, crew of four, 
  • travel expenses, professional fees, photographer,
  • the singers, musicians, choreographer
  • online tech-guy 
  • and the PERKS for YOU! YAAAY!

             Thank you!---->>

 

POSTCARDS 

BOOK

 

 

 

SHEET MUSIC

  

WHAT WE TAKE AWAY

A beautiful experience through opera and a new perspective on who we think we are for shaping a more joyful future—together. It’s the music, the voice, the conversation, the whole experience moving us to more accurate understandings…and it is a win-win for all.

 

Thank you for taking the time to watch our videos and consider our goal!

story:
Share the Music! Help MOBTOWNmoon's thrilling new version of Pink Floyd be heard the world 'round. 

The CD is not available to the general public until May 7....BUT INSIDERS DON'T HAVE TO WAIT!

A message from producers Sandy Asirvatham and ellen cherry.

A year ago it was still a dream....

And then, with the help of generous individual donors and a graciously well-timed foundation grant, we were able to produce our beautiful new version of Pink Floyd's DARK SIDE OF THE MOON. Thank you again, dear friends and fans!

The CD is done! You can listen to a few sound samples at www.mobtownmoon.com/sounds. 

MOBTOWNmoon is both a celebration of one of the most beloved albums of all time and a showcase for Baltimore's tremendous musical talent. The project contains all sorts of fresh grooves, eclectic arrangements, and gorgeous sounds, from the expected (rock guitar, synths, B3 organ swells)....

to the surprising (bassoon! accordion! strings! banjo!)....

to the potentially mind-blowing (Gregorian chant?! gospel piano?! and is that a cawing raven I hear?!).

Forty-two (42) Baltimore-based performers were involved in the recording. Now's the time to let the world know about the incredible talents we harbor here in Charm City....and you can help.

We Know You Want It And You Want It Now

If you pledged at the Eclipse Chasers level or higher during our first IndieGoGo campaign last summer, your CD is already en route to you.

But if not, why not get yourself a PRE-RELEASE COPY today and have it in your hands in about a week? It comes with a bonus: the warm, fuzzy feeling you get, knowing you are helping us broadcast this project far and wide.

Again, you can hear some samples at www.mobtownmoon.com/sounds

Your Early Purchase Helps Us SHARE THE MUSIC

Press and radio campaigns require money up front (even when you're doing a large part of the work yourselves, as we are!). Your early purchase will help us get our CD out to as many influential DJs, music writers, and entertainment news editors as possible.
 
Choose one digital download, one physical CD, or a pack of five or ten if you're in the mood to be very, very sharing...

(Each purchase level covers our costs and includes an amount that's strictly a donation to help us with press and radio campaign costs.)

Fully Tax-Deductible Donation Option

Are you happy to wait a little while for the disc, but want to help share the music anyway? Please consider a tax-deductible donation directly through out nonprofit fiscal sponsor, Fractured Atlas. Gifts of all sizes are deeply appreciated! CLICK HERE TO DONATE

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't purchase or donate at this time, you can still help out:

  • Share this campaign with your music-loving friends through Facebook, Twitter, or plain old antique rotary telephone (if you can find one of those).
  • Put your name on our email list at www.mobtownmoon.com and receive a free mp3 of "Breathe"!
  • Are you a journalist, critic, DJ, or music podcaster? Do you have friends in high places? Our press campaign is DIY. If you've got any contacts in media who you think will love this work, please feel free to send them our way!
