story:
General Avocado - The Dream In the Horizon

For all members of the band, this project is something that's been in our minds for a long time. We talk about it after rehearsals, before shows, with friends and family. Whenever there's a period where the band is day-dreaming, a lot of our thoughts gravitate around that notion that, with a little help, we are going to be able to share what we do live for the audience, with everybody interested or intrigued about our music.

The donations will go a long way. We can get started on the recording of the album, and as that first, yet extremely important, part of the "campaign" concludes, then the distribution and promotion will start to take place.

When we are finished, our donators will receive the promises we are making here for them. Our dream will have come true, and from there, the sky is limit and you all are giving us wings.

General Avocado - The Project and Contributions

This project consists on 4 basic premises:

  1. The first portion of the contributions will go automatically to our "Studio Time", which will help us record and have the initial product ready for our fans.
  2. Secondly, we will utilize another portion of the funds for merchandise, along with album distribution, to ensure everybody receives what we are promising in return for the donations.
  3. We will constantly keep everybody posted on the advancement of the campaign with videos, and a few surprises, such as acoustic versions of our songs that everybody will get a chance to watch online.
  4. The campaign will reach its "destination" once we have compiled all of the information necessary to deliver the product to our donators. We will record a video for the Album's first single, and the rewards will be shipped to our fans. We hope to be able to do this by Summer of 2013.

Important disclaimer: in the off-chance we are not able to achieve the full amount, we will do everything we can to still deliver our promises to those who donated, with the money collected from the campaign, and we will find new ways to reach that final goal. 

 

General Avocado - The Story

This band started as a duo that added a drummer, who at the time was simply looking for a band that could open for his other band. As the rehearsals went on, and a solid foundation was built, General Avocado started playing little shows, everywhere and anywhere they could. With a few "bucks" collected from tips and the rare paid shows, they recorded about six songs in their living room, just to be able to give something tangible to whomever was interested in listening to a very humble "snap-shot" of what a live show was at that time. Finally, the last piece of the puzzle entered in the form of an extremely talented bassist who was able to connect with the band and the music immediately. With a full band now "on stage", General Avocado has evolved tremendously, and played at several different important local venues, at a larger scale, and continues to thrive on the emotions, and the true variety they bring to the local music scene, which is dominated to a certain point, by the heavy metal genre.

One more thing...

We consider what we are doing musically a very unique thing. It is really difficult for us to describe in in "paper", or with a few words. We do our best at that, and you can read it in our bio, but there is no better way to express it than to be able to play for you those songs that we have been working on for almost a year now. Please help us spread the music. There is no way to re-pay you for lending us a hand in achieving this dream of ours, but we promise you, we will do our very best. 

Thank you in advance, and we will see you on the road.

Sincerely,

Jessica, AJ, Mao & Leonardo

General Avocado
story_txt:
General Avocado - The Dream In the Horizon
For all members of the band, this project is something that's been in our minds for a long time. We talk about it after rehearsals, before shows, with friends and family. Whenever there's a period where the band is day-dreaming, a lot of our thoughts gravitate around that notion that, with a little help, we are going to be able to share what we do live for the audience, with everybody interested or intrigued about our music.
The donations will go a long way. We can get started on the recording of the album, and as that first, yet extremely important, part of the "campaign" concludes, then the distribution and promotion will start to take place.
When we are finished, our donators will receive the promises we are making here for them. Our dream will have come true, and from there, the sky is limit and you all are giving us wings.
General Avocado - The Project and Contributions
This project consists on 4 basic premises:

The first portion of the contributions will go automatically to our "Studio Time", which will help us record and have the initial product ready for our fans.
Secondly, we will utilize another portion of the funds for merchandise, along with album distribution, to ensure everybody receives what we are promising in return for the donations.
We will constantly keep everybody posted on the advancement of the campaign with videos, and a few surprises, such as acoustic versions of our songs that everybody will get a chance to watch online.
The campaign will reach its "destination" once we have compiled all of the information necessary to deliver the product to our donators. We will record a video for the Album's first single, and the rewards will be shipped to our fans. We hope to be able to do this by Summer of 2013.
Important disclaimer: in the off-chance we are not able to achieve the full amount, we will do everything we can to still deliver our promises to those who donated, with the money collected from the campaign, and we will find new ways to reach that final goal.

One more thing...

Thank you in advance, and we will see you on the road.

story:
Short Summary

Hi,

This is Kera's mom, Angela.  Kera has been playing viola for 5 years now.  This coming year she will be 16 and, unlike normal teenagers, she does not want a party or presents.  Instead she would like your assistance in upgrading her viola to a full size instrument from her beginner's viola. 

Kera is already performing in the Honors Orchestra at Judson Highschool (the top orchestra in the school) and she is only in her sophomore year.  She loves to play and has about worn out her current viola...which is two sizes too small for her current stature.

For her Sweet 16, instead of a party and instead of gifts, she would like a GOOD QUALITY, full sized viola so that she can continue in her musical education.

What We Need & What You Get

It is my hope that this will be viewed as a sponsorship towards Kera's 16th Birthday Gift.

What is needed:

Viola - Full Size 16" Nicholas Ostler Tertis Viola $1,400.00

Bow - New bow  $100.00 +/-

Viola Case - Hard Case $150 -$200 (at least)

Strings - extra set of strings $50.00

Fees and taxes - $150 +/-

 

I will have the names of all sponsors engraved on a plaque for Kera to display.

If we reach our goal all of the items listed above will be able to be purchased...if we do not reach that goal then we will purchase what we can.

If we exceed the goal then all of the above will be purchased and and other monies will go towards getting a hard case for Kera's cello (yes, she plays two stringed instruments)...these cases start off at close to $400.00.  Anything beyond this will go directly to Kera as a bonus.

 

The Impact

Family and friends are always important in a person's life.  With your support of Kera's musical passion you will make it possible for her to progress even further...having an instrument that is capable of sounding as good as you play makes a huge difference in propelling and ampliflying one's abilities.

Kera has been playing since 6th grade and is only growing in her love of orchestra.  In addition to playing viola and cello she also aspires to learn the contrabass.  She is very dedicated to the musical arts and continually strives to be ever improving in her ability, appreciation and devotion to playing.

Please be a part of making Kera's 16th birthday one that she will truly remember...not just with memories but a tangible instrument that will be with her throughout her musical journey.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that some of you will not be able to help and I understand completely.  If you could help get the word out to others that may be able to help I would greatly appreciate it.

Please share this campaign to help ensure Oyster (as she has named her desired instrument) becomes a part of Kera's life.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hi, my name is Jim Pharis. With your financial help I will be able to record my first full length CD.

The CD will be a mix of original songs with a few choice covers.

I'm probably like a lot of you. I got a guitar as a kid and began to teach myself to play.

Now here I am, all those years later, with a uniquely individual style of playing and composition. An individual voice.

Now, with your help, it's time to record that voice

What's In It For Me?

I hope to gain two things out of this recording:

1) A marker, or milestone, of where I am at this point in my artistic development.

2) A tool to use to help me get more playing work. I'm a worker. A more professional presence will create more opportunities playing-wise.

What's In It For You?

A few of the premiums for your involvement in the CD include:

1)Pre-release downloads and copies of the CD. 

2)Lessons and instructional video for you or a friend or family member. 

3) A concert for you and your friends at your house.

Where Does The Dough Go?

Here's a breakdown on how the money will be spent:

1) Studio cost, recording engineer, mastering $1500

2) Royalties for cover songs $600

3) Digital download cards $150

4) CD duplication and tour posters $1125

5) Artwork for CD cover, poster and download card $500

6) Packaging and Shipping of premiums $440

7) Credit card/ Paypal fees $130

8) Indiegogo fees $389

TOTAL $4834

So, that's the story of my Indiegogo Campaign. Thanks for taking the time to check it out. 

Please remember, I can only make this happen with your support.

I'll ask one final thing of you besides your financial participation.

Please help me get the word out about this project by sharing it via social media.

Thanks again.

 P.S. You can hear more of my music by visiting http://www.reverbnation.com/jimpharis

or http://jimpharis.com/fr_home.cfm

You can find some of my guitar lessons here http://www.learn-fingerstyle-guitar.com/

story:
UPDATE: Watch this video for samples of music off the new album!

We are all part of a puzzle... and I am one of those puzzle pieces. You are all puzzle pieces as well. A puzzle is incomplete if even one piece is missing. Help me finish this puzzle I am working on. 

  • My name is Jeremy Dean Harrison and I am working on my second solo album, called, How's the Whether?
  • The album is a reflection of the choices each individual has to make every day... a choice or a doubt between two or more alternatives, or when we say that something is true in any of the circumstances we mention. The music and lyrics are a reflection of the world around us and the difficulties in which we find ourselves making life choices in order to optimize and actualize our life experience. 
  • This campaign is important to me because I love sharing my music with others. I write songs to inspire people to be their best; because I feel inspired by the good in the world and I want to be the best me I can be; to actualize my potential and optimize my experience. I know this music can change a perspective or make a person's day better.
  • With your help, I can complete this album and share my music for free with the world. 
  • I believe in light and I believe in the choice to use that light for making this world amazing! 

After reading the Parable of the Talents, I was inspired to record my first album, Into the Light... A great man once said, "“But with some I am not well pleased, for … they hide the talent which I have given unto them, because of the fear of man. … Thou shalt not idle away thy time, neither shalt thou bury thy talent that it may not be known.” At some point in time, we must all use our gifts and talents to inspire greatness in others! Fear not, for our talents are made in greatness. 

What I Need 

Let me break it down:

  • $2,500 is the minimum I need. This provides me with 10 days in the studio, which is plenty of time to get things started.
Additional costs     
  • Drums... To put live drums on this album will cost me about $2,000 for studio and drummer (think Mars Volta or Afghan Whigs for studio drummer). 
  • Mix and Master... $2,500 will get this album an above and beyond mix from a professional. 
  • Website Updates... $500-1,000 
  • Print Cds $1,000 for 1,000 copies (I might do records this time as well)
  • Digital Distribution $150
≈$10,000.00 for everything!
  • I ask for a minimum of $2,500, but ideally I would like to surpass this goal so that I may have your help in completing the project sooner.
  • None of the money raised will be used to purchase airline tickets, hotel, cars or any other aspect of my personal life. I have a savings for that. 
  • As a PhD student studying Philosophy, with a part-time teaching salary, I could use a little extra help. My wife and I do all of our own graphics and videos... so that is fun for us.                                                                                                                           
 The Impact

If anything, do it for the kids... My students loved having a computer teacher who had his own cd. Most of them would sit down and do their work because they thought I was cool. Not all of them... but most of them. This music is impacting their future. ;)

I want you to be excited about this album. 

  • I know I am not famous but the music is really good... sincere and fun. Take a listen to my last album (http://www.jeremydeanharrison.com/music).
  • I have given away almost 1000 cds and have had a great number of people download the songs from my site. This was all paid for on my own but now I am hoping that someone will help me out. I am hoping you are that someone.

What You Get

First of all, I give you my love and appreciation. I have been working hard and saving up to record this second album; and by chipping in a few dollars, you realize my love for writing and recording music. There are no words or perks that can explain how I truly feel about others helping me to improve my gifts and talents to share with this world. 

Second, it takes a little while to complete an entire album, so it will be 6 months to a year before I have the finished product. It just takes time... and that means you are willing to invest in me... for that I owe you eternal and infinite gratitude. 

Other than that... check out the perks to see what you get... on my website there is some pretty cool merchandise I would like you to check out. If there is something that is on there, that you don't see in the perks... just hit me up and I will do my best to provide. The biggest problem for a musician, is we want to provide really cool and interesting perks; and most of us have some pretty cool ideas... but merchandising companies usually want you to buy in bulk to get a discount on shirts and things... but please let me know... maybe there is something else we can do.

http://www.jeremydeanharrison.com/product-category/physical/

Check out my merch here on my website! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes we just don't have the extra cash to kick down... I get it. Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign, my website (www.jeremydeanharrison.com) and my music in general.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Like me on www.Facebook.com/JeremyDeanHarrisonMusic
  • Follow me on www.soundcloud.com/jeremydeanharrison
  • Subscribe to me on Youtube.com as I will be uploading more video content soon!

Thank you for giving me a chance to use my gifts and talents to share with the world!

Second, it takes a little while to complete an entire album, so it will be 6 months to a year before I have the finished product. It just takes time... and that means you are willing to invest in me... for that I owe you eternal and infinite gratitude. 



Other than that... check out the perks to see what you get... on my website there is some pretty cool merchandise I would like you to check out. Check out my merch here on my website!

Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Like me on www.Facebook.com/JeremyDeanHarrisonMusic

Follow me on www.soundcloud.com/jeremydeanharrison

Subscribe to me on Youtube.com as I will be uploading more video content soon! 

Thank you for giving me a chance to use my gifts and talents to share with the world!

story:
We are working in the Divine Play of total surrender to the Enlightened Intention of All Masters Combined in the Service of Supporting the Awakening of the Golden Age...

We are Living the Teachings of Ascended Masters and Siddhars (Perfected Masters of Light) We channel their energy transmission and Intentions through all our Actions in Surrender to Enlightened Awareness in Love for All.  We especially enjoy channeling and transmitting energy of the Enlightened Intention of Mastery through Sacred Sound and Song.

We Have Self Published a Hand Full of Books (five) and recorded Two CD's with a special place as Technology for Anchoring Pure Energy Transmission for Awakening Wisdom beyond words with Direct Transcendent Experience.

We both, Darshan Baba and Tripura Sundari Purna Prema Ananda Mayi, have unique gifts and Training in Transmission of Energy for Healing and Initiation as Shaktipat Deeksha Awakening one to Brand New Perspectives, with Greater Freedom in Life, and Ultimately Leading to Total Mastery.  This Energy is Super-Intelligent Light working with miraculous synchronicity of its own Force and Power as Light to Reveal Absolute Truth bringing about Total Moksha (Liberation and Self/God-Realization) in perfect safe timing.


With your help and donations we will be able continue to travel to new locations sharing these Blessings - which are Bringing Manifestation of Heaven on Earth into our own lives - with more and more people...  As well as serving in Loving Kindness through simple acts such as feeding hundreds and even thousands of people in places such as India (where even a just a thousand dollars could feed many thousands of people)...

The Benefits of contributing to and supporting the Work and Enlightened Intention of The Masters in Anyway (not just monetary) goes beyond mention, Darshan Baba says that in the Paradigm occupied by Purna Prema Ma and himself any association with this project even just seeing it is an auspicious omen which guarantees one will have full Moksha or Liberation from all Suffering and Attainment of Ultimate Freedom in Bliss and Peace, of this Darshan Baba says there is No Doubt!

We both, Darshan Baba and Tripura Sundari Purna Prema Ananda Mayi, have unique gifts and Training in Transmission of Energy for Healing and Initiation as Shaktipat Deeksha Awakening one to Brand New Perspectives, with Greater Freedom in Life, and Ultimately Leading to Total Mastery.  This Energy is Super-Intelligent Light working with miraculous synchronicity of its own Force and Power as Light to Reveal Absolute Truth bringing about Total Moksha (Liberation and Self/God-Realization) in perfect safe timing.
With your help and donations we will be able continue to travel to new locations sharing these Blessings - which are Bringing Manifestation of Heaven on Earth into our own lives - with more and more people...  As well as serving in Loving Kindness through simple acts such as feeding hundreds and even thousands of people in places such as India (where even a just a thousand dollars could feed many thousands of people)...
The Benefits of contributing to and supporting the Work and Enlightened Intention of The Masters in Anyway (not just monetary) goes beyond mention, Darshan Baba says that in the Paradigm occupied by Purna Prema Ma and himself any association with this project even just seeing it is an auspicious omen which guarantees one will have full Moksha or Liberation from all Suffering and Attainment of Ultimate Freedom in Bliss and Peace, of this Darshan Baba says there is No Doubt!

story:
FUND $40,000 IN 40 DAYS TO PRESERVE OLS:

A jewel in the crown of fine listening rooms across the country.

In the words of Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, whose statue keeps watch over OLS in the thriving city square we call home:

"Music is the universal language of mankind."


ONE LONGFELLOW SQUARE PROVIDES A TRULY UNIQUE EXPERIENCE FOR PERFORMERS OF ALL GENRES AND AUDIENCES OF ALL AGES

We are not a crowded bar or a formal concert hall. We are a 200-seat neighborhood listening room in the culturally rich city of Portland, Maine. OLS is an intimate space where people of all walks of life come together and become part of the performance.

While we search out the finest national and international talent to bring to Maine, we also support our vibrant local music scene, from the state's most established artists to young regional musicians at the beginning of their careers. Music legends like Tom Rush and Ronnie Earl return to our stage year after year, yet we are equally proud to have presented artists like The Punch Brothers, Brown Bird, and Aoife O'Donovan early on in their now thriving careers.

The OLS nonprofit mission, established in 2011, also underscores our commitment to bringing music and art into the daily lives of children in the greater Portland area. Through a shared commitment and partnerships with other Portland nonprofits and community organizations, we are able to reach out to underserved youth and engage them with exciting, hands-on programming. School groups use our flexible space during the day and a great number of Portland kids have performed on our stage, presenting their own original work in music, dance, and theater.

PARTNERSHIPS AND COMMUNITY ARE AT THE HEART OF WHAT MAKES OLS TICK, AND WE ARE EXCITED TO SHARE NEWS OF TWO NEW PARTNERSHIPS IN THE WORKS FOR THIS FALL:

MAINE ACADEMY OF MODERN MUSIC: MAMM will expand our monthly Kids Open Mic program from welcoming singer-songerwriters on the first Sunday of the month, to expanding musical genres to include rock on the second Sunday and jazz, bluegrass or hip-hop on the third Sunday of each month.  In addition, with support from the Davis Family Foundation, MAMM will utilize our "urban classroom" to provide music lessons for underserved kids in the community several days a week.

BERKLEE COLLEGE OF MUSIC MONTHLY STUDENT SHOWCASE: Joe Walsh, OLS Board Member and instructor in the American Roots Music Program at Berklee College of Music, piloted this showcase last year with great reception from Portland music fans. Beginning in January, we will bring some of the most talented young musicians in the country to the OLS stage once again.

Other recent arts and music programming for youth have included:

  • Boys & Girls Club of Southern Maine:  theatre and dance performances
  • LearningWorks and Reiche School:  claymation workshop with Oak Street Studio
  • Center for Grieving Children: songwriting workshops and CD release party with immigrant youth
  • Monthly Kids Open Mic: hosted by teens for kids and teens
  • The Real School:  hands-on sound technician short course for teens

OLS IS AT A CROSSROADS AND WE NEED YOUR HELP NOW TO CONTINUE.

We are asking our community to make One Longfellow Square a permanent part of the cultural fabric of Portland, Maine as a community-supported nonprofit. Our $40,000 IndieGoGo campaign will provide the seed funding that will sustain us this year as we launch the other facets of our development program including new community partnerships and our corporate sponsorship program.

A $10 gift - and a $10 challenge to 10 of your live music loving friends goes a long way to meeting our goal - one live music fan at a time. Or maybe you are able to make a gift of $200 to support the purchase of one of 200 new, comfy chairs for the venue (one with YOUR name on it!). Have a look at our perks in the righthand column and decide which giving level suits your budget. 

Keep the stage lights on and the doors open at One Longfellow Square!

The success of this campaign lies in the hands of many live music fans in Maine, and in neighborhoods around the country and the world who value the experience of live music in small venues.  Please share this message with many.

Thanks for listening. Thanks for giving. Thanks for spreading the word.



WHAT MEMBERS OF THE ARTS COMMUNITY ARE SAYING ABOUT ONE LONGFELLOW SQUARE:

“As a professional touring musician since 1977, I can say that One Longfellow is on a short list of the best listening rooms in the U.S.  My criteria include location, sound, good layout, staff professionalism and friendliness, and perfect size for serious acoustic music. I put it in a class with the great acoustic venues: Ann Arbor’s The Ark, Berkeley’s Freight and Salvage, Boston’s Club Passim, and Chicago’s Old Town School Of Music - all of which, by the way, are now nonprofits. One Longfellow is an essential lynchpin of the Northeast touring music circuit, meaning: We really need and love this place!”

- Darol Anger, Fiddler, Composer, Producer, Berklee professor


“One Longfellow serves as an integral and unique piece of the music community in the Greater Portland area. There's no other venue in the area that provides such intimacy (while seating two hundred) with ambiance, professionalism, and impeccable sound. One Longfellow is an asset to Portland, and has fostered a culture of listening and appreciation with a relaxed and playful vibe. Thank you!!”

- Emilia Dahlin, Singer-Songwriter

Voted Portland's Best Local Female Vocalist,  2005, 2006, 2007


“One Longfellow Square is a vibrant contributor to the Portland music scene. Their diverse programming and intimate setting offers a unique experience to the city's cultural calendar. They have a great location at the entrance to the downtown arts district. We are delighted to see their programming expanding.  The trolley stops right at their door on First Fridays — check them out!"

- Jennifer Hutchins, Executive Director, Creative Portland


_______________________________________________________________________

ONE LONGFELLOW SQUARE WOULD LIKE TO THANK:

 The talented artists who appear in this video:

Lauren Rioux and Joe Walsh

The Aoife O'Donovan Band

The Gabriel Alegria Afro Peruvian Sextet

Kids & Teens Open Mic Hosts Liam Swift and Sadie Grant

The Portland Jazz Orchestra

Eric Bettencourt

Tinariwen

Spose

Lake Street Dive

Dietrich Strause

Connor Garvey

Thalassa Raasch and Chris Gauthier, for their brilliant videography and capturing the heart and soul of OLS.  Chris Gauthier + Thalassa Raasch.

Patrick Corrigan, for his drawing of OLS, and his talented design work and hand painting outside and in One Longfellow Square.

story:
I've already started working on The Live Experience, a new live album (audio version and video version) to follow up my last studio album, Conversations. Here's the first video from The Live Experience.

You can get also my Conversations album (listen here), featuring the song Sweet Friend of Mine, here. You'll receive extra songs (see the list below), bonus features and better quality audio. If you use PayPal, you can have a download or CD very quickly. 

I'm thrilled with this album and want to make sure it gets heard. I've learned the hard way that if you don't promote an album well, very few people even learn that it is available. But it takes money to promote an album well. It costs thousands of dollars to do publicity or send songs to just one radio format, for instance. There's a great team excited about helping me make sure this album gets noticed but I've had to turn many of them down because I can't afford them. 

That's where you come in. You could look for the album in stores but you'll get fewer songs, none of the extras and you won't get the higher quality audio files that are included in the downloads here. Why should you get the album directly from me now? 

When you join this campaign you're not just buying music. You're investing in the impact that you believe we can have together and in the lasting value of the songs that will come from our musical journey together. Sharing goals and experiences like this means you're not just a "fan" of my music. You're a Sweet Friend Of Mine. Here's why this model works better and is essential to my getting to interact with you more and to my ability to continue to record.

I’ve got some great rewards for individuals, groups and charities -- something for everyone. Each one has a different delivery date so you'll know when you should receive it. Check them out over there. -->

You can also invite me to your town - for a Conversation or a concert. You’ll find the details–yep, you guessed it–right over there. -->

Click a "Claim This Perk" button to see more information about ordering it, delivery dates, etc. If you pay by credit card, Indiegogo doesn't complete the transaction until several days after the campaign ends, so your delivery date is after that. If you use PayPal, the delivery date will be earlier than the one posted. 

Thanks again for your interest in my music.  Please share this page with your friends... choose the cool stuff you want... and check out some of the songs on my Conversations album.

Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations.

I look forward to connecting with you and learning what you think about these songs on social media like Indiegogo, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and ReverbNation.

There are videos of songs further down the page, right after the FAQ.

P.S. I am also a founding member of the Sweet Comfort Band. We have a new album called The Waiting Is Over and you can get a copy, which I'll autograph, here too.

FAQ

What is included in the Conversations Deluxe Download?

Sweet Friend Of Mine
You Make Me Love You
Know It
I Can’t Imagine
One Missing Piece
Got Ya Where You Want Me
Little Bit At A Time
Lovin’ You
I See You
No Words
Nothing To Prove
Every Father Is A Son
Say What You Mean
God Wins
Silent Night
This Christmas
Peace
Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas
Christmas Time Is Here
What a Wonderful World
I See You (Radio Version) 

I Can't Imagine (Radio Version)

Bonus Audio
Ringtones
Album Graphics & Poster

Which songs are on the Conversations CD?

Sweet Friend Of Mine
You Make Me Love You
Know It
I Can’t Imagine
One Missing Piece
Got Ya Where You Want Me
Little Bit At A Time
Lovin’ You
I See You
No Words
Nothing To Prove
Every Father Is A Son
Say What You Mean
God Wins
Silent Night
This Christmas
Peace
Have Yourself A Merry Little Christmas
Christmas Time Is Here

Why have you set your goal so low?

Indiegogo charges higher fees if I don't reach my goal. So, I set a low goal in hopes of exceeding it and paying lower fees.

Can I participate even if I don't live in the United States?

Absolutely! I’ve had such great experiences with my international audience and I want you involved. Plus, the guy who helped me put this campaign together is a Canadian and he’s helped me figure out how to make it easier for you be a part.

You can choose any of the perks that are delivered by e-mail (Reports From The Soul Furnace, Digital Album Download, Let's Talk, etc.) without any extra cost. 

There are some extra shipping costs, compared to mailing the same items to an address in the United States, if you choose a perk that is rewarded by mailing you something -- CDs, shirts, etc. So, you can simply add a bit to your pledge to cover those costs. I’ll trust you to be fair when estimating that amount. Here are some typical extra costs for shipping one CD to these countries:

Canada & Australia: $1.50-2.00 extra for one CD

United Kingdom: $4-4.50 extra for one CD

Netherlands: $3 extra for one CD

Japan: $3 extra for one CD

If you choose a reward package that involves travel you’ll be responsible for the travel costs.

Can I give the album or other perks to my friends?

You betcha! Indiegogo allows you specify who you want the perk sent to and indicate that it is a gift. You can even include a note for the recipient of your gift.

What do you need for concert rewards?

It's pretty basic: You provide a sound system suitable for the size of audience and venue, along with a keyboard, an acoustic/electric guitar and two direct in boxes/connections.

My accommodation needs are simple too: One hotel room (two for Christmas concerts), meals and transportation to/from the airport. Additional travel costs will apply if you do not live within 90 minutes of a major U.S. hub airport that offers direct flights from Los Angeles.

Can you tell me more about the estimated delivery dates?

If I can send your rewards earlier than estimated cost-effectively, I will. I'll work hard to get your perks to you as quickly as possible after I receive payment from Indiegogo. PayPal payments happen fairly quickly but credit card payments aren't processed until several business days after the campaign closes. Some perks, especially those that involve travel, will require a bit more time to schedule but we’ll work that out together.

What happens if you don't reach your goal?

You'll still get whatever perk you've selected. I'll have to pay higher fees to Indiegogo if I don't reach the goal but you'll still get everything.

How can I help with this campaign?

There's lots you can do in addition to backing this campaign and sharing this page. Any comments you post help raise the profile of this page. Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations. You can also send Christopher a message here if you'd like to be added to my Indiegogo campaign team (see the group below).

What if I have a question that isn't answered here or want a perk that isn't offered?

Send me a message. There is a big "Send User A Message" button on my Indiegogo profile page. 

Here's I See You.  http://bit.ly/ISeeYouVideo

Here's Little Bit At A Time.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=khNs5m-Nyxw

Here's Got Ya Where You Want Me.  http://vimeo.com/78610359

story:
Short Summary

I'm David Vox Mullen and I've been an entertainer my whole life. There's nothing I love more than performing for people be it through singing, acting or comedy. For a decade I was the lead singer & lyricist for The Slipstream. (A Chicago based rock band that played for over a decade together). Basically, I've written a bunch of new rock & adult contemporary songs and I've simply got to get them out to the world. I'm seeking support to offset the cost of producing such a project and believe me the cost is really high. So anything you can do be it small or large will be put to good use. Please consider helping to give me the chance to once again express myself through music.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I'm asking for $8,000 to help to offset the cost of recording, producing, hiring musicians, studio rentals, engineering fees, development, design, marketing and ultimately distribution of the music project
  • We've come up with some really fun perks for our contributors at all levels.
  • Obviously I'm passionate about this project and will continue working on the music if this campaign does not reach it's goal, but the closer to the goal we get, the less time it will take to produce and obviously the more we receive, the higher the quality of the production will go.

The Impact

Before you give, I just want to thank you for even reading this portion:

  • This project is more than just me recording music. It is giving me the chance to return to something I am truly passionate about.
  • I have successfully produced 4 albums with my previous band and I produce other artists as well so I know what to do once the funding is there.
  • Once we accomplish this goal, you'll be able to see the album on iTunes and other distribution points and know that YOU were a major part of bringing this project to the marketplace.

Risks & Challenges

This is a very new and scary concept for me. I've never done a crowd funding project before and I HATE having to ask for help. But over the years, I have learned that it is truly better to share the load with talented people than trying to do it all by myself.

  • I'll admit that I'm not sure if I'm interesting enough for people to even want to be involved. But I truly hope that people will share and contribute to this project in order to help me reach this goal. Let's make some music!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and that's ok, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Remember to use the INDIEGOGO share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary I'm David Vox Mullen and I've been an entertainer my whole life. There's nothing I love more than performing for people be it through singing, acting or comedy. For a decade I was the lead singer & lyricist for The Slipstream. (A Chicago based rock band that played for over a decade together). Basically, I've written a bunch of new rock & adult contemporary songs and I've simply got to get them out to the world. I'm seeking support to offset the cost of producing such a project and believe me the cost is really high. So anything you can do be it small or large will be put to good use. Please consider helping to give me the chance to once again express myself through music.   What We Need & What You Get 
I'm asking for $8,000 to help to offset the cost of recording, producing, hiring musicians, studio rentals, engineering fees, development, design, marketing and ultimately distribution of the music project We've come up with some really fun perks for our contributors at all levels. Obviously I'm passionate about this project and will continue working on the music if this campaign does not reach it's goal, but the closer to the goal we get, the less time it will take to produce and obviously the more we receive, the higher the quality of the production will go.    The Impact Before you give, I just want to thank you for even reading this portion:  This project is more than just me recording music. It is giving me the chance to return to something I am truly passionate about. I have successfully produced 4 albums with my previous band and I produce other artists as well so I know what to do once the funding is there. Once we accomplish this goal, you'll be able to see the album on iTunes and other distribution points and know that YOU were a major part of bringing this project to the marketplace.    Risks & Challenges  This is a very new and scary concept for me. I've never done a crowd funding project before and I HATE having to ask for help. But over the years, I have learned that it is truly better to share the load with talented people than trying to do it all by myself.  I'll admit that I'm not sure if I'm interesting enough for people to even want to be involved. But I truly hope that people will share and contribute to this project in order to help me reach this goal. Let's make some music!
    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute and that's ok, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Please help to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Remember to use the INDIEGOGO share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
THE PROJECT

The goal of this project is to fund the production of my debut studio album. I'm working with London producer Charlie Dawe. With the album finished produced, mixed & mastered me and Charlie will pitch this to labels. Making this album will help me and get my music to the next level and also I will be able to do full length gigs and tours with this.

WHO IS RAY NOIR?

I'm a recording artist living in London. 

I grew up in the comparatively tranquil climes of Norway, travelling through cities like Oslo and Paris before settling in London. I've always been massively influenced by the metal, industrial and rock movements, cutting my teeth on artists like Nine Inch Nails and Marilyn Manson.

I started as a DJ, but always wanted to make my own music. After meeting Frankmusik at a party in London, we collaborated in the studio, and birthed my first hit, punk/industrial stomper ‘Double Trouble’. My second single 'All Alone' ft. Mariann Rosa came out in February this year and both singles and videos was released to critical success from publications like Esquire Magazine, Kaltblut Magazine, World of Wonder Reports, Vampire Freaks, Attitude Magazine, Gay Times, and perezhilton.com, as well as international attention from South Korea to Colombia. Both songs charted at the German Alternative Charts.

Rewards

As rewards you can get merch bundles, exclusive t-shirts, beanies, signed poster + stickers, get your hands on the album before release date,  skype conversation with me, get your name tattooed on my body, get a portrait of you made as a caricature and tattooed on my body,  dinner date with me in London (eating my favourite food, Pizza). I will also be giving away my beloved leather jacket with my first logo painted on the back. I've been wearing this jacket for many years and it's been used on stage many times.

LOGO T-SHIRT FSDT: £20 + SHIPPING

FACE ALL ALONE T-SHIRT COMES WITH 2 T-SHIRT BUNDLE £35 + SHIPPING

Goal

The goal is to get in £3000. £2500 will be going to produce the tracks, studio time to record vocals. The rest will be going for mixing and mastering and print tee's for you who support this crowdfunding. 

Risks

If the project is not funded, it will take longer for me to be able to present a finished album to labels and also it will mean i won't be able to do any tours or gigs at the moment. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute in helping this project, i would be forever grateful for any shares and buzz about this campaign on social media etc. 

CONNECT WITH RAY NOIR

WEB: http://raynoir.com

FACEBOOK: http://facebook.com/ray.noir

TWITTER: http://twitter.com/thisisraynoir

INSTAGRAM: http://instagram.com/raynoir

YOUTUBE: https://youtube.com/channel/UCUwqjcd8ol1M64IQQO...

SPOTIFY: https://open.spotify.com/artist/3j7i3MN2ah2BR9A...

SOUNDCLOUD: http://soundcloud.com/ray-noir

story:
Please help support The Discs debut album, a punk rock/new wave project by musician Allan Day.

Why?

Because a troubled 15 year old kid named Allan Day was so moved by punk rock that he began writing his own songs, chronicling the world around him, emulating his idols.

Because those songs were typed on a Smith Corona and lay in a bin for years, chord progressions committed to memory, some demoed over the years, others coaxed from the recesses.

Because of the failed efforts back then by that 15 year old to assemble a band called The Discs, even though he and fellow punk Glenn assembled a meeting with bassist Minda and others.  For lack of interest, though, the project was abandoned...until now.

Because recording and releasing a Discs album in hellish 2020 by this same guy would simply be more fun than not doing so. 

So, ladies and gentlemen, because the world needs some levity and fun right now, I’m proud to finally present the debut album by The Discs.

Please help support this project to help offset the costs of studio time by donating now.  There are incentives at each tier that include a digital copy of the album, complete 4 panel artwork, t-shirts, stickers as well as upper tier incentives such as DJ dance parties and private concerts.

Thanks for watching this and for your consideration - I really do appreciate it - and most importantly, thank you for making this 15 year old’s dream a reality!

story:
¿Quienes somos?

Como solemos decir; Somos Bullys y somos Rock, y con eso no hay mucho más que explicar.

  • Historia

Nos creamos 2015 en el barrio madrileño de Carabanchel. La primera formación contaba con Álvaro González Valor y Rafael Baldominos Gómez, ambos guitarristas con influencias del Rock más clásico español e internacional. Nuestra primera actuación, en acústico, tuvo lugar en la sala Metáforas ese mismo año.

 A lo largo del año 2016 se incorporaron a la banda Pablo García Barrero y Esteban García Valdivia mezclando diferentes influencias musicales para componer nuestras propias canciones y participando en festivales y en unas cuantas salas en Madrid.

En febrero de 2017 participamos con el musical ‘7 minutos para amarte’ actuando en directo y grabamos nuestro primer disco “Más que humano” en Random Waves Records.

A la banda se incorpora Sergio Águila-Collantes (Rubio) como batería y Nicolás Gilarranz como Bajista, tocando en festivales como el "Benalfest" de Malaga y compartiendo cartel con músicos como Izal, el Kanka... 

  • Actualidad

Actualmente nos encontramos en la grabación de nuestro próximo lanzamiento "Todo es Rock". Un disco cargado de mucho Rock & Roll y con el que nada volverá a ser lo mismo. 

Estamos contando con empresas como; Madame Lapie (Fotografías, diseños y redes), Live Hall Records (Productora), distribuidoras, empresas de video... 

Agradecemos (y recompensamos) mucho cualquier tipo de ayuda a hacer que éste proyecto continúe adelante para poder seguir creciendo poco a poco. 

¿Que necesitamos y que recompensas hay?

Buscamos poder pagar todo el proceso de preproducción, producción, postproducción y distribución, que lleva detrás cualquier material audiovisual, y queremos poder preparar un buen disco y buenos shows para vosotros. 

  • 15€: Disco “Todo es Rock” con nombre en créditos finales.
  • 20€: Disco “Todo es Rock” con nombre en créditos finales y firmado por toda la banda.
  • 25€: Disco “Todo es Rock” con nombre en créditos finales, firmado por toda la banda + Disco “Más que humano”.
  • 30€: Disco “Todo es Rock” con nombre en créditos finales, firmado por toda la banda + Disco “Más que humano” + Camiseta Bullys negra.
  • 35€: Disco “Todo es Rock” con nombre en créditos finales, firmado por toda la banda + Disco “Más que humano” + Disco “Pozaco inminente” + Camiseta Bullys negra.
  • 40€: Disco “Todo es Rock” con nombre en créditos finales, firmado por toda la banda + Camiseta Bullys negra + Acceso a prueba de sonido y backstage en concierto presentación.
  • 50€: Disco “Todo es Rock” con nombre en créditos finales, firmado por toda la banda + Concierto privado de presentación del disco (máx. 15 personas)
  • 75€: Disco “Todo es Rock” con nombre en créditos finales, firmado por toda la banda + Concierto privado de presentación del disco (máx. 15 personas) + Cena y copa con toda la banda.
  • 100€: Disco “Todo es Rock” con nombre en créditos finales, firmado por toda la banda + Concierto privado de presentación del disco (máx. 15 personas) + Cena y copa con toda la banda + Disco “Más que humano” + Disco “Pozaco inminente” + Camiseta Bullys negra

 

Impacto

El dinero recaudado, no solo nos ayudará con el lanzamiento del disco, si no que ayudara a mejorar la calidad de la banda todo lo posible a nivel de estudio y de directo.

Otras formas de ayudar

Una muy buena forma de colaborar con nosotros de forma ajena al Crowdfunding es la de comprar nuestros discos y merchandeising, y sobre todo ir a nuestros directos.

¡Muchas gracias familia!

¡Somos Bullys y somos Rock!

story:
We will be performing at the Jazz Gallery (NYC) on November 30 and December 1, performing at Firehouse 12 (New Haven) on December 2, and recording in studio on January 31 and February 1 for a fall 2017 release on the Firehouse 12 Records label. The project is partially supported by Firehouse 12, the Jazz Gallery, and the Tri-Centric Foundation, but I am also asking for the help of our community of friends and listeners. If this project interests you, and is something that you’d like to see come to fruition, I hope you will consider offering your active support.

To give a little bit of background: Earlier this year, Anthony Braxton’s Tri-Centric Foundation invited me to apply for a "Research & Development Micro-grant", a small infusion of capital to initiate new creative projects. The idea of this new double trio ensemble had been dancing around in my head; both the instrumentation and specific musicians were clear, and I could already imagine the musical interactions, the sounds, and the moods. While each member of the ensemble has an instrumental twin, their approaches couldn’t be more different. The group features both long-time collaborations and first-time meetings, including my first chance to play with Gerald, one of my heroes on the drums. 

I’ve spent much of the last year composing the music, including a very productive residency at the Montalvo Arts Center in Northern California this past September. The music is very much inspired by grandmothers—my French grandmother whom I never met, my Japanese grandmother who continues to live in the home adjacent to the Buddhist temple where my grandfather was priest, my American step-grandmother who passed this year and who never treated me any different than her blood grandchildren, and my Iranian step-grandmother who is nearing the end of her incredible life as an educator and author after a recent stroke. The Micro-grant offered me an opportunity to follow that idea and develop compositions and concepts for this group, the Jazz Gallery is providing the venue for the premiere and development of the music, and Firehouse 12 is providing the production expertise and studio for the recording, but I need your help to pay all the musicians for their time and creativity. While I am proud of the music I've composed, I am most excited by all that I can not yet imagine from the incredible musicians in this ensemble. 

If you are excited about this ensemble and recording project, about the musical potential for creative moments, please consider one of the support options to the right. 

Thank you!

Tomas

The Tomas Fujiwara Double Trio:

Ralph Alessi - trumpet

Taylor Ho Bynum - cornet

Mary Halvorson - guitar

Brandon Seabrook - guitar

Gerald Cleaver - drums

Tomas Fujiwara - drums

story:
I am Heather Martini. I am a singer, songwriter, & artist. I have played music for over 10 years with multiple bands. This will be my first EP.
    These songs are written from experiences that have deeply healed me & opened my heart in ways I did not know were possible. These experiences have torn through the hardness of self-protection and brought me to a place of experiencing deep intimate love. I hope that they do the same for those that hear them. I hope they stir a desire to settle for nothing less than being truly known and completely possessed by love.  
    You can support this project by giving financially, sharing and promoting it. Thank you!

This will be my first EP.    These songs are written from experiences that have deeply healed me & opened my heart in ways I did not know were possible. I hope they stir a desire to settle for nothing less than being truly known and completely possessed by love.      You can support this project by giving financially, sharing and promoting it. Thank you!

story:
For the second season of Elements concert series, we are going off the beaten path, blending genres and instrumentation,and creating programs you won't find anywhere else in Austin. We start off in November with Julie Silva and members of Indimaj in Asfur, a program that blends Mideastern folk music, jazz, and classical music by Middle Eastern composers.  In January horn player Anne-Marie and violinist Sean Riley will  join me for Eroica.  Think music that's bold, heroic, and brassy, culminating in one of my favorite chamber works-Brahms' Horn Trio in E flat.  To celebrate Women's month, we have Femme- a concert with music by all women composers.  My collaborators will be two of my favorite women, mezzo soprano Liz Cass and cellist Barbara George.  Finally, we close the season with Groove: classical music with intense rhythm and drive.  Adam Bedell, percussionist from Line upon Line, and local violinist Turner Partain will help me bring the house down with classical music that will make you wanna dance (or at least tap your foot).  Here's a rundown of our dates/times.

Asfur:  Sunday November 4 at 8pm

Eroica: Saturday January 26 at 8pm and Sunday January 27 at 8:30pm

Femme: Sunday March 24 at 8pm and Monday March 25 at 8pm

Groove: Friday April 19 at 8pm

This year we are expanding, with two performances of most programs and two collaborators on each.  Of course, putting on events costs money, and for each concert, we’ll need funding for marketing, programs, ticketing, and the venue rental.  These expenses together add up to about half of the $1000 dollars I’m raising for each concert. The other half allows me to pay the performing artists.  I’m very proud to bring you award winning performers from the Austin area, and these funds allow me to pay them for their imaginative, moving performances they are bringing to the stage. Of course, for perks we offer season tickets, ticket packages, signed posters, and all donors will be recognized in the program for their generous support.  

Together we can help continue this concert series in Austin, but also support art events that focus on collaboration and open up classical music performance to be heard in new and refreshing ways.  For years, and I have organized recitals and performances as a private teacher, and have co-curated concerts with ACMC during their summer festival for the past 10 years. Through these years of programming I have collaborated with dozens with amazing performers, and amazed at how the concerts are already coming into shape.  Last year I was so moved by the experience of collaborating with friends and connecting with a local audience.  A series like this is a big undertaking, but I’ve already been blown away by the enthusiasm of the other artists involved, the interest shown on social media, and the aid of my marketing team. With their continued support and a strong showing from the Austin community, I’m confident we can keep bringing Austin a great concerts!

Remember even if you can’t donate, you can always support the campaign and the series by word of mouth, sharing and liking us on social media, and attending our performances.  Everything counts, and whatever you do, thank you for sharing in this experience with me. See you at the concerts!

Final Concert Schedule:

We start off in November with Julie Silva and members of Indimaj in Asfur, a program that blends Mideastern folk music, jazz, and classical music by Middle Eastern composers.  In January horn player Anne-Marie and violinist Sean Riley will  join me for Eroica.  Think music that's bold, heroic, and brassy, culminating in one of my favorite chamber works-Brahms' Horn Trio in E flat.  To celebrate Women's month, we have Femme- a concert with music by all women composers.  My collaborators will be two of my favorite women, mezzo soprano Liz Cass and cellist Barbara George.  Finally, we close the season with Groove: classical music with intense rhythm and drive.  Adam Bedell, percussionist from Line upon Line, and local violinist Turner Partain will help me bring the house down with classical music that will make you wanna dance (or at least tap your foot).  Here's a rundown of our dates/times.Asfur:  Sunday November 4 at 8pmEroica: Saturday January 26 at 8pm and Sunday January 27 at 8:30pmFemme: Sunday March 24 at 8pm and Monday March 25 at 8pmGroove: Friday April 19 at 8pmThis year we are expanding, with two performances of most programs and two collaborators on each.  Of course, putting on events costs money, and for each concert, we’ll need funding for marketing, programs, ticketing, and the venue rental.  These expenses together add up to about half of the $1000 dollars I’m raising for each concert. The other half allows me to pay the performing artists.  I’m very proud to bring you award winning performers from the Austin area, and these funds allow me to pay them for their imaginative, moving performances they are bringing to the stage. Of course, for perks we offer season tickets, ticket packages, signed posters, and all donors will be recognized in the program for their generous support.  Together we can help continue this concert series in Austin, but also support art events that focus on collaboration and open up classical music performance to be heard in new and refreshing ways.  For years, and I have organized recitals and performances as a private teacher, and have co-curated concerts with ACMC during their summer festival for the past 10 years. Through these years of programming I have collaborated with dozens with amazing performers, and amazed at how the concerts are already coming into shape.  Last year I was so moved by the experience of collaborating with friends and connecting with a local audience.  A series like this is a big undertaking, but I’ve already been blown away by the enthusiasm of the other artists involved, the interest shown on social media, and the aid of my marketing team. With their continued support and a strong showing from the Austin community, I’m confident we can keep bringing Austin a great concerts!Remember even if you can’t donate, you can always support the campaign and the series by word of mouth, sharing and liking us on social media, and attending our performances.  Everything counts, and whatever you do, thank you for sharing in this experience with me. See you at the concerts!Final Concert Schedule:

story:
Short Summary

 

Transports Project is an Inter-Cultural Music Project bringing together French and Indian artists. This collaboration is one of its kind, blending the two cultures and their musical styles aesthetically into one. This project is spearheaded by Julie Bonnafont and her group of lyricists from France, whose tour across the Indian state of Tamil Nadu inspired them to pen-down their experiences in French. As music students of A R Rahman’s K M Music Conservatory, we got on board this project in August 2017, to set music to these lyrics, giving rise to a fun collaboration and a very interesting music album of 14 songs! Under the guidance of our composition faculty, Dr. James Bunch, we were able to bring in flavors from across the country (Uttarakhand, Tamil Nadu, Delhi, Kerala etc) into a range of folk, pop and Indian Classical Music traditions into these French lyrics! 

This album, named ‘No Parking’ has been recorded in the Conservatory’s studio by our team of members in December 2017. The Premier Showcase took place at the Indo-French Chamber of Commerce and Industry (IFCCI) and received a warm reception. It is being produced by BECARRE PRODUCTION (A Record Label based out of Orleans, France) and is currently in the post-production stage.

Furthering this project, we, Aditya Ravindran & Karthik Manickavasakam, have been invited to join three other French Musicians, to showcase some songs from the album, across various cities in France, details of which are given below:

Tour itinerary:

01/06/2018: Les Bains-Douches (Lignières-18)

02/06/2018: Hors les murs (Orléans-45)

04/06/2018: Festival ASIE (Bourges-18)

05/06/2018: Festival ASIE (Bourges-18)

06/06/2018: La Chapelle Saint Mesmin (45)

08-09/06/2018: Festiv’art (Saint-Maur-36)

This project is the result of hard work and dedication of a number of students from the Conservatory, spanning 5 months. This showcase is a testament to all the efforts taken by these budding artists and will prove to be, important and fruitful to our careers as musicians.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised through this campaign will primarily sponsor our travel and support our living in France for the showcase tour. We hope to bring back something to cherish, to all contributors of this campaign, after the successful completion of this trip. The details of which will be revealed soon, we promise!

    The Impact

    This project is a showcase of many upcoming and talented artists of our country. A tour of this kind is nothing short of a dream-come-true for budding musicians. Setting Indian tunes to lyrics of a foreign language was no easy feat. We have poured our sweat and blood into this project, working through tedious long hours, ardently trying to beat those creative roadblocks. The true success of this project, or any music, lies in the hands of the audience and their appreciation is our true reward. We are excited to take our music one-step further, to France, hoping to receive the same warm reception that we did here, in our December concerts. Your contributions will go a great deal in realizing this dream of ours. Through this crowd-funding campaign, we invite you, to not just contribute, but to be a part of this special journey of ours!

    Risks & Challenges

    With one month to go for our showcase tour, the biggest challenge we are facing is the time constraint. However, we believe that we will be able to meet this campaign target soon enough through your contributions.  Any and every small contribution will go a long way and get us closer to our dream and destination. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    This campaign could be one of the lots, that you have come across. Or this could turn out to be one of those moments which reassures people's belief on the artists and artists’ belief on the people. You could be a part of this magic.

    This album means the world to us. Help us take this music to more people!

story:
My Story

My name is Kevin Gerdes. I am living in Los Angeles, CA where I take EVERY DAY to make my dream of making music happen! I have lived in LA for 1 year and 2 months. In such short time I have created my first single, which is now in the iTunes store for download! The song in titled "Come Away With Me". I have worked on various entertainment projects from modeling, to acting, and singing. Other then releasing my single this year I am mostly proud of my featured role on the NBC comedy Outsourced.


As the release of my first single is complete, I am now focused on my second song. I have got to keep this fire burning! I am working with an AWESOME music producer, Mark Grilliot. Mark has worked with various entertainment professionals and celebrities. I know that I am very blessed to be able to work with such a talented man. I find our relationship works so well because not only are we music partners, we are friends.


My second song is going to continue in the genere of Pop. However, unlike my first song it will be slightly slower and more of a defined love story. Think Bruno Mars.


I have a deadline of 60 days to raise the funds for this project, however I am eager to begin the song as soon as possible! It is important to always have something fresh for the world to hear!


The Impact

The impact that this project has on others is always, like anything I work hard on, is to inspire people to dream. I come from a town in Maryland where it is not uncommon to get stuck in one way of life. I love to give people the ability to have hope in themselves and to never give up on their dreams. I receive everything from emails, text messages, facebook and twitter messages, etc from past friends congratulating me on how far I have come since here in LA. Some also tell me how much I have allowed them to be excited about possibility again. That in itself is an amazing feeling. Knowing that you can inspire others through believing that your dreams will come true is out of this world. 


So the impact of this project and anything that I do is to inspire the people that this song will touch. To let people know that, DREAMS DO COME TRUE!


Oh and there is one more... My older brothers have a child each. Hearing from them that their children dance along to my songs is one of the best feelings that I've ever felt. I live 3,000 miles from my niece and nephew. Being able to do things that I have always loved such as making music and for them to be able to listen and dance to MY MUSIC is a way for me to be directly in their lives.


What We Need & What You Get

Lets break this down. We all know that VERY LITTLE is done for free. To make this second song a reality for myself and for YOU $1300.00 is needed to be raised. Every penny that is raised will be used entirely on this project. No matter how much money is raised, all of it will go to this music project. If more the the projected goal is raised then the balance thereafter will go to funding the next song! Lets make an ALBUM!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help by donating money to my project then NO PROBLEM! If you dont have $1.00 to give to this project... then NO PROBLEM! I bet you know someone who does! 


It is important that everyone realize that I am only able to reach a limited amount of people via the internet. So I ask you... take ONE moment and use the share tools on this page or copy and paste this link onto your facebook, myspace, twitter, and other social network pages so that your friends and family can give to this project. If you show that this is important to you. If you show people that aiding in the development of others goals and lifelong dreams is important to YOU, then others will follow your actions! 


Thank you for taking time to read this and thank you for your support in anyway that you can give it!


- Positivity breeds Positivity!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! I am passionate about music but most importantly being able to spread all the talent there is out there whether it be in a huge city or a small little town no one has ever heard of. Talent should be shared and accessible no matter where you are! Help me get there…

With your contribution i can start this project, build the site and spread the love...

What We Need & What You Get

25k - To build the interactive website and have mobile app access -  this price surprised me too although to build and maintain a successful website you can't make short cuts. I am working with a great company that can help with building and maintaining this musical talent goldmine! 

2k- Equipment, logo design, brochures, business cards

1k - Register my business with the state and process all the correct documentation that goes with it - legal work

    The Impact

    Everyone no matter where they are should be able to use their musical talents for good and get some work from it as well! This will be a place to connect. 

      Risks & Challenges

      Starting a new venture and business will always have hurdles but I anticipate good hurdles. I anticipate having a lot of traction and needing to work closely with the web developer to upkeep the site. I also anticipate a lot of time on my end needed to filter and monitor - I work at a computer desk and I also have the nights and weekends off so I plan to make this project my #1! I believe in this and I know it will bring so much opportunity to people that may not have been able to showcase themselves. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Share my indiegogo with others please and keep an eye out :)

story:
Le projet

Il s'agit d'aider Hot Hell RooM en participant au financement de la session d'enregistrement et de mixage en studio de leur deuxième album.



Après 11 ans d'existence et plusieurs concerts en France, Hot Hell RooM à décidé d'enregistrer une dixaine de titres au Hybreed Studio (7th Nemesis, The Arrs...). Les batteries seront enregistrées au Roots Notes Studio par Pierre Houllier.



L'enregistrement débutera au printemps 2015 sur une durée de 20 jours (enregistrement et mix compris).



Un graphiste se chargera du visuel de l'album qui restera simple. Enfin, si possible, un attaché de presse se chargera de faire vivre l'album dès sa sortie.



L'existence de ce disque permettra au groupe de se professionnaliser et d'étendre sa notoriété à la France et l'Europe, mais soyons francs le but étant de jouer du Rock dans un maximum de pays.

A quoi vont servir les fonds

Location du Studio "Hybred Studio" à Fontenay sous Bois 94 pour l'enregistrement et le mixage des prises.



Mastering de l'album



Rémunération de l'ingénieur du son pour l'enregistrement et le mixage..



Rémunération du créateur de la pochette du disque.

Pressage de l'album



Réalisation d'un clip vidéo



Création d'une bâche de fond de scène

A propos de l'artiste

Hot Hell RooM a été créé en septembre 2003 par trois musiciens et amis de longue date : Alan Raoul à la basse (Invading Chapel, ex Coldown et 7th Nemesis), Loïc Malassagne au chant et à la guitare (Invading Chapel et ex Anthemon) et Stone à la batterie.
Une première démo autoproduite "Lies Box" (3 titres) voit le jour en octobre 2005 et sera suivie d’une série de plusieurs concerts courant l’année 2006.
L’album démo "Hot Hell Room" (12 titres) enregistré dans leur « studio maison » sera masterisé par le producteur américain Beau Hill (Alice Cooper, Europe, Ratt, Twisted Sister, Winger Etc...). Il sera disponible en numérique sur iTunes, Musicme et autres plate-formes via le label Alien Prod.
En janvier 2010, le batteur Stone quitte le groupe et sera remplacé par Ludovic Rouix (Ex-Evolvent, Ex Anthemon). Le titre "You Don't Belong To Them" apparait sur la compilation N°11 du webzine Pavillon 666 en juin 2010.
Entre septembre 2011 et février 2012, le groupe travaille sur son premier album officiel "Kali Yuga Bonfire" (12 titres) et il sera enregistré, mixé et masterisé au Hybreed Studio (As They Burn, The Arrs, 7th Nemesis...) par Andrew G, sauf pour les batteries qui seront enregistrées au Roots Notes Studio par Pierre Houllier.
Septembre 2012, le guitariste Shazybob vient renforcer le groupe pour les concerts.
Le titre "Wistful Sunset", extrait du nouvel album, apparait sur la compilation du webzine French Métal "La Colère Des Dieux " n°15 de décembre 2012.
Mai 2013, l'album "Kali Yuga Bonfire" est disponible via le e-shop de Dooweet Records. En juillet, le groupe sort son premier clip officiel avec le titre "Humanity Will Never Change" et il sera produit par Eddy Norman.


En Septembre 2013, Sébastien Luccioni rejoint le groupe en poste de guitariste complétant ainsi la formation.


D'autres façons d'aider


  • Tu peux partager et faire faire de la publicité autour de notre projet.

story:
for people who order garments or cover songs we will contact you to get size and colour or song request info as there is no place for you to add it. sorry for the inconvenience

Help the Dust Rhinos produce their next CD

The Dust Rhinos are Winnipeg's premiere Celtic Rock band, having shared the stage with bands from the Dropkick Murphys to Alabama. We have written a great bunch of new songs for our next album and of course, we want to turn them into the best album possible to share with you. To help us accomplish this, we have hired award-winning songwriter and producer Murray Pulver (Crash Test Dummies, Doc Walker) to produce the album. 

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to raise $7500 to help us offset our production and manufacturing costs.  We're not looking for you to pay for a big-ticket marketing team and an extravagant tour bus or anything; this money is going into making sure Murray and the engineers are all paid quickly and that we can have this great album out to you sooner than if we were raising all the money ourselves.

What we have for you in return is a list of great perks to thank you for your support. As the old saying goes, "one man's ceiling is another man's floor" and, with that in mind, we have developed a list of participation levels to include everyone. We appreciate anything you're willing to contribute.

Reaching Our Goal

For 20 years, the Dust Rhinos have been Winnipeg's premiere party band, and with this new CD, we want to bring our brand of Celtic Rock to a wider audience than ever before. 

We are very proud of all of our albums, but we always want our next album to surpass all of them. Recording our new original songs with Murray's production expertise will allow us to do just that. 

Anything we raise past our goal will be put into touring and further promotion of this new CD.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you aren't able to contribute financially to our success, there are plenty of ways that you could help us. Please like and share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, other social networking sites, and by talking to your friends and fellow music lovers! We are looking forward to growing our fan base with this new recording and we would love to have you along for the ride. 

      And that's all there is to it.

The Dust Rhinos are Winnipeg's premiere Celtic Rock band, having shared the stage with bands from the Dropkick Murphys to Alabama. We have written a great bunch of new songs for our next album and of course, we want to turn them into the best album possible to share with you. To help us accomplish this, we have hired award-winning songwriter and producer Murray Pulver (Crash Test Dummies, Doc Walker) to produce the album.    What We Need & What You Get We would like to raise $7500 to help us offset our production and manufacturing costs.  We're not looking for you to pay for a big-ticket marketing team and an extravagant tour bus or anything; this money is going into making sure Murray and the engineers are all paid quickly and that we can have this great album out to you sooner than if we were raising all the money ourselves.
What we have for you in return is a list of great perks to thank you for your support. As the old saying goes, "one man's ceiling is another man's floor" and, with that in mind, we have developed a list of participation levels to include everyone. We appreciate anything you're willing to contribute.
  Reaching Our Goal For 20 years, the Dust Rhinos have been Winnipeg's premiere party band, and with this new CD, we want to bring our brand of Celtic Rock to a wider audience than ever before. 
We are very proud of all of our albums, but we always want our next album to surpass all of them. Recording our new original songs with Murray's production expertise will allow us to do just that. 
Anything we raise past our goal will be put into touring and further promotion of this new CD.
  Other Ways You Can Help Even if you aren't able to contribute financially to our success, there are plenty of ways that you could help us. Please like and share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, other social networking sites, and by talking to your friends and fellow music lovers! We are looking forward to growing our fan base with this new recording and we would love to have you along for the ride. 

 And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello everyone and thank you for taking the time to read my request! My name is Lucy and I am a music student at The Ohio State University, majoring in Music Education and Vocal Performance. I have been offered the opportunity to study opera and sing in Italy later this summer with Music Academy International's Trentino Music Festival. I have been in New York at the Manhattan School of Music Summer Voice Festival and from there will be traveling to Trentino, Italy in July to sing under the tutelage of the renowned Opera star Renata Scotto. 

 While this is a chance of a lifetime, and many people have encouraged me to  go for it, I was concerned my ability to cover airfare, room and board, etc. A friend suggested I turn to crowd funding, so here I am! I would appreciate any help you can give to further my dream. 

"To send light into the darkness of men's hearts--such is the duty of the artist"

-Robert Schumann


Thanks, 

Lucy
