story:
Mythological Horses is recording our second full length album this fall, and we need our friends and fans and YOUR HELP to make it happen. We will be recording in late September in Seattle, Washington with Tad Doyle of the legendary SubPop band TAD. 

We will be spending four days in the studio which will cost around  $1,600. The other $400 will go toward transportation (none of us own cars) and gear (strings, drum heads, etc). 

We only have a very short time to raise this money. We have been on tour the majority of the past 8 months straight and are flat broke,in fact we are currently on tour stuck in Alaska with no plane tickets home but that's a different story.

We are giving our life on the road to create new music and bring it to the world!

Believe in Rock n Roll! Believe in us! 

Thank you and blessings


MYTHOLOGICAL HORSES LOVES YOU!


Mythological Horses Self-Titled LP Out Now on Hovercraft Records.

Mythological Horses is the brainchild of Anchorage, Alaska-born singer/songwriter Shawn Holley. Before the formation of the Horses, Holley released a handful of anti-folk cassettes and digital albums while living the Hunter S. Thompson lifestyle of excessive partying, traveling and writing. Holley has toured non-stop over the past decade living on the road out of a Care Bear suitcase with a beat up acoustic guitar. He managed to survive a brutal touring schedule that often took him to the brink of 200 live performances per year.

Credited for his non stop touring and DIY ethic, Holley and Mythological Horses have shared the DIY values of like-minded bands such as The Pharmacy and Kimya Dawson. A few years ago, Holley put a full band together. The Mythological Horses new lineup began writing more straight forward garage punk tunes with catchy leads and memorable choruses.

The current lineup consists of Shawn Holley on rhythm guitar and vocals, Jest Commons (formerly of Moldy Peaches) on drums,Chris Vanbibber on lead guitar, Johnny Chee on lead guitar and Justin Ober on Bass.

Last summer the band entered the studio in Seattle, Washington to record their first official full-length album with Tad Doyle of the Sub Pop band TAD. The album was then mixed by Andrew Crowley (St Paul, MN) and mastered by legendary Seattle producer Jack Endino. 

 Hovercraft Records released the album in 2014.

The Mythological Horses debut album is now available for purchase on limited edition colored vinyl (pink and white) via Mythologicalhorses.bandcamp.com and HovercraftPDX.com

story:
Wine Country Tales, Volume 1: Sonoma and Napa - Preview on SoundCloud

This innovative CD and DVD pairs the guitar music of Brian Gore with art by Bill Russell, to tell stories of the California wine country and coast. The CD features 8 original guitar songs inspired by the history and environs of Marin, Sonoma and Napa. The DVD includes 6 original animated stories that highlight interesting people and places in the wine country, including: Muir Woods, The Last California Mission, Jack London's Wolf House, Robert Louis Stevenson's "Silverado Squatters," the misadventures of Edward Bale and his Grist Mill in St. Helena, and the story of Chinese immigrant labor. 

In terms of the flow of the music and art – we conceived this as a tour north from San Francisco into the wine country. You'll pass by Muir Woods, so consider a visit to the towering redwoods. Then head up to Sonoma, near the town of Glen Ellen and the ruins of the Wolf House in Jack London State Park. From there, it’s easy to trek into Napa Valley and Bale's Mill south of Calistoga. You'll then travel through St. Helena,  and into the town of Napa. It’s a kind of “musical map,” of the region – and by no means an exhaustive one. There’s so much to see and do here. But the stories we’ve chosen reveal a lot about the depth of influences that shape the region.

There's nothing like this pairing of guitar music and original art in an original duo. Some of the art we have integrated into this unique CD and DVD package was created live during our concert performances. Our first project together, "Santa Cruz in Song and Image," also a musical map, combined music with static illustrations, which suited the inspiring scenic environs and pastoral music we chose. For “Wine Country,” we started telling tales using multi-media; so, in this release, we include a DVD of animated videos, alongside an audio CD of the music.

 Your contributions will go towards helping us recoup our investment in developing and producing the release. This process has taken more than a year of work, and has had its challenges.  The subjects and locations we treated required more than just matching beautiful songs and images to them. Each song on this album tells its own true story, supported by the videos and illustrations. This involved painstaking preparation, research, and even some historical scholarship.  The result is an inspiring auditory and visual experience - combining art and music into a one-of-a-kind release.

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to get enough funds to recoup our labor, production and promotion costs for this release.  That includes production costs for the beautifully designed 4-panel digipack CD/DVD and 24-page booklet, the 8 songs and many lush and beautiful illustrations and animations that go into the DVD.  

Support of the project helps us continue the work of this innovative duo which we want to expand into a second volume featuring other wine country regions of California. In the process, you'll receive a great product that provides a source of new discoveries for you about the region, as well as how art and music can be combined in innovative ways.

 

For guitar aficionados, we have a special gift pack of strings, string winder and tuner from D'Addario/Planet Waves.


The Impact

At first, we originally thought of "Wine Country" as a fun way to make beautiful art and music about a richly inspiring region.  But we realized the project would need to be more than sweet songs set to lovely pastoral image sequences. We discovered many larger than life characters that involved some stranger than fiction stories in the history of the wine country. We made a few real discoveries that will surprise you and some 'hidden' stories - that really need to be told and deserve wider recognition.  


    Other Ways You Can Help

    We have offered perks at several different levels, so everyone can have a chance to contribute. Over the course of the campaign, we will be reaching out personally to all of our friends asking for their support, both in donating and spreading the word. We think this can be a success because of you!

story:
Update - We have reached 100% !!

WOW, thank you very very much! Zsófi is dancing, Ariel already called grandma and Gyuri ate a whole bag of cookies. We have reached the 100% and this warms our hearts very much.
We would like to thank you for all your help and support and the love that we received in the last two weeks. With this funds we can fully realise the dream we imagined for our first live album.

The Next step - New tours, new web design

Having reached this point, we dream the next step: with more support we can reach more people.
Our mission is to share our music far and wide, and with the additional funds ($1800-$3600) you will help us to:
- Create a new website
- Promote our music
- Fund our upcoming Winter Tour (Vienna, Prague, Berlin, Cesky Krumlov) 1-7 December (details on our fb page)
- Design a new costume
- Assist us in launching our Israel tour!! (coming next spring)

We have also added new rewards (perks) to the campaign: 
- TIcket for 2 to the concert for $12 (bring your friend, partner or your favourite neighbour!)
- Keep it in the Sun physical CD shipped to you for $15 (with this perk we wish to reach out to those who have not heard us before and want to hold our beautiful first studio album in their hands)  

We meet you on the 28th of November in Budapest, Hungary (or wherever you are via live streaming!)

With Love,
Ariel, Zsófi, Gyuri aka Matana
14th Nov, 2014 (Zsófi's house, Nagymaros, Hungary) 


Our Story

A big dream can come true for Matana with a LIVE ALBUM RECORDING CONCERT this November 28th in the Magnet House Budapest, Hungary.

After traveling across Europe and giving concerts at festivals, ashrams, yoga studios as well as street performances we became rich in musical experiences and made beautiful friendships along the way in many countries. This live concert in November would be the storytelling of our adventures and our musical explorations since we met under a tree 4 years ago. 

Our sound comes from the mixture of classic instruments such as the Violin, Guitar and the new millennium wonder - the Hang sound sculpture (sometimes referred to as Hang Drum). Together, along with vocals inspired in part by Hungarian folk motifs, the Matana sound experience takes the listener on an inwards journey. 

We have invited several guest musicians to join us, friends we love to play with, including Ninka Nassif from Ilhaam Project (France).
(http://www.ilhaamproject.com)

Recording the live album will allow us to capture those special moments created from the attention of the audience and the rich atmosphere of the space.It is like a tree, alive, having rhythmic roots, harmonic trunk, melodical branches and everyone involved being a leaf capturing the light of the Sun. Matana means gift in Hebrew and this live album would be a very big matana for both us and for our fans as one of our strongest features is being sensitive for the present moment and creating music from the connection of it. Please support us by watering our tree and be part of it by helping our dream come true and spreading the word.


Our Budget

Of the 4,200 USD (about 3,300€) the bulk will be used for recording, mixing, mastering and producing the new live CD, with the rest going towards supporting our guest musicians, facebook advertising, CD sleeve design, streaming the concert, video shoot, indiegogo & paypal commisions and reward costs.

Stretch Goals

All additional funds will go towards supporting our musical journey, allowing us to continue expanding our music and sharing it with the world.

A Taste of Our Rewards

Our first studio album, the classic 'Keep It In The Sun' 


The Grand Prize! A Disco Armonico (the Italian Hang) handmade by Marco Della Ratta in support of our campaign - hand delivered by us together with a house concert and more rewards...!

story:
So, here's the deal:

Hi everyone, my name is George Velez, Jr. and I started a big salsa band back in 2008 once my dad retired from his 9-5.  We figured it would make a nice father-son hobby.  Well, since then, GRUPO ARCANO has been creating some buzz on the global scene after we released our debut album in 2012.  There is now demand for a follow up album, but we also have come to know the value of a high quality music video.  So here's the gist:

  • Our NEWEST single, LA RUTINA DEL MUJERIEGO, is straight up amazing and all of the other songs that we have been preparing are just as catchy and sweet but we need the funds and sponsorship to be able to bring them to life and make them available for all of you (our friends and fans).
  • We are itching to make our follow up album and include a professional, storyline music video as well.  Not a video of the band 'playing' but more story based, like the late great M.J.
  • We would be able to reach a greater number of people through newer avenues that require this type of media/video.  We can submit to prime Music Video stations, among other things. A dream come true for my dad.. and, of course, it'd be nice to have YOUR name attached to the credits for making it happen!

What We Need & What You Get:

  • Realistically, a full album can run in the 10s of thousands, but I believe we can make one for about $20,000.  The $5,000 goal is at least to secure that we can begin the process and possible prepare 2-3 more songs.  If we meet our base goal, then all of the funds will go straight to studio recording session.
  • Regarding a video, after having many conversations with different videographers and directors, the average quote has kinda been between $5,000 - $8,000.  We love to play but local musicians just don't earn or get enough to really make these things happen easily.
  • Now, we are really interested in cooperation and participation, in any form.  So, at the very least, having your name appear in the final credits is pretty damn cool.

The Impact

Helping someone achieve a goal is one thing.  Helping a family obtain a dream is far greater.  Your pledge and contribution moves us one step closer to that dream:

  • Grupo Arcano breaks the mold in so many ways.  We keep the essence of traditional salsa without making it something else, yet we've brought such a new and refreshing sound and face to the scene, let's keep moving forward..
  • Oour first album (Desde El Otro Lado Del East River) was considered by many one of the best albums released in 2012.  we received an award for Best Album from Manchester, UK for the album.  We have begun to catch the eye of some nice big festivals like, MUSIKFEST in Bethlehem, PA.
  • We really love making new friends and fans and nowadays we have something most of us never had before years ago. We can have ACCESS to the musicians as fans!.  We want you to really be a part of this experience so we will share pics and videos and are even available to chat whenever.  It's a privilege for us to communicate with all of you.

Challenges

Having and sustaining such a big band is not easy (Arcano is 13 musicians).  Local venues do not pay out enough and almost always try to "encourage" us to cut down the size of our band.  REALLY?!  They want us to lose the integrity of our music and sound for a few dollars?  The fight to maintain and remain such a big band is difficult and some of us have demanding responsibilities (just like all of you) outside of the band.  But, Arcano has way more than POTENTIAL.  We have GREAT chemistry that comes across every time we play.  So many have begun gravitating toward our music.  And others look to actively disrupt what we have going, sad but true.

We are looking for ways to mend these type of attitudes in the genre by inviting others to guest in on some of our works.. but this VIDEO would be a HUGE step in reaching a wider audience.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you, our dear friends, might just not be able to contribute at this time, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask family and friends to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Share this INDIEGOGO link for us!

And that's all there is to it.

 And that's all there is to it.

story: On the heels of 2013's "Jesus Christ Supernova: The Heavy Metal Soundtrack" comes "Metal Kalikimaka -  Volume 1" a Heavy Metal Christmas album featuring many of the same awesome musicians and vocalists from JCSN, as well as some awesome newcomers to the Tin Idol family! Based out of Hawai'i, Tin Idols, as the collective group is billed, does not disappoint with 17 tracks of your favorite Christmas songs done in the Heavy metal style and includes one original Christmas song as well! As with JCSN when you do an album of cover songs, licensing fees must be paid and this campaign to to help offset those costs. As with JCSN we will be offering some nifty perks from Tin Idol Productions for your generous donations! Once again mahalo for your support!

story:
Horace "H" Brown III

Hi, my name is Horace Brown III, but my friends call me "H".

  • I have been singing since the tender age of 4. From grade school - college, and so on singing just about everything from opera to R&B.
  • What I have been working on for the past few years is a solo demo which now totals about 18track that have self produced in the realm of hip hop/R&B.
  • What I strive to bring out in my music an earthy soulful truth about life, not candy coating the struggles there in with the hope that others will sing along.

What I Will Achieve With Your Help:

  • Too often today the music scene force feeds us a rarely changing selection of artists whom cycle and recycle through the airwaves with toe tapping cuts from the music factory until the sound changes or the shock value fades. I need your help to improve the fantasy with a slice of life.
  • As I have stated, over the past five years I have been working on my demo album, Blu Soul. I have written, sung, and produced all of these tracks myself in my own home studio with some collaboration from fellow artists here in Texas. Now I am looking to move these works into a more professional project which will require some upgrades in equipment and marketing.
  • This is where your blessed contributions come in. Technology has allowed almost all of us the opportunity to be the masters of the moment, but for a cost. Through hard work I have made some great music, and with your help I shall make it greater so that others can hear.

And if you can't help...

Just enjoy the songs. Let others know so they can sing along ;)

Thank you,

H

       (Please Check Out Other Songs in my Gallery Under Videos)

story:
Couple Colleen (Coco) and Dave (David!), of Construction & Destruction (Construction and Destruction) have recently finished recording their fourth album together, entitled MUTATIS MUTANDIS (-which is a Latin term meaning, roughly, the necessary changes having been made). C & D are interested in making some necessary changes too, in terms of releasing this most recent album on vinyl, a feat that has thus far eluded them, due to being poor-ish. But they have always felt a wealth of support from friends and family and interested listeners, and are grateful for it. And, are once again (sorry!) appealing for this support from any who might be in a position to give it.
In order to press the new album on vinyl, C&D need to raise $2200. Any financial kindness will be rewarded in C & D goods: their entire discography is available, as well as their Emotionally Available/Unavailable hand-woodburned doorhangers, and hoodies and t-shirts designed by them (or sister Marianne Collins) and manufactured in Nova Scotia, Canada at Stanfield’s.
Construction & Destruction have been quietly making work from their rural home by the sea in Nova Scotia for about six years now, and have been generously rewarded for their efforts by being invited to play and tour throughout Canada and Europe. Construction & Destruction’s work can be perused at:
myspace
facebook
And they’ve been fortunate to come across the following kind words describing their musical efforts:
Doomily experimental garage-rock
-Time Out London
[L]iterate lo-fi […;] it deserves your full attention, absolutely. Only with all one’s attention directed hereto is the true beauty of Construction & Destruction realised.
-Musings On Linguistics And Cheese
Construction & Destruction might not fit into the average listener’s wheelhouse, but what they are doing is worth your time. […] They push themselves and challenge you to stay with them, offering you little rewards at the most unexpected times.
-Herohill

Any support shown in the past has been greatly appreciated, and has enabled them to keep at it when things’ve gotten rough, making getting up in the mornings (-afternoons?) that much easier. Any support sent their way at this time would be incredibly appreciated, as things are pretty tight, and help would enable them not only to fulfill their long-time desire to have their work pressed to vinyl, but also to continue slogging away at the making of their work at all. C & D’s approach to making work has often been cited as “do-it-yourself”, but this is not entirely true. They’ve been bolstered by the generosity of others, and could not make the work without help.
Please know that if the fundraising goal is met and exceeded, any additional funds would be put into keeping their musical engine puttering… And please feel free to pass this appeal along to anyone who might be interested…
Thank you!
THANK YOU!

story:
Sample music at the following facebook fan pages:

http://www.facebook.com/juneausksy#!/pages/Juneau-Sky/188243641236644

http://www.facebook.com/pages/Sarah-St-Germain/212360128837979?ref=ts

Greetings!
Hey folks! This is Tony from Juneau Sky. Sarah and I wanted to start off by saying thank you for stopping by to check out our fundraiser. We are here because we believe we can crack the music business code and earn our livings doing music. We have the talent, determination, and vision for a career in music that is modest yet sustainable. Hopefully you are here because you feel the same!

Why We Need Your Help
It’s no secret that the music business is a tricky beast. It is because of this conundrum: record labels want to sign bands with a following, yet most bands can’t develop a serious following without the support of a label.

This is where the proverbial “break through” comes in to play. Every band that “breaks” has a unique story, yet there is one part that is universal: lots and lots of touring. We want to tour regularly and vigorously in order to gain maximum exposure. Touring translates into CD sales, YouTube hits, fan traffic on websites, and networking with music industry people. This is what labels want to see!

On our last tour we found we lacked certain key promotional tools: a record of Sarah’s music and a music video for Juneau Sky. Our goal is to raise $3,750 to film a video and make a record in preparation for our second tour, the NEW YEAR TOUR. We will be driving across the southern United States and up the west coast, playing 20-30 shows in a variety of formats, including house concerts, popular music venues, and street performing.  We believe that management, publishers, and labels are waiting around the corner for us to show up, with 10,000 YouTube hits and 5,000 song downloads!

Here is where your money will go:
1. Sarah’s EP “Being and Becoming” - $1,200
2. Juneau Sky’s  music video - $1,300
3. Tour support (a cushion for unexpected costs, car repairs, etc.) - $1,000
*IndieGoGo and paypal fees (7% total) - $250

Perks
Since this is not a charity, anyone who donates to this fundraiser will receive a "perk." A perk is essentially a thank you gift for your contribution. In addition, all contributors are invited to a free show at the Axum Level X Lounge in Washington, DC the evening of January 15th.

 

FRIEND OF A FRIEND Tour - A Success Story
The FRIEND OF FRIEND tour (FOF) was a two week experiment with house concert touring. There were eight shows during the tour, starting in Northampton, MA, and ending in Miami, FL. It grossed $1,300 and yielded a profit of $600 after expenses (gas, food, etc.). In addition, we raised $160 for the Latino Economic Development Corporation, a non-profit that hosted a concert as a fundraiser in Wheaton, MD.  All the money raised was by donation, including CD “sales.”  

Let us take this opportunity to say one more huge thank you to everyone who came out to support the FRIEND OF A FRIEND tour! It was a total success, on many levels, and was an incredible learning experience. We learned so much about why touring is the way bands break into the music business. We met so many lovely people, all showering us with support and encouragement, which made the burden of traveling totally worth it. We learned that the more people we played for, the more likely we were to be discovered. We also learned that within our own small community of friends, friends of friends, and family there were tremendous amounts of resources waiting to be uncovered and put to use.

A Love Story
Tony Bernardo of Juneau Sky had just finished recording his new album, Come Back Together, when he met Sarah St. Germain. Eager to form a band and promote the new album, Tony set out for Northampton - a more urban part of western Massachusetts than his former home in Shutesbury. After a frustrating month and a half of searching for a place he stumbled upon a small house just outside of town, but more importantly, a beautiful housemate! Turns out she was also a singer/songwriter and despite all odds, a pretty darn good one. Their shared passion for music provided a spark, but both were weary of dating their housemate.

Never the less, they began having unofficial dates in their living room. Before you knew it they were “taking it slow” and “getting to know each other first.” Then something special happened: Sarah sang her original song Little Lives to Tony. That sealed the deal! It didn’t take long for Sarah to admit to her mutual feelings for Tony, and so they began testing their chemistry, both romantically and musically.

In a flurry of passion, they began fleshing out Sarah’s songs one by one. Sarah was able to overcome her crucial handicap of not being able to play an instrument and Tony was able to take a break from his own music to facilitate Sarah’s development. Rather than form a group together and risk smothering each other, as so many other couples would have, they decided to honor their unique, distinct styles and accompany one another in their independent projects. Their vision for interdependent musical partnership materialized this fall during the FOF tour.

The Timeline
STEP 1 - Finish Sarah’s EP “Becoming.” During the FOF tour there was demand for a recording of Sarah’s music. We are in the process of writing, arranging, and producing Sarah’s introductory record. It will be five songs of her original music with songwriting contributions from Tony. Thanks to the generous support of Stone Kawala (www.stonekawala.com) they will be making the record at home for almost nothing ($200). They will need to pay for mixing/mastering ($325) and duplication ($475). An additional $200 will be book marked for expenses during our week in DC mixing the record and filming the video.

STEP 2 - Recording Juneau Sky’s music video ($650). Alma production (also found at www.stonekawala.com/services) has agreed to film a music video for “On My Feet,” the first single from Juneau Sky. It will be a spoof of a Starbucks commercial (several people told Tony that it should be on a Starbucks commercial, but he refused to sell out!). The song will also be re-recorded and re-mixed at Inner Ear, a state of the art studio in Washington, DC ($650). This will help bring the song up to commercial quality so that it matches the quality of the video.

STEP 3 -  Launch the NEW YEAR TOUR! Armed with a record of Sarah’s music, a killer video of “On my Feet,” and a $1,000 worth of tour support we’re going to win fans, build a buzz, and get the attention of cool industry pros! We set sail the last week of January!

Thank you all so much for your loving support and encouragement! We could not do this without you!

story:
Our Story

Firstly, we are huge post-rock fans. It was our dream for years to organize post-rock festival in our small country. This year, we started trying make our dreams happen. Now it is reality and our line-up includes post-rock stars like This Will Destroy You, Tides From Nebula, Lymbyc Systym etc. 

Whoneedslyrics?! festival is new DIY festival held in Bratislava - Slovakia from 18th to 19th September in two clubs rarely under one roof - in Batelier and Fuga. 

We also organize warm-up show with real post-rock legends - 65daysofstatic (on 4.8.2014)

In fact that Whoneedslyrics?! Festival is purely „do it yourself“ project (with no financial sponsors) we decided that we want and need you as our ''sponsors''.

What We Need & What You Get

Total whoneedslyrics?! festival budget for the 1st edition is 12 500€. 

We are D.I.Y. festival, so revenues will come only from ticket sales. That's why we need your help. All money raised will go towards the production of the festival, which is organized by real post-rock enthusiasts.

What you get? 2 days full of great bands, new post-rock friends and great experiences! :)

Of course, VIP tickets, t-shirts etc. are available only here.

And you can be sure that if we will raise more money than we expect, next edition will have more headliners and great bands and it will be the best festival in the whole world! :)

    Other Ways You Can Help

    You can:

    Just buy your ticket here: http://predpredaj.zoznam.sk/en/event/1333/whoneedslyrics--festival

    If you can't help us financially, great help for us is to share this on your FB, website etc.

    whoneedslyrics?! festival team

    festival is organized by
    Michal Goňa (line-up, finances...), Terézia Goňová (communication, artist manager), Ján Arbet (web), Veronika Klimonová (photo), Batelier and Fuga clubs team
    if you have any questions or suggestions feel free to write us here: info(at)whoneedslyrics.com

    line up

    This Will Destroy You /US/, Tides From Nebula /PS/, Lymbyc Systym /US/, Lehnen /AT/, Sounds Like the End of the World /PL/, The Ills /SK/, Rosa Parks /HU/, Cinématique /AT/, Fresh Out of the Bus /SK/, Inheritance /SK/, Line Gate /SK/, Our Stories /SK/, Via Anima /SK/, Kornelius W /SK/, more acts t.b.a

story:
What is Musical Amoeba?


Innovative, unique, eclectic - a new chamber music series has emerged from the primordial ooze of New York and is ready to take it's show to new and bigger audiences. Musical Amoeba is New York's newest music series, a concert series whose goal is presenting contemporary classical juxtaposed with the historical foundations that inspired it. 

In it's first year of production, Musical Amoeba presented four concerts, with three different ensembles and with music ranging from Baroque to World Premieres. Musical Amoeba was founded by composer/clarinetist William Wheeler, and features young performers and composers. Different ensembles are invited to participate on each concert, and are allowed to curate a large part of the program, which leads to each concert covering a wide variety of music.

So far, Musical Amoeba has presented with the Washington Square Winds, the Samadi-Keene piano/guitar duo, and the newly formed quartet STRIA. 

As the campaign is now closed for funding, please go to www.musicalamoeba.com for more information, or read on below to hear about this season.


The Lineup for 2014-'15?



Musical Amoeba's Season Opening Gala
w/ High Five quintet and STRIA
October 26th, 2014, 5:00 PM
Nuyorican Poet's Cafe
236 E 3rd St, New York, NY 10039
Tickets:  15$/10$ Students

Join composer/pianist Jesse Elder's quintet High Five and Musical Amoeba's quartet STRIA for jam packed evening of great music, including the premiere of Musical Amoeba's 2014 commission Howie Kenty, celebrating the first full season of Musical Amoeba.
 www.jesseeldermusic.com
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wTur6I5dzRI


Musical Amoeba presents The American Voice
December 18th, 2014
Christ and St Stephen's Church, 8:30 PM
122 W 69th St, New York, NY 10023
Tickets: 10$

Join Musical Amoeba for a night of vocal music, featuring Amelia Lubrano, soprano, Jeremy Chan, piano and William Wheeler, clarinet. Premieres by local composer Bruce Saylor, along with works by John White, Dominick Argento, William Wheeler, and more.



Musical Amoeba presents New Guitar Sounds

w/ the Samadi-Keene Duo

February 7th, 2014, 6:00 PM

OPERA America, 

330 Seventh Ave, 7th Floor

New York, NY, 10001

Tickets: 10$

The Samadi-Keene duo returns to Musical Amoeba's lineup to present a night of new music featuring guitar. Performance to include compositions selected from the 2014 Call for Scores, along with works by Darius Milhaud and William Wheeler.

http://www.enceladusensemble.com/home


W/ Daniel Keene, Guitar 
Kristin Samadi, Piano 
Lauren Wuerth, Flute 
Karen Kupferberg, Oboe 
William Wheeler, Clarinet



Musical Amoeba's Throwback Night

w/ Sunny Knable, composer/pianist

Date and Time to be announced. (Mid - March)


Musical Amoeba gets back to its roots, presenting a concert by performer/composers William Wheeler and Sunny Knable, with friends. Come join us for this hour long concert, featuring music by Jennifer Jolley, Rain Worthington, Knable, Wheeler, and others.

http://www.sunnyknablecomposer.com



Musical Amoeba's New Quartet and STRIA

Date and time to be announced. (April)


Musical Amoeba presents a new quartet consisting of Bassoon,  Bass Clarinet, Cello, and Horn. William Wheeler's first concert length piece, Variations in a Garden, is to be premiered, as well as works by many others. 



Musical Amoeba's Closing Gala

featuring the Cadillac Moon Ensemble

Date and time to be announced. (Late May-June)


Musical Amoeba's final concert features the innovative quartet Cadillac Moon Ensemble, playing music by a variety of today's composers. An additional guest ensemble will make an appearance on this concert, to be announced. Come join us in the celebration of a successful year. 

http://www.cadillacmoonensemble.com


Thank you all so much for your support, and consider following us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/musicalamoeba. You can also sign up for the mailing list by contacting musicalamoeba@gmail.com with your inquiry and stay up to date on the latest news.
story_txt:
What is Musical Amoeba?

Innovative, unique, eclectic - a new chamber music series has emerged from the primordial ooze of New York and is ready to take it's show to new and bigger audiences. Musical Amoeba is New York's newest music series, a concert series whose goal is presenting contemporary classical juxtaposed with the historical foundations that inspired it. 

In it's first year of production, Musical Amoeba presented four concerts, with three different ensembles and with music ranging from Baroque to World Premieres. Musical Amoeba was founded by composer/clarinetist William Wheeler, and features young performers and composers. Different ensembles are invited to participate on each concert, and are allowed to curate a large part of the program, which leads to each concert covering a wide variety of music.

So far, Musical Amoeba has presented with the Washington Square Winds, the Samadi-Keene piano/guitar duo, and the newly formed quartet STRIA. 

As the campaign is now closed for funding, please go to www.musicalamoeba.com for more information, or read on below to hear about this season.   

The Lineup for 2014-'15?


Musical Amoeba's Season Opening Gala
w/ High Five quintet and STRIA
October 26th, 2014, 5:00 PM

Nuyorican Poet's Cafe
236 E 3rd St, New York, NY 10039
Tickets:  15$/10$ Students

Join composer/pianist Jesse Elder's quintet High Five and Musical Amoeba's quartet STRIA for jam packed evening of great music, including the premiere of Musical Amoeba's 2014 commission Howie Kenty, celebrating the first full season of Musical Amoeba.
 www.jesseeldermusic.com


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wTur6I5dzRI



Musical Amoeba presents The American Voice
December 18th, 2014
Christ and St Stephen's Church, 8:30 PM
122 W 69th St, New York, NY 10023
Tickets: 10$


Join Musical Amoeba for a night of vocal music, featuring Amelia Lubrano, soprano, Jeremy Chan, piano and William Wheeler, clarinet. Premieres by local composer Bruce Saylor, along with works by John White, Dominick Argento, William Wheeler, and more.


Musical Amoeba presents New Guitar Sounds
w/ the Samadi-Keene Duo
February 7th, 2014, 6:00 PM
OPERA America, 
330 Seventh Ave, 7th Floor
New York, NY, 10001Tickets: 10$




The Samadi-Keene duo returns to Musical Amoeba's lineup to present a night of new music featuring guitar. Performance to include compositions selected from the 2014 Call for Scores, along with works by Darius Milhaud and William Wheeler.
http://www.enceladusensemble.com/home

W/ Daniel Keene, Guitar Kristin Samadi, Piano Lauren Wuerth, Flute Karen Kupferberg, Oboe William Wheeler, Clarinet


Musical Amoeba's Throwback Night
w/ Sunny Knable, composer/pianist
Date and Time to be announced. (Mid - March)

Musical Amoeba gets back to its roots, presenting a concert by performer/composers William Wheeler and Sunny Knable, with friends. Come join us for this hour long concert, featuring music by Jennifer Jolley, Rain Worthington, Knable, Wheeler, and others.
http://www.sunnyknablecomposer.com


Musical Amoeba's New Quartet and STRIA
Date and time to be announced. (April)

Musical Amoeba presents a new quartet consisting of Bassoon,  Bass Clarinet, Cello, and Horn. William Wheeler's first concert length piece, Variations in a Garden, is to be premiered, as well as works by many others. 


Musical Amoeba's Closing Gala
featuring the Cadillac Moon Ensemble
Date and time to be announced. (Late May-June)

Musical Amoeba's final concert features the innovative quartet Cadillac Moon Ensemble, playing music by a variety of today's composers. An additional guest ensemble will make an appearance on this concert, to be announced. Come join us in the celebration of a successful year. 
http://www.cadillacmoonensemble.com




Thank you all so much for your support, and consider following us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/musicalamoeba. You can also sign up for the mailing list by contacting musicalamoeba@gmail.com with your inquiry and stay up to date on the latest news.

story:
Thursday, September 4, 2014, in Jackson, Mississippi at Duling Hall marks Soul Sonic Rotation's premiere, a first of a kind concept in Mississippi and maybe the world. 

Soul Sonic Rotation is a night of non-stop live band performances of various genres of music.
Soul Sonic Rotation is eclectic audiences.
Soul Sonic Rotation is raising the level of music consciousness.                                 Soul Sonic Rotation is hit song, after hit song, after hit song; the evening will play out like a jukebox.

I am reaching out to you via Indiegogo to request your help with this wonderful event. Recently financial backers for Soul Sonic Rotation canceled, leaving me in a serious bind with musicians and venue owners already committed to the event.  I need you to donate whatever you can towards my goal - $1,000.00.  This money will cover artists' and venue fees and promotional costs.

I am adamant about the presentation of Soul Sonic Rotation for several reasons, the main reasons being audiences are offered an opportunity to enjoy a variety of music at one event and independent musicians are given a platform on which to gain greater exposure and be paid fairly for it.

Often independent artists are prevented from committing solely to their craft due to the pennies they receive in exchange for their performances. Soul Sonic Rotation aims to implement positive change, especially regarding financial compensation. I hope you will support this concept with donations and your presence, when possible.

It is music conscious people like you who elevate the voice of independent musicians.  Thank you.

story:
MARCH 16, 2015: It is with deep gratitude that I announce that Maiden of Midnight will be released this Sunday, March 22nd, 2015.  I couldn't have done it without the amazing support of my Indiegogo community ~ thank you all so much!  The album is available as a pre-order on my website and on bandcamp, and soon will be available on iTunes and through other distributors as well (though direct support of the artist is always best!)

If you're just arriving here, welcome to read on if you're interested to know about the backstory of the album and the campaign that pushed it over the brink...

NOVEMBER 18, 2014: Thousands of gypsy miles later, my debut album stands on the threshold of completion! I have arrived in Los Angeles and am in the studio with Tina Malia in final mixing! The artwork is designed, the last grace-notes recorded, and I am excited and ready to let this out into the world! But in order to do that, I need to clear one final financial hump ~ or as I've been saying, like any good birth this just needs one final push!

And that's where you come in...  I ran the initial fundraiser for this album exactly two years ago ~ and though very successful, I knew we would need more funding when the time came to finish it.  Since then I've toured significantly, meeting many new friends and fans ~ so I simply wanted to offer the same perks I did back then for those who didn't get to partake the first time.  Oh yes, and there's a couple extra goodies you might notice in the perk-list for you longtime supporters and super-fans... ;-)  Additionally, take note that the Pre-release is an Exclusive Fan-Release ONLY! The public release will be a month later ~ so in order to assure that you don't have to wait, this is the best way to pre-order your album!

Oh yeah, and did I mention that the album is simply beautiful, danceable, sensuous, entrancing, and somewhat spicy and fun?!  The musicians and producers who have lent their masterful touch have been impeccable and inspiring ~ this has been a hugely collective effort, and it shines with the vibrancy of my virtuosic musical tribe ~ not to mention the power-packed team of advisors and supporters (and yes, that includes YOU!).  I love these people and couldn't have done it without them... 

Scroll down to read about the musicians, the instruments, the songs themselves..., and help me bring this beautiful, mystical album to completion and into your hearts and hands! 

I am SO EXCITED to share this beautiful music with you!

These musicians, producers, arrangers, and advisors have been both invaluable and a tremendous joy to work with:

  • TINA MALIA ~ Co-producer/arranger/mix-artist extraordinaire! A stunning singer, composer, multi-instrumentalist, and producer, I have been deeply honored to work with Tina for the last two years on this album. 
  • JESSE MANNO ~ As co-producer, master multi-instrumentalist, and composer, Jesse is pure joy and wild fun to work with. On Turkish baglama and cura saz, oud, drumkit, percussion, flute, and string arrangements, you'll hear his sultry, sinuous, and spicy grace-notes all over this album... 
  • JAMES HOSKINS ~ The last and perhaps most evocative musician to be recorded, James has lent his unearthly cello on several pieces. James' playing goes straight to the heart, sending it to the stars. 
  • WADE EVANS ~ The rumours are true: Wade Evans is a superhuman instrumentalist! By a fluke of travel and holiday schedules, all his recording got crammed into one day, and we recorded all his classical guitar and oud in one 18 hour stretch at Immersive Studios. He plays on every song, and beautifully! 
  • SCOTT BEARS Scott has been one of my most dedicated musicians for several years now, and it tickles me beyond belief to have gotten him back to his roots: rockin out on electric guitar. 
  • AHARON BOLSTA ~ Groove-meister #1, Aharon plays impeccable drumkit, spirited Indian tabla, and vivacious Mideast doumbek. 
  • DAVID ALDERDICE ~ Groove-meister #2, David lends his soulful drumkit grooves on a number of songs. 
  • JARED MAY ~ Slinky, deep, and soulful, Jared May on bass brings the heavens down to earth and keeps our hips in play. 
  • TIERRO LEE ~ This fine gentleman, engineer, and producer was at the helm in the very beginning, and it is due to his impeccable touch that the foundation of this album is so solid and clear. 
  • MEAGAN CHANDLER ~ Meagan lends her shimmering high-notes and spicy flamenco palmas on a couple songs, and has been by my [often virtual] side every step of the way, advising me on the arrangements, instruments, artwork, and every matter of the heart (producing an album is an emotional and spiritual journey as well as an artistic one!). 
  • TIM GENNERT ~ Three-time Grammy nominee mastering engineer, Tim has some of the best ears in the business, and is lending them toward the final polishing touch of mastering.
  • And also thanks to: ADRIENNE SHORT ~ Violin, JENNA WOODS ~ Finger cymbals, and CHARLIE PARKER & DIK DARNELL ~ Additional recording engineering. This has truly been a community endeavor, and I'm so happy for all the wonderful folks involved.
  • TOM HAST ~ This man has harbored me, encouraged me, and asked all the best challenging questions at all the right times. My work has been honed and uplifted in the fires of his friendship. 
  • BRENT 'HAFIZ' MATHIEU ~ We couldn't have done anything without Brent's belief and support. He kickstarted the project, and has championed it every step of the way! 
  • GUILLAUME 'WILDCAT' ~ Not many photographers would come out on the ocean cliffs with me in a freezing cold windstorm to shoot the cover art - it takes a fearless and adventuresome soul to follow my wild whims - but Guillaume was up to the task!
  • YOU!! ~ Dearhearts ~ this project is alive entirely because you've championed it! I couldn't have done this without your support, and it is my hope it gives back a hundredfold with its medicine... 

I've created this album because I believe these songs hold important keys to unlocking and healing our human hearts. The lyrics, melodies, and instrumentation evoke reminders of the oft-forgotten deeper and mystical sides of life, the deep well from which Soul is drawn. Additionally, in working with elements and instruments from traditional music from around the world, it is my hope to both honor the gifts of our many human heritages, and help weave a richly textured future that draws upon the wealth of these very roots.

These are the songs that make my heart sing, that I have been yearning to share with you in their fully-formed state for years!  I am so grateful to have finally been able to do this work... 

  • MAIDEN OF MIDNIGHT ~ The title track, this song has a decidedly Celtic feel, and is a prayer for all our "journeys home." "Ancient Woman, Maiden of Midnight, sing us your mystery song / And gypsy dancer, of the fire and moonlight, won't you bring us along / On your way, on your way home..." 
  • THE WIND ~ An ethereal rock song. "And I sent the god of thunder / To break the stormy night / But still the darkness gathers / So close your eyes / I'll be your sight..." 
  • DANCE OF THE STARS ~ To free our gypsy spirits! Sing and dance along to this Turkish-inspired festive piece... "Ride the sky... a light... on fire!"
  • DESERT BLOOMS ~ A beautiful and graceful fusion of Celtic and Indian musical elements, with even a touch of classic rock, the prayer is that we return to right-relation with the earth, and find soulful freedom in our hearts. "And we are wild as the wind, as we caress the earth and sky / And we are lovers of this land, and love is all that's left in time..." 
  • PHOENIX ~ A raucous and incisive Mideast-inspired rhythmic song that asks us to live boldly! "If you were to fall, finally surrender, who would you be now?" 
  • LA ROSA ENFLORECE ~ A heart-wrenching Sephardic love song with Spanish and Mideast Flavorings. "The nightingales are singing, sighs of love..."
  • KALI'S ARMY ~ With this song we enter the cauldron of transformation, that we may be freed from the binds that constrict us, into the wild grace of the sweet mystery... "And I'm bound in this garden...is watered with tears / Turn back ye demons, I've conquered your fears!" 
  • INTO THE VOID ~ Letting go, we surrender to the unknown. This song is an exotic dive into the mystic ocean... "Into the void I travel / Into the shadows I fall / Into the silent thunder / Into nothing, and all..."
  • RAVEN ~ Uplifting, playful and rhythmic, this song celebrates the rich freedom that comes with letting go. Having known both darkness and light, we find the joy within both, surrendering to fly free... "Essence of blackness / Silence of night / Stillness embodied, fall into flight, fall into flight..."
  • ESPERANZA ~ A Spanish-inspired original song with fusion elements from the Celts to the Mideast... "Respira la Esperanza, con la fuerza del espiritu..." May our spirits be strong as we breathe in...
  • ANGELFIRE ~ Accompanied by the shimmering sounds of the cura saz, the album ends on a celestial and dreamy note... "Black waves of night pour through me / Stars of the ocean, tumbling sky..."

Studio work takes an immense amount of time, and is often far beyond a musician's budget. I have been grateful for all the help I've received in making this album manifest. This particular campaign didn't cover all the funds (I've privately fund-raised and taken out loans as well), but it did make a huge difference! Just to give you a sense of the kinds of fees involved, here's a breakdown of merely the final stages of the album (keeping in mind that we already spent $14,000 prior to this on studio, musician, and editing fees):

  • $6500 Mixing - of the final-stretch, this is the most crucial and time-consuming.  I was in the studio with Tina Malia for a month and a half from Nov-Dec working hard day in and day out to dial in the soundscape of this album.
  • $1000 Mastering - the finishing touch: without high quality mastering, no album is complete. I like to say it's like polishing a gem: while in mixing you make sure the cuts are just right, you still have to polish it...
  • $1550 Printing - I've created beautiful artwork - including a lyric booklet! - and we're printing in the most sustainable and economical way possible.

Of course any additional funds will be put to good use: next up I'm working to raise $2000 for a Publicity Release. I have been dialoguing with a respected PR firm and hope to partner them to get my work out to the larger global audience!

A lot of you already contributed to this album 2 years ago, which I'm deeply grateful for ~ you're already a part of the team! And I know you're eager to finally get your copy of this album ~ so help me complete it by building the buzz: check out the indiegogo share tools above, tell your friends, and help me celebrate its imminent release by sharing in my enthusiasm! And of course, check out the perk-list to the right, as I have added some new goodies that you might be interested in...

Ariana is a visual artist, as well as a musician and lyricist ~ she has created three photo-quality 8.5x11 prints of her original art merged with her lyrics ~ see the new perk on the right, "Lyrical Angel"
